loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is the age of 41. She is the mother of three children. Kaneez lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband works in dairy products like milk, curd and butter for sale. He owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earnings from milk sales. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. Kaneez's husband is in need of a buffalo to increase his income through his milk sales business so Kaneez requested a loan. In this way, she can support her husband's business. She thanks Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milk sale business.

loans.name: Shahid

texts.en:
Shahid is a 38-year-old married man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan along with his family. He is the father of three sons and two daughters. He owns a chicken sales shop in the market. He has been running his chicken shop for the last 10 years. Shahid buys chickens from the wholesaler and sells them in his shop to the customers. His number of clients increases due to his good attitude towards his clients. Shahid is the sole earner of his family, so he wants to increase his income. In this way he would be able to meet his family's requirements. He is a very honest shop keeper. He behaves politely to people. 

Shahid wants to buy broilers to sell at his chicken shop to improve his living standard. For the development of his business, he needs a loan. So he made contact to BRAC Pakistan who issued him a loan for his chicken sale shop. Shahid is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for his chicken sales shop.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing jack machine services to remove raw materials from old buildings and for road construction purposes for the last ten years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Shehnaz's husband needs to buy a new jack machine because the condition of his current jack machine is not good. Therefore Shehnaz has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Shehnaz's husband can afford a new jack machine. In this way he can provide better services to earn a profitable income. Shehnaz also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new jack machine

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.en: Fazilat is a 52-year-old, married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children; her husband is an old man and stays idle at home. Fazilat runs a small clothing business at home. She sells clothing at very reasonable rates. She purchases clothing from a nearby market at low prices and then sells them for a high price in her community. The ladies of town like her clothing collection and selections a lot. The demand for clothing has increased due to attractive colors.  She wants to increase the variety of clothing to cope with the increase of demand on a daily basis. This is the reason she has requested a loan, so that she can buy more varieties of clothing to fulfill the demand. Fazilat has a wish for the secure future for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: M.shafiq

texts.en: M.Shafiq is a 35-year-old, married and energetic man, living with his spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a general store in which he sells shampoo, bath soaps, detergents, biscuits, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store as well. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stocks to cope with the demand. To cope with the demand of his customers, he wants to buy more stocks for his store, but he does not have a sufficient amount to buy more stocks. Therefore, M.Shafiq has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy more stocks of shampoo, bath soaps, detergents, biscuits, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for his general store. He hopes that lenders will support him, and that this loan will prove productive for his business as well. He is very impressed with the Kiva loan cycle system; he is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of shampoo, bath soaps, detergents, biscuits, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for his general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a photovoltaic system.

loans.name: Mughal Masih

texts.en:
Mughal Masih is a very hard-working and active borrower with Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. He is 46 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with his family. His family includes a decent and responsible housewife, four sons, and three daughters. He owns a small clothing shop, in which he sells old and used clothes. He collects used clothes from different areas, and makes differently-designed, useful items for selling, such as ladies' dresses, curtains, and pillow covers. He has been running this business for ten years and cherishing his whole family. He speaks with monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relationships with his customers. Due to good relationships, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand.

With the increase in demand he considers it necessary to grow the business. But the lack of capital is the major problem for him. Therefore, Mughal Masih took a loan for his business. With the help of this loan, he will purchase more clothes for his business. Mughal Masih thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 30 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chicalyo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de construcción civil, desempeñándose como maestro de obras en la construcción de viviendas y por las tardes brinda servicio de transporte público en una mototaxi, Luis es trabajqador se esfuerza para lograr una mejor calidad de vida.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de neumaticos y aceite para su mototaxi que le permitirá trabajar trasladando a sus pasajeros a zonas aledañas a su distrito y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 30 years old, her lives in the district of Cayaltí, a community which operates in agriculture, commerce and cattle, located in the Province of Chicalyo which belongs to the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru.

He offers services in civil construction, acting as a master builder of homes and in the afternoon, he offers services in public transportation in his motorcycle taxi. Luis is hard working; he makes every effort to obtain a better quality of life.

Luis is seeking a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy tires and oil for his motorcycle taxi which will enable him to work, carrying passengers from neighboring areas to his districts, and in this manner, generate larger profits to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and oil for his motorcycle-taxi.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: Carlos es un humilde vendedor ubicado cerca a la iglesia del pueblo, padre de un hijo de 13 años de edad partió con la esperanza de encontrar un estilo de vida sostenible para él y su familia. Comenzó con un pequeño capital de trabajo que gracias a sus ventas y su buena ubicación fueron creciendo hasta tener un empleo sostenible con el que puede cubrir los gastos familiares. Solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía, como gomas de mascar, cigarrillos, bebidas, frituras para abarcar un evento especial que se realiza anualmente en su región y el cual es muy visitado. Con este crédito podrá tener los insumos suficientes para abarcar la demanda de productos que habrá en el evento generándole ingresos y ganancias con las cuales piensa ampliar su negocio ofreciendo otra variedad de productos pero todo depende del éxito de este evento
texts.en:
Carlos is a humble vendor located near the church of the town, and father of a child of 13 years. He left the hope of finding a sustainable lifestyle for him and his family. He started with a small amount of working capital. Thanks to his sales and good location, he grew until he had sustainable employment with which he could cover the family expenses.

He is applying for a loan for the purchase of merchandise, like chewing gum, cigars, drinks, and fried snacks to accommodate a special event that is carried out annually in his region and which is very visited. With this loan, he will be able to have the sufficient supplies for meeting the demand of the products that will be in the event, generating income and revenue for him. With this, he plans to grow his business, offering more variety of products but everything depends on the success of this event.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like drinks, cigarettes, fried snacks to cater a special event that will occur in his area.

loans.name: Khuram Rasheed

texts.en:
Khuram Rasheed is the age of 26, and he lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is unmarried and living with his parents. He is a very hard-working and gentle person. He owns a small restaurant, in which he offers delicious foods two times in a day. He has been running this restaurant for four years and earning good profits from his restaurant business. He offers tea to his customers, also. Through this business of restaurant, he supports his parents financially. Now he wants to establish his restaurant better, by purchasing new equipment, including plastic furniture, utensils, a cauldron, etc. Due to household expenses, his savings are not enough to buy the desired things.

Therefore, Khuram Rasheed requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. He will use the loan to buy plastic furniture, utensils, a cauldron, etc. In this way, he would be able to enhance his restaurant business. He thanks Kiva and appreciates their warm support to him.

loans.use: to purchase new plastic furniture, utensils, a cauldron, etc., for his restaurant.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 35-year-old, married woman. She has been doing embroidery by machine, at home, for the past five years, to support her family. In fact her husband is also doing the same work at home, but he earns an insufficient income to support their family. So she helps her husband in his tasks related to the embroidery. Also she sells embroidered dresses in her town. By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She has become expert in embroidery by machine. She wants more raw materials for embroidery, so that she could easily cope with the increasing demand for her art.

She is a mother of two sons and four daughters. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to use a portion of her revenue to provide a quality education for her children. Parveen thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for embroidery

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl tiene 56 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer  grado, está casado y tiene cinco  hijos, su esposa es ama de casa, es gente muy humilde y trabajadora,  ella es la que se encarga de las labores del hogar, tienen gallinas y  le ayuda con el ordeño del ganado a su esposo, solo dos están estudiando y los demás le apoyan a don Raúl en los trabajos.

Él es comerciante de ganado, compra y vende, y cuando el negocio no está del todo bien se dedica a la agricultura tiene más de 30 años de realizar la actividad, su padre desde pequeño le enseñó que la vida solo se vivía bien, cuando se respeta y se hace respetar como persona que es. Es así como ha logrado hasta este día el poder salir adelante: ordeña 4 vacas las que le producen cuajada y leche, con lo que tiene el sustento de la casa un poco seguro, la distancia que recorre es variable ya que no siempre va al mismo lugar, cuando saca la cosecha una parte la vende y lo demás para el gasto,  el trabajo lo hace por la mañana de 6:00 am a 12:00 md. Y por la tarde se dedica al negocio del ganado.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar ganado de repasto, para luego venderlo, y con esto genera un ingreso a su hogar, con lo que mejorara sus activos  y podrá ampliar la producción y tendrá más posibilidades para sus hijos que sigan estudiando.

Sus sueños son que sus hijos se preparen en la educación y  poderlos sacar adelante por medio del sacrificio  que incurre tener hijos estudiando, espera que su hijos se preparen para que un día le ayuden  en su vejez, todo esto lo logra con la bendición de Dios y su esfuerzo. Las ganancias del comercio será invertido en el pago de la cuota y en seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Raúl, 56, studied until third grade. He is married and has five children. His wife is a housewife. They are very humble and hardworking people. She is the one who is in charge of the duties of the home. They have hens and he helps her husband with milking the cows. Only two are studying and the rest support Raúl with the work.

He is a cattle trader; he buys and sells. When the business isn't so good he works in agriculture. He has been doing this activity for more than 30 years; when he was little, his father taught him that life is only lived well when one is respectful and is respected as the person that he is. Because of this, he has achieved being able to get ahead up to today: he milks 4 cows that produce cheese and milk, with which he has secured the livelihood of the house a little. The distance he travels is variable since he does not always go to the same place. When he takes in the harvest, he sells one part and the rest is for consumption. He works in the morning from 6:00 AM to 12:00 noon. In the afternoon he works with the cattle business.

He needs the loan to buy cattle for grazing, to sell it later. With this, he will generate income for his home, with which he will improve his assets and will be able to grow production. He will have more possibilities for his children who continue studying.

His dreams are that his children prepare themselves in education and that he can get them ahead by means of the sacrifice that having children in school incurs. He hopes that his children prepare themselves so that one day they help him in his old age. He will achieve all of this with the blessing of God and his strength. The profits of the business will be invested in the payment of the installments and to continue working.

loans.use: to buy cattle for grazing.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 32-year-old, married women, and a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for the last 20 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Sobia’s husband needs to make maintenance on his vehicle, because the current condition of his vehicle is not good. It requires some maintenance charges to repair his taxi car. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make maintenance of his vehicle. Therefore Sobia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Sobia’s husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. In this way he can provide the better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Sobia also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Sobia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for maintainance repairs for her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is the age of 51, a mother of five children, and living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a fruit seller by profession; he has sold fresh fruits at a shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his own family also through the generated income from this business. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So, he decided to expand his current business by full seasonal fruits. He wants to increase his stocks on a daily basis, so that he can maximize sales of the fruits. Therefore, Rani has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy excess seasonal fruits. Rani thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son to buy fruits for his fruit selling business.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing some money became short. Therefore, Shakeela has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of their savings.  She had received a loan in the past but she could not buy a rickshaw for him due to household expenses.  This time, she will successfully buy the new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.

Shakeela is a 28-year-old woman living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She hopes that this time her husband can easily generate sufficient income for cherishing his children and could pay all the installments on time. She is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Norma, hace cinco años por iniciativa propia y apoyo de su esposo fundo una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, ya cuenta con muchos clientes, trabaja todos los días, en un horario de 6:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., vive con dos hijos de 22 y 18 años de edad.
Invertirá en la compra de arroz, aceite, huevos, frijoles, harina, bebidas, azúcar, sal, etc., con estos materiales tendrá más potencial en su negocio y sus nuevos ingresos le permitirán mantener el sustento diario de su familia.
Su aspiración es mantener funcionando su negocio para lograr tener una mejor estabilidad económica, con la que cancelara sus deudas y mejorara el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Five years ago Norma, by her own initiative and the support of her husband, founded a store of staple food products. She already has many customers. She works every day, on a schedule from 6:00 AM to 5:00 PM. She lives with two children of 22 and 18 years of age.

She will invest in the purchase of rice, oil, eggs, beans, flour, drinks, sugar, salt, etc. With these materials, she will have more potential in her business and her new income will allow her to maintain the daily subsistence of the family.

Her aspiration is to keep the business functioning to achieve having more economic stability, with which she will pay off her debts and improve the family lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, eggs, beans, flour, drinks, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Claudia Melissa

texts.es:
Claudia vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, trabaja como cajera en una institución de su ciudad, lo cual le permite poder tener ingresos para poder salir adelante y6 poder apoyara a su familia con algunos gastos del hogar.

Claudia esta agradecida con los prestamisats kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada ella podrá realizar mejoras en la habitación donde vive, asimismo podrá solventar algunos gastos personales, de esta manera mejorar las condiciones en las que vivie y seguira trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un negocio propio y ser una gran empresaria”.
texts.en:
Claudia lives in the city of Pucallpa. She works as a cashier in an institution of her city, which allows her to have income to be able to get ahead and to support her family with some of the expenses of the home.

Claudia is thankful for the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help given, she will be able to make improvements in the room where she lives. Also, she will be able to cover some personal expenses. In this manner, she will improve her living conditions and will continue working and fighting to make her great dream a reality: "having her own business and being a great entrepreneur."

loans.use: to improve her home and personal expenses.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Here is Razia, from Pakistan! She is married and has six children. She has requested a loan for her husband; he conducts a food stall, for offering food to the common people of his area at evening. He has been changing his menu from time-to-time, according to the weather, climate and taste. Nowadays he wants to offer burgers; for this reason he is in more need of eggs, spices, oil, onion, cauliflower and tomato ketchup. Earlier he was selling Alu Chat (Pakistani food), which is cheaper than burgers. He does not have enough cash in hand to buy ingredients for offering the next menu items.

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband will be able easily to buy the described ingredients.

Razia is the age of 58, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making burgers, to sell at the food stall

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
Suriya is a 53-year-old lady living with her six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She owns a small general store at home as she has allotted a portion of her house for the general store. One of her drawing rooms opens through the front side onto the street and she is utilizing that room for a general store. She offers miscellaneous items which are consumed in houses on a daily basis such as rice, flour, pulses, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits.

She has been running this business for many years and this is the major source of income for her family because her husband earnings are very poor. Now she wants to grow her business in increments for the needs of her family, so she decided to grow her business and contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

She will buy rice, flour, pulses, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits.  She hopes that her general store will work better than before. She has praise for this cooperation and thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as rice, flour, pulses, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits

loans.name: Nafeesa

texts.en:
Nafeesa is a 44-year-old married woman. 

She has been knitting embroidery by hand at home for many years to support her family. In fact, her husband remains jobless most of the time. For the sake of her children and to meet household expenses, she started doing embroidery at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides her with all the raw materials for knitting embroidery, and she completes her tasks over a wooden frame. She wants to sell knitted embroidery directly into the market so that she can earn more profit for her family. She has become expert in her art and wants to buy raw material on her own so that she can sell her handmade embroidery in her hometown.

Therefore, Nafeesa has requested a loan to buy raw material so she can knit more embroidered dresses to sell and could generate maximum income. 
She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of her revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw material for embroidery

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila’s son has been driving an auto rickshaw. He pays daily rent, because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra-poor family and has been feeding his own children as well. Now his children are growing older, and their needs grow, as well. He was worried for many days about how to stop having to pay the daily rent, so he decided to buy his own rickshaw.

Jamila has been making savings for many days, to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, but at the time of purchasing some money was short. Therefore, Jamila has requested a loan for her son so that he can buy a rickshaw with the contribution of savings. She hopes that now her son does not have any need to pay daily rent, which was the cause of an increase in expenditures.

Jamila is a 48-year-old woman, living with her five children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She hopes that now her son will be able to earn more income, because now he will not pay daily rent to anyone. She is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw for her son, with the contribution of savings.

loans.name: Bilal Ashraf

texts.en: Bilal Ashraf is a 34-year-old married person, and a father of four children. He is living happily with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a metal turner by profession and he works over a lathe machine. He manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motorcars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of vehicles' engines, turbines and radiators. He has been doing this business for ten years and until this time, his business has been stable. Due to continuously working over lathe machine, some of the machine's important parts have been tearing off, and urgently needs to be replaced. Without the replacement of affected parts, the whole lathe machine mechanism is affected. He does not have a sufficient amount to buy spare parts to fix the problem of his lathe machine and could buy cutting tools. Therefore, Bilal Ashraf requested a loan so that he would be able to cover the cost of repairing his lathe machine. He is very thankful to the Kiva and Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing his lathe machine.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana is a 32-year-old married woman, living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Shabana belongs to a very poor family and has been feeding her two children. There is only a single person earning income and contributing to support household expenses. Shabana has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband but the savings are mostly spent on household expenses. Now she wants to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but she does not have enough cash in hand to buy one. Therefore, Shabana has requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy a new rickshaw with some contribution from their savings. She hopes that he will drive the auto rickshaw with his full devotion and earn sufficient income.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Rafia's Group

texts.en:
Rafia is a 46-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family.  She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health expenses.

Her husband has been running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. He also assists his younger son by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years.

Rafia wants to grow the business of her husband so she has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner's BRAC Pakistan so he can buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan and she is in her eighth loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for the general store

loans.name: Abdul Razzaq

texts.en: Abdul Razzaq is a 39-year-old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of four sons and three daughters. Abdul Razzaq has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so he can buy gent’s shoes for his shoe shop. He has been making and selling shoes for seventeen years. He has been making and selling ladies fancy, kids shoes and casual shoes in his hometown. Most of his customers demand gent’s shoes as well, but due to lack of available funds he cannot purchase gent’s shoes.  Therefore, he has requested a loan so that he can buy a variety of gent’s shoes for resale. In this way he can easily cope with the demand and abstain from the customers’ disappointment.  His shop is situated in the shoe market and lot of others shoe shops are available there which is the cause of tough competition. He dreams to move his shop to another place to abstain from the competitors. Through the investment of this current loan, he can easily establish his shop and can enhance his savings so his dream can come true. Abdul Razzaq thanks Kiva, honorable lenders, and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of gent’s shoes for resale.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 38-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children.

Her husband is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and he manufactures and renews spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles, renews the turbines and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and until this time his business has been very settled.

Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some of the important parts have been tearing off and are urgently needing to be replaced. Without the replacement of affected parts, it is it highly affecting the whole mechanism of the lathe machine.

Her husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy spare parts to fix the problem of the lathe machine and to buy cutting tools. Therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy spare parts for his lathe machine.  Abida hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to fix a lathe machine

loans.name: Sampa

texts.en:
Sampa is 39: a young, energetic, enthusiastic and optimistic woman. She is from the remote village of Petkati in Jalpaiguri district. She is married to Tapan, who is now 51 years old and has a secondary education. Sampa studied till grade 7. Sampa, together with her husband, is raising one son, who is a student in grade 10.

Sampa's husband is engaged in a small business, but he is unable to cover the basic needs of his family as well as the educational costs of their son with his small income. Sampa decided to help her family to bring good well-being to the family. She is an enterprising woman who wants to do a business of selling Ayurveda medicine (medicine made from medicinal plants and herbs). She thinks it is a profitable business. She learned about Ayurveda medicine from her ancestor; she belongs to a family of Ayurveda specialists.

Sampa is requesting this loan to purchase Ayurveda medicines from the medicine wholesalers and initially start the business from her house. With the development of the business, she hopes to rent a shop in the local market. She hopes the loan will enable her to fulfill her dream. Her dream is to expand her business in order to give her son a better education in a better school.

Sampa is really grateful to the lenders, Belghoria Janakalyan Samity and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase Ayurveda medicines (medicine made from different medicinal herbs) to start a business.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 35-year-old married woman and she is responsible for three children. Her husband has been running a tailoring shop for eight years, and he is the only person responsible for the household. Uzma has applied for Kiva loan from its Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan because her husband wants to purchase pieces of cloth, ribbons, needles, threads, etc. for his business.

This loan will enable her husband to purchase these above items for business use, and it will also be fruitful for Uzma to make some savings in order to fulfill her family's needs. Uzma is very thankful to to Kiva for this kind regard.

loans.use: to purchase pieces of cloth, ribbons, needles, threads, etc. for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Sheikh Waseem

texts.en:
Sheikh Waseem is a 40-year-old married man, and father of two children. He lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan.

Sheikh Waseem owns a bakery and sweets shop in his hometown. He sells a variety of cakes, rusks, milk, biscuits, juices, cold drinks and different kinds of sweets. Earlier, his father ran the sweet shop but due to his old age, Sheikh Waseem looks after all the matters. He purchases the inventory in large quantities from a nearby bakery and general store and sells it at his shop. Now he wants to offer more types of sweets to his customers, but he does not have a sufficient amount to buy these additional sweets. Therefore, Sheikh Waseem requested a loan so that he could buy his desired sweets to sell. He wants to prepare these sweets at his own shop in order to earn maximum income. He will make some savings with the profit and hopes that in the future, he will be able to prepare all the sweets by himself. Sheikh Waseem thanks Kiva and Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of sweets to sell at his bakery and sweets shop.

loans.name: Shanaz

texts.en: Shanaz is a 50-year-old and married woman and she is responsible for seven children. Her husband runs a gold shop and he is the only person who supports his family. Shanaz wants to help her husband's gold shop, which her husband has been running for the last 15 years. Her husband wants to buy some more gold and maintain his shop. Due to insufficient finances, Shanaz is unable to do maintenance on her husband's shop, which is why she applied for a Kiva loan from its Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan. Shanaz is very thankful to kiva for this kind regard.

loans.use: to buy more gold and maintain her husband's gold shop.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN ROQUE” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nelly es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de helado, brostería, tienda de barrio, macramé de mantas, venta de frutas, venta de cosméticos, venta de celulares, compra y venta de ovejas y cerdos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nelly es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de celulares; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con el primer prestamos obtenido por Pro Mujer por incentivo de su esposo que tiene un negocio similar a este.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de celulares por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The San Roque Communal Bank will begin its 5th cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Pan American Regional Office.  It has 9 members, and is managed by a board of directors of which Señora Nelly is president.  The members of the communal bank have various businesses: selling ice-cream, a grill restaurant, a neighborhood store, creating macramé blankets, selling fruit, selling cosmetics, selling cellular phones, and buying and selling pigs.

The loan will benefit the micro entrepreneurs, of whom Señora Nelly is a member.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, at the invitation of her neighbor who is a member of the institution.

Currently, she has a business selling cellular phones. She says that she started her business with the first loans that she received from Pro Mujer, and that she was encouraged by her husband, who has a similar business.

Her current loan will be for increasing capital; she will purchase wholesale cellular phones in the markets of the city of El Alto, and sell them later in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources for supporting her family, as she is married and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit, the health care, and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale cellular phones.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 39 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of eight children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He wants to repair the rickshaw's engine and body. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Robina thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the rickshaw's body and engine

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 43 years old. She is married with four children.  She has been working as a rice farmer for the past eight years. She would like to use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, vive en e distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, arroz y frutales, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, cuenta con clientela como transportistas de las rutas de Jaén –Chiclayo, moradores de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de fruta para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and lives in the Pucara district, a community of hot weather.  Its population is engaged in agriculture, especially the cultivation of coffee, rice and fruit, and raising livestock, and is located in the province of Jaén belonging to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

She sells fruit.  Her business is located in her home.  Her clientele includes truck and bus drivers along the route between Jaén and Chiclayo, and residents of her district.

She has requested a loan of 500 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of more fruit to supply her business and thus generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to supply her business.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 38-year-old woman living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw business for the last year. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of his regular use. Yasmeen's husband decided to replace his auto rickshaw with a new CNG rickshaw because CNG rickshaws are popular in his area. He could earn maximum income by driving a CNG rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new CNG rickshaw. Therefore, Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of a new CNG rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business well. Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband buy a new CNG rickshaw.

loans.name: Fresiane

texts.en:
Fresiane is 35 years old. He is a father of three children, and they all go to school. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 36-year-old married woman living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a butcher by profession; he sells chicken from his shop. His daily practice is to buy broilers from the market and sell them in his shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills, which discouraged his purchasing power for new inventory for his butcher shop. 

Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy broilers to sell from his shop. She dreams to provide all the facilities of life to her children.

loans.use: To buy (chicken) broilers for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the purchase of agricultural supplies to nurture and protect her coffee plants.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding her children. Now her children are growing old and their needs are as well. She has been saving money for many days to buy a new moto rickshaw for her son, but at the time of purchasing she was short some money. 

Therefore, Haleema has requested a loan so she can buy a new moto rickshaw with the contribution of savings. She hopes that now her son can easily generate reasonable income to support his family. 

Haleema is a 58-year-old married woman, living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a moto rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Sabiran

texts.en:
Sabiran is 35 years old and she is a responsible mother living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her second loan with BRAC. She is an old member and she has been taking loans according to the needs of her family.

Sabiran belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to cover all the household expenses with poor earnings. In fact, her husband is a hawker by profession and sells different kinds of hair oils by bicycle. He sells mustard oil, avocado oil, castor oil, coconut oil, olive oil, rosemary oil, safflower oil, etc. He calls in the streets loudly to consumers and offers all these hair oils. He is famous for his oil to protect hair from falling. He wants to buy a large quantity of hair oil to sell for the growth of his business and to overcome poverty. Therefore, Sabiran requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy more hair oil. Sabiran is very impressed with this honorable support. She thanks Kiva and Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy hair oils for her husband to resell.

loans.name: Munaza

texts.en:
Munaza is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring at her home. She has been doing it for the past four years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. She sews garments from nearby factories; her son brings cloth from the factory. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine because her previous sewing machine has become out of order due to continuous work. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

Munaza thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a stitching machine.

loans.name: Candelario José

texts.es:
Candelario José es un joven de 36 años, soltero, que vive al lado de su mamá en el municipio de El Sauce, un poblado ubicado al occidente de Nicaragua.
Se desempeña como Guarda de seguridad desde más de cinco años, actividad que le ha permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y estar pendiente de la salud de su madre bajo su pobreza.
Candelario es un hijo bien portado y abnegado que su madre se siente muy orgullosa de él y da gracias a Dios por haberle dado un buen hijo.
Candelario se siente muy agradecido con Kiva y Ceprodel porque le han otorgado varios créditos que le han ayudado en su desarrollo familiar, ya que ha mejorado la casa de su madre y ha resuelto problemas de salud.
En este momento necesita un crédito para comprar medicamentos, ya que se ha sentido mal de salud y no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para enfrentar esta necesidad.
Solicita a estos inversionistas que le apoyen su solicitud para mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Candelario Jose is a young man of 36 years of age, single, and lives with his mother in the town of El Sauce, a town in western Nicaragua.

He has been working as a security guard for more than five years.  This activity has allowed him to put bread on the table every day and care for the health of his mother in poverty.

Candelario is a well behaved and devoted son.  His mother is very proud of him and thanks God for giving her a good son.

Candelario feels very grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for granting several loans that have helped him and his family.  He has improved his mother's house and addressed her health problems.

They currently need a loan to buy medicine because his mother is in poor health and he does not have the resources to address this need.  He is asking the investors to support their application to improve her health.

loans.use: to purchase medicine.

loans.name: S.rubab

texts.en:
S.Rubab is a 36-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children; her husband does work in a firm for low wages. 

S.Rubab runs a small clothing business at home; she sells clothing at very reasonable rates. She purchased clothing from the market at a low price and then sells it at a high price in her community. The ladies of town like her clothing collection and selection a lot. The demand for her clothing is due to attractive designs and colors. Her husband affords all the household expenses from his earnings, and she contributes her earnings only for savings. 

She wants to increase the variety of clothing on a daily basis; this is the reason she has requested a loan, so that she can buy more variety of clothing to fulfill the demand. S.Rubab wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream to provide better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothing for reselling at home by herself.

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida is 38 years old and she is the mother of five children. Her husband owns an electric shop where he sells electric tube rods, bulbs and energy-saver bulbs of various brands. He provides services to his clients for electric goods also. For the growth of his business and desire to earn maximum profit for his family, he wants to buy more electrical goods.

Therefore, Farida requested a loan from Kiva’s Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy bulbs, tubes and energy savers. In addition, he wants to buy some extra electric switches, bulb holders, sockets, etc. to offer his customers. 

Farida hopes that her husband will be able to grow his business soon. Farida is very thankful to the Kiva and Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more electrical goods for her husband.

loans.name: Anisa

texts.en:
Anisa is a 44-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore Pakistan. She has been sewing cushions for the past several years to support her family. She beautifully sews cushions at home and then sells them in the local market. By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband is an old man; her sons work in a factory, but earn insufficient income to support the family.

She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she has requested a loan to purchase stocks of threads, fancy cloths and polyester. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. 

She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide better facilities for her children.

loans.use: To buy cloth and polyester for filling in cushions.

loans.name: Eder

texts.es:
Eder es soltero, vive en la Ciudad de Lima con sus padres.
Desde hace 1 año viene desempeñándose como costurero y con sus ingresos apoya a su familia.
Es un joven muy trabajador y emprendedor que lucha incansablemente para sacar adelante a sus padres y mejorar su nivel de vida.

Su mayor sueño es “tener un taller de confecciones”.
Gracias a los prestamistas kiva, Eder podrá utilizar el apoyo para comprar una cama y así tener mayor comodidad en su hogar e incrementar su desempeño en el trabajo, adquirir experiencia y más adelante tener su negocio propio.
texts.en:
Eder is single and lives in the city of Lima with his parents.  For the past year, he has been employed at making clothing and supports the family with his income.

He is a very hardworking and enterprising young man struggling tirelessly to take care of his parents and improve their standard of living.

His dream is to have a clothing workshop.

Thanks to the Kiva lenders, Eder will use the loan to buy a bed and thus have greater comfort in his home, increase his performance at work, gain experience and some day have his own business.

loans.use: to purchase a bed to furnish his home.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 30-year-old lady; she is living with her husband and two daughters in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. When she was newly married, her financial condition was very poor because her husband was not a very skillful person to work on the lathe machine. He has been learning the techniques to work on lathe machines from professionals. Now, he came to know how to operate the lathe machine, so that he can carry on his newly started business. Due to his lack of experience, the lathe machine was damaged and needed maintenance.
 
Therefore, Kousar has requested a loan for her husband so he can fulfill the deficiencies of the lathe machine and can buy additional tools, dies, spare parts, etc. Kousar is tension free now because she hopes that her husband will be expert soon and get reasonable income as an expert turner.

Kousar is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy additional tools, dies, spare parts and cutting tools to work on the lathe machine.

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera belongs to a poor family, and is living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a blacksmith; he manufactures iron accessories for doors and windows used in houses. He has been providing door-to-door services to weld the broken accessories.

A few days ago, his welding machine became out of order due to overheating and needed to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy a new welding machine, but he does not have money due to a lot of household expenses. Therefore, Sumera has requested a loan from BRAC, which is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy the welding machine for manufacturing.  

Sumera thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine for manufacturing.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 60 años de edad, vive solo, en casa propia en el Centro Poblado El Cumbe, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará cuenta con buenas referencias laborales y personales, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la destilación y comercialización de aguardiente en el caserío Puchea- Callayuc, el cliente tiene una experiencia en el negocio de 13 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de caña de azúcar materia prima para la elaboración de aguardiente y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 60 years old and lives alone in his own home in the town of Cumbe, which is in a rural district of Pucara.  He has good professional and personal references.  The population of the area is engaged in agriculture, animal husbandry and trade, located in the Jaén province belonging to the Cajamarca region, located in the northern highlands of Peru.

He is engaged in the distillation and sale of 'aguardiente,' a local liquor, in the village Puchea-Callayuc.  The borrower has 13 years of experience in the business.  He has requested a loan of 2000 soles to buy more sugar cane feedstock for the production of spirits and thus generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar cane as raw material for the production of aguardiente

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a 49-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children. Her elder daughter has grown and has reached the age of marriage, but Bushra does not have savings to collect the dowry for her daughter's marriage. 

Her husband owns a clothing business; his practice is to buy clothing from wholesalers and sell it to retailers. He has a lot of customers who like to buy clothing from him; sometimes he purchases clothing from out of the city at a low cost and sells it to the retailers. He has a good reputation in the market, and his current customers refer him to the other retailers, which becomes the cause of his advertisement.

One of her sons also helps her husband in the clothing business; both are partially devoting their time to the shop.
 
Bushra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy more clothing to fulfill the demand. Bushra hopes that the savings will much increase, and she will arrange the marriage ceremony for her daughter. 

She dreams for the bright future of her children, the establishment of the business and for better living standards for her family.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothing for reselling.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is 32-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for many years. Recently his rickshaw has not been working properly through regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. Therefore Asia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Asia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays a daily fare because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding his children. Now his children are growing old and their needs as well. He was worried for many days about how to abstain from the daily fare, so he decided to buy his own rickshaw. 

Rukhsana has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing, they were short some money. Therefore, Rukhsana has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.  

She hopes that now her husband does not have any need to pay the daily fare that became the cause of an increase in expenditures. 

Rukhsana is a 45-year-old woman, living with her five children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en: Shakeela is a 33-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is an auto rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last four years. Recently his rickshaw has not been working properly through regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. Therefore Shakeela has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Shakeela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto ricksaw.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and five children. Her husband owns a small gemstone shop, in which he sells precious gemstones for rings, earrings and necklaces. He presents his jewelry under a glass display case, for the attraction of customers.

He has only one source of income. He has to afford the expenses of utility bills, the school fees of his children, and the other household expenses, alone. The condition of his house is not up to the mark for living.

Therefore, Bushra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her husband will use the loan funds to increase the inventory of the shop, and his earnings, as well. She hopes that she will construct her house soon, so that her family members pass their lives comfortably.

Bushra is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: To buy gemstones for her husband to resell at his shop

loans.name: Hassan Dar

texts.en:
Hassan Dar is the age of 27. He is a married person, and he has to look after his old parents also. He spends little time with his family, due to his busy business.

Hassan Dar owns a hardware shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He sells hardware goods, such as iron nails, nuts, bolts, door locks, door handles, and cutting blades. His shop is situated in the hardware market, and it is challenging for him to sell his products among his competitors. Because in his area, there are many industries available. To cope with the competitors he has to maintain the stock of each spare part, so that he will not have to refuse any customer. He wants to increase the stock of his shop to cope with the demand, and to earn maximum profit as well.

Nowadays, he is unable to buy inventory for his shop, because he has been spending most of his income on household expenses. Now he does not have money to buy inventory. Therefore he requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. The loan will enable him to buy all the important goods, including expensive and cheap hardware materials.

Hassan Dar is tension-free after taking loan, because BRAC showed him a beam of hope in the darkness. He is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his hardware shop

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 42-year-old, married woman. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children; now they are growing older, and their needs grow as well.

Her husband has a business of providing services, to move construction supplies such as sand, pebbles, concrete, cement and soil, from one place to another. He has been doing this work for many years and generating reasonable income for his family. Nowadays his truck is broken, due to overloading and jerks over bad roads. He is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. Due to this reason, he is unable to continue his services, and his earnings are zero.

Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her husband will use this amount to maintain the truck, so he can start his services again. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair the truck used by her husband.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 49-year-old lady, living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother; her children have reached the age of marriage. She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities for her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her two sons have been driving auto-rickshaws for many years; their income is sufficient to feed the entire family. One of her sons has to maintain the auto-rickshaw's body but he does not have a sufficient amount of money to fix the problem.  Therefore, Suriya has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son would be able to buy the auto-rickshaw's body. 

She hopes that she would be able to make enough saving till the time of her children's marriages. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new body for an auto-rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children; her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community. 

Nasreen owns a small business to sell ladies' ready-made garments at home. She purchases fabric from markets at a low price, sews it, and sells it for a profit. The ladies of town like her garment collection and selections. The demand for clothing has increased because the summer weather has started and people demand seasonal clothing. 

Her husband's income covers all the expenses and her earnings go into savings. She has requested a loan to buy more a of garments to meet the demand. 

Nasreen wishes for a bright future of her children and her dream is to provide better facilities to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy garments.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is the age of 35; she is the mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly. Because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore, Farah has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Farah is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of rickshaw maintenance

loans.name: Zohra's Group

texts.en:
Zohra belongs to a poor family, living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a 46-year-old woman and a responsible house wife. 

Her husband is a blacksmith; he manufactures iron accessories such as doors and windows which are useable in houses. He has been providing door to door services to weld broken accessories as well. He owns a iron shop as well in which he sells iron rods and basic raw iron for manufacturing. 

A few days ago his welding plant has become out of order due to overheating and needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy new a welding plant but he does not have cash in hand due to lot of household expenses. 

Therefore, Zohra requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy a welding plant for iron manufacturing.  

Zohra thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a welding plant for iron manufacturing.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia’s age is 37; she is married, living with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She purchases clothes at cheap rates with the help of her husband and sells them in her locality. She has been doing this practice since 1998. Now she has gotten enough experience and knows clothes-dealing very well.

She wants to utilize her clothing experience and wants to get more profit but she is compelled to take a loan due to her low financial condition. Therefore, Asia showed her interest to take a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy a variety of clothing to sell.

She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide better facilities, living standards. and charming clothes to her children.

loans.use: To buy clothing for reselling from her home.

loans.name: Nazmeen

texts.en:
Nazmeen is a 38-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two daughters and two sons. Her husband is a rickshaw driver, by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the past ten years.

Due to excessive use, the rickshaw body has become damaged, and some parts of it are not working properly. Because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair the rickshaw and replace its body, as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost. Therefore, Nazmeen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairs and body replacement for the rickshaw. This will enable him to continue his business. Nazmeen is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing and replacing the body of the rickshaw.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia belongs to a poor family. She is living with her spouse and five children, in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her son has been manufacturing iron goods, such as doors, windows, and tables, for many years. Now, he has become professional in his work and can run a separate enterprise. He wants to open his own workshop, but due to a lack of available funds, he is unable to buy initial raw materials and a welding plant.

Therefore, Safia has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is an active field partner of Kiva. She will use the loan to enable her son to buy a welding plant and initial raw materials, such as welding rods, soldering rods, and iron goods for manufacturing. Safia thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a welding plant and raw materials, to set up a new welding workshop for her son.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar is a 54-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has manufactured spare parts for sewing machine for many years. He buys steel scrap material from the market, melts it, and then  injects it into the dies to give it a specific shape. In this way, he manufactures the spare parts, sells them at the market and makes enough income to contribute to the family's livelihood.

Her son wants to change the nature of his work; he wants to buy new sewing machines and its spares parts rather than manufacturing the parts. However, due to lack of funds, he is unable to purchase sewing machines.  This is the reason that Munawar requests a loan for her son to buy sewing machines and spare parts so that he can increase his sales. She expects a boost in her earning and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

Munawar has four children and barely manages to meet their needs. She needs to provide them with good food, proper health, and an education. She needs to earn additional income to support her family. She is in her seventh loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan and it will be first loan with Kiva. 

Munawar is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machines and spare parts.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 48 years old and the responsible mother of four sons and two daughters. Her son has  run a tailoring shop for many years as he takes orders from boutique owners and sews ladies clothing on order. 

His shop is situated near the house in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. One of his brothers and a few appointed tailors, help him to sew the fabric. In this way, he generates  income for his family and employs others. He belongs to the middle standard family. Due to low earnings, he is unable to provide a better living standard for his sibling, parents and his own family. A major portion of his income is divided among the tailors. 

He faces tough times due to the low income. He can not do any other business because he is not skillful in any other profession, so he decided to expand his current enterprise. 

He does not want to sew the garments on order because the contractors criticize and find drawbacks in his completed shipments.  He wants to buy his own fabric and a professional sewing machine to sew garments and sell them directly to the retailers.  
 
Nasreen has requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan for her son to buy  a professional sewing machine, equipment, and fabric to make garments. She  is happy to receive the loan and thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her son's tailoring shop.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays a daily rental fee because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been able to feed his children. His children are growing older and they have many needs.  He worries about how to abstain meet the daily needs and has decided to buy his own rickshaw. 

She has saved to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband but she has not been able to save enough. Therefore, Rukhsana requests a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw.  She hopes that he does not have to rent the rickshaw . 

Rukhsana hopes that her husband would earn more income because he will be paying the daily rent. She is very happy with this loan and thanks  Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Noor Jahan

texts.en:
Noor Jahan is 38 years old and lives with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has sold seasonal fresh fruit from his shop for many years. The people like to buy fruit from him because his rates are very reasonable. He has built a regular customer base and makes enough money to contribute to the family's income. 

Due to his reputation, the demand for fruit has increased, and his stock is depleted by noon each day.

Noor Jahan feels proud on her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. She requests this loan for her husband to buy greater quantities of fruit. 

Noor Jahan wants to save the  profit for future's sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 41-year-old married woman. She is a mother of one child and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health. 

She requests a loan for her husband. He owns an iron shop to sell binding iron used in making roofs. Due to the increased cost of iron, he is unable to buy new inventory to sell from his shop. 

This is the reason that Irshad has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Irshad hopes that this loan will prove productive and beneficial for her family. She thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy binding iron rods.

loans.name: Mario Adalberto

texts.es:
Mario tiene 52 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, por la escases de escuelas y la necesidad que se tenía en la casa era difícil el poder estudiar, está casado y tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.
  
Él es empleado de la alcaldía de su ciudad, ya tiene más de 12 años en este trabajo, se desempeña como personal administrativo, por su responsabilidad y honestidad lo han llevado a ganarse la confianza de ese lugar. El trabajo le queda a unos 300 metros de su casa, lo cual se desplaza a pie, el horario que cumple es de  8:00 am a 4:00 pm.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar mobiliario para la casa, y de esta forma podrá tener mas comodidad en el hogar.

Sus sueños son, preparar bien su casa para que en un futuro tenga mejor valor de adquisición, para sus hijos espera dejarles una herencia digna donde al vender pueda cada quien obtener una buena parte, ya que con la construcción tendrá un mejor valor la propiedad.
texts.en:
Mario is 52 years old, and he attended school until the sixth grade, as the scarcity of schools and the needs of his home made it difficult to study. He is married, with three children who are now grown, and his wife takes care of their home. 

He works for the Office of the Mayor in his city, a job that he has held for more than 12 years. He works as part of the administrative staff, and he is trusted because he is reliable and honest.  He walks to work, which is located about 300 meters from his house; his schedule is from 8:00 A.M. until 4:00 P.M.

He will use the loan to purchase furniture for his house, and in this way, he will be able to have a more comfortable home.

His dream is to prepare his house well, so that in the future it will have a higher market value when his children sell it, allowing each to receive a good share. He hopes to leave them a decent legacy, and with construction, the property value will increase.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for the house.

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en:
Zareena is a 45-year-old married woman. 

She has done hand embroidery from home for many years to support her family. In fact, her husband has been sick most of the time and is unable to work. 

For the sake of her children and to meet household expenses, she started an embroidery business at home with the help of her daughters. A supplier comes to her home and provides the embroidery supplies. She and her daughters complete the project using a wooden frame. She wants to sell knitted embroidery directly in the market so that she can earn more profit for her family. She has become an expert in her art and wants to buy supplies  so that she can sell her handmade embroidery in her hometown.

Zareena has requested a loan to buy supplies to knit more embroidered dresses to sell and generate maximum income. 

She is a mother of three daughters and three sons. She hopes to increase her earnings through larger sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy embroidery supplies.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTALEZA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rufina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de carpintería, artesana en zampoñas, costura de mandiles, venta de queso, venta de accesorios de autos, venta de comida, venta de poleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rufina es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de carpintería; da a conocer antes de casarse su esposo trabajaba en un taller de carpintería, posterior al matrimonio ambos deciden instalar una carpintería independiente con un pequeño capital que tenía ella.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera) que adquirirá de las barracas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada  y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución y su grupo.

Se identifica una socia ausente, misma qu se encontraba en el consultorio médico.
texts.en:
