The “Fortaleza”[strength] communal bank is beginning its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional center.  The group is comprised of nine members and is managed by a board of directors where Rufina is president.  The members of the association are engaged in various businesses including a carpentry workshop, artisanal reed flutes, sewing aprons, and selling cheese, automobile accessories, food, and T-shirts.  

The loan they are taking out will benefit small businesses where Rufina is a member.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago by the invitation of an advisor that came to visit her in her home.  Currently, she has a carpentry workshop business and discloses that her husband worked in a carpentry shop before they got married.  After the marriage, they both decided to set up an independent carpentry shop with the small amount of capital that she had.

The loan that she is taking out now is to increase working capital through the purchase of wood, which she will acquire form the warehouse in El Alto.  Later, she will sell it per customer order.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is married and has five children.  When asked about what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings that the institution offers to her group.

An absent member, who was at the doctor’s office, is identified.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 52 years old, has five children, and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a scrap dealer. He purchases scrap iron, plastic accessories, aluminum and copper from retailers  and sells it to a recycling factory. He has done this for many years and earns a  reasonable profit. He loves his children a lot and wants to provide them with better conditions. 

He wants to earn maximum income to ensure and secure the better future of his children. Recently, he met with a new retailer who has large quantities of scrap. He is unable to afford this. 

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan to help her husband  to buy large quantities of scrap material.

Razia hopes that this loan will enhance the earning capacity of her husband.  She wants to savings than than in previous years.

She seems very glad after taking this loan and thanks Kiva.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 34 years old and lives with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband owns a shop to sell electrical goods and provides repair services for ceiling fans and washing machines . He also sells electrical components such as bulbs, switches, and sockets.
 
He wants to restock his inventory but does not have enough cash to buy new inventory. Asia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can restock his inventory.
 
Asia thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita tiene 52 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pero hace un tiempo  estuvo en un programa de enseñanza y  aprendió a leer y a firmar. Ella estuvo casada, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, de los cuales ninguno está en casa de ella porque ya formaron sus propios hogares. Ella solo cuida a dos nietos que tiene en su casa y solo ellos dependen económicamente de ella.

Felicita es agricultora, aprendió la actividad desde que estaba muy pequeña ya que su familia se dedicaba a eso y por tanto su padre le enseño a cultivar el maíz y el frijol, entre otros productos, ella tiene como  fuentes de ingresos  la agricultura, la crianza de aves de corral, la siembra de hortalizas, y la crianza de cerdos y algunos reces. Desde que se separó de su esposo tuvo que luchar con el trabajo para sacar adelante a sus hijos. El horario de trabajo del cliente es de 5 horas diarias.

Con el crédito comprará insumos agrícolas para sembrar  el maíz, frijol, maicillo entre otros.  

Sus sueños son poner un puesto de venta en el municipio más cercano para comercializarlo pues considera que así tendrá mejores ingresos que venderlo todo de una sola vez. Para su familia sueña con seguirlos apoyando y ayudarlos a que cumplan sus sueños.
texts.en:
Felicita is 52 years old, and did not have the opportunity to attend school, but some time ago she was in a learning program and learned to read and write.  She was married but is now a single mother of 4 children, of which none are at home with her since they have started their own families.  She only takes care of two grandchildren that live with her, and they are the only ones who depend on her financially.  

Felicita is a farmer, and she learned the trade from a young age because her family worked as farmers and her father taught her how to grow corn and beans among other produce.  Her sources of income include agriculture, raising poultry, planting vegetables, and raising pigs and some cattle.  Since she separated from her husband, she has had to fight through her work to get her children ahead.  She works five hours a day.

With the loan, she will purchase agricultural supplies to grow corn, beans, sorghum and others.  Her dream is to open up a store in the closest town to sell her produce.  She believes that this will allow her to generate greater earnings than she does selling it all at once.  For her family, her dream is to continue supporting them and helping them to reach their goals.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to plant corn, beans, sorghum and others.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 33 years old and has faced many tough times due to her husband's occupation. 

Recently, her husband did not have a permanent job and therefore changed his occupation. He now has a  business in which he provides a concrete mixer machine and labor to construct ceilings. He has work and earns a sufficient income. His concrete mixer machine works from a generator, but it no longer works and needs to be replaced with a new one. 

He is unable to generate even a penny without the mixer machine.   Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so that her husband would be able to buy a new concrete mixer machine and continue to work.

She is nervous about her husband’s occupation.  This business is very profitable and is only the source of income for her family.

Naseem thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a concrete mixer machine.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 46-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges in his shop. He is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at profitable prices. With the profit, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits for resale

loans.name: Marina

texts.ru:
Марина 44-летняя швея, которая проживает в городе Душанбе, в самом сердце Таджикистана. Она умелая мастерица, занимающаяся пошивом женских национальных платьев в течение около 6 лет. Она работает у себя дома. Марина живет вместе с мужем,  23-летней дочерью и 21-летним сыном. У нее дружная семья.  Марина любит свою семью и свое дело. 
Для того чтобы улучшить процесс своей работы, Марине необходимо купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку, так как ее машинка очень устарела и всегда ломается, что причиняет ей неудобств.  В будущем она хочет расширить деятельность и открыть возле дома собственное ателье.
texts.en: Marina is a 44 year old seamstress who lives in the city of Dushanbe, in the very heart of Tajikistan.  She is a master artisan, having sewn traditional women's dresses for about 6 years.  She works from home, where she lives with her husband, 23 year old daughter, and 21 year old son.  Her family is very close.  Marina loves her family and her work.  In order to improve her work process, Marina need to buy a new, modern sewing machine - her old machine is very outdated and frequently breaks, causing her great inconvenience.  In the future she would really like to expand her business and open her own studio near her home.

loans.use: to purchase a new, modern sewing machine

loans.name: Pedro Andres

texts.es:
Pedro Andres tiene 52 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de plátano y comercio del mismo y fruta de temporada, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de fruta y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro Andres, 52, lives in the Buenos Aires district, a community with a warm climate.  Here the residents work in agriculture, animal husbandry and commerce.  This place is in the Morropon province in the Piura region of the northern coast of Peru.

Pedro Andres is a farmer.  He mostly cultivates bananas, and he sells them along with other seasonal fruits.  He has requested a loan from EDPYME ALTERNATIVA for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy a greater quantity of fruit.  This way, he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit to sell to his customers

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran sells milk in her community. She and her husband have sold milk for many years. Her husband sells milk in a nearby town and she sells in the neighborhood. They both contribute to cover household expenses. 

Nazeeran is 33 years old and lives with her family in Lahore, Pakistan. Each day, the needs of her family increase but her source of income remains constant.

Therefore, Nazeeran has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to raise cattle to produce milk. She will user her savings and the loan to buy a cow. 

Nazeeran thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a cow to produce milk to sell.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 40-year-old married woman and lives with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Farzana’s husband has been a laborer in a firm. Now he is older and weak and has decided to drive an auto rickshaw. He wants to buy an auto rickshaw to generate income for entire family. 

Due to lack of funds, he is unable to purchase new rickshaw.

She has saved money for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband,  but she does not have enough to purchase the rickshaw.
 
Therefore, Farzana requests a loan for her husband to buy a new rickshaw. 
 
She is very happy after receiving this loan and thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy anew rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Yakelyn Giamileth

texts.es: Yakelyn tiene 28 años de edad de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 10 y 2 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace tres años y es así como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Yakelyn solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pared de la sala dado que actualmente el material se encuentra deteriorado. Con el crédito solicitado comprará ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro.
texts.en: Yakelyn is 28 years old and lives in her own home with her spouse and two children who are aged 10 and 2.  She has worked as a housekeeper for the past three years, which is how she is able to bring home an income for her family.  Yakelyn is seeking this loan from FUSAI to build a wall for her living room seeing as how currently the material has deteriorated.  With the loan, she will purchase bricks, cement, sand and iron.

loans.use: purchase bricks, cement, sand and iron to build a wall for her home.

loans.name: James

texts.es:
James tiene 31 años de edad, vive en el Caserío de Cabara Chica, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una zona con clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de piña, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años, tiene clientes en su distrito que se dedican a la venta de fruta, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 500 nuevos soles para la compra abonos para darle mantenimiento de su cultivo de piñas y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
James is 31 years old and lives in the hamlet of Cabara Chica, a rural area in the Pucará district that has a warm climate and whose population is dedicated to agriculture, commerce and livestock.  It is located in the Jaén province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern sierra.

He works growing pineapples, and he has 10 years of experience in this field.  He has clients in his district who are devoted to selling fruit.  He has requested a loan of 3,500 nuevos soles to purchase manure to provide maintenance to his pineapple crops.  This will allow him to generate greater earnings for his family.

loans.use: purchase manure to provide maintenance for his pineapple crops.

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna belongs to a poor family and lives with her spouse and a daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a blacksmith and manufactures iron accessories for home doors and windows. He provides door-to-door services to weld broken accessories.

His welding equipment is currently out of order due to overheating and needs to be replaced. He wants to buy new welding equipment but does not have money due to lot of household expenses. 

Therefore, Lubna has requested a loan from BRAC so that her husband would be able to buy welding equipment for manufacturing.  

Lubna thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a welding equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cattle to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима уроженка аграрного района Северного Таджикистана. После развода с мужем она осталась одна на иждивении родителей-пенсионеров. У неё не было ни опыта, ни образования, чтобы работать и кормить себя и своего ребенка. Фотима устроилась продавщицей в лавке по продажи продуктов питания, продавала охладительные напитки и получала мизерную сумму, которую не хватала даже на питания. Для того чтобы расплатиться с долгами, торговля для неё было единственным выходом.  Она  решила взять точку на рынке и начать свой бизнес. Первоначальный капитал был мизерным, но спустя годы, Фотима увеличила свой оборотный капитал. Вот уже 8 лет как Фотима занимается куплей продажей хозяйственных товаров как посуды и т.п. Сейчас она  арендует магазин внутри центрального автовокзала и у неё есть постоянные клиенты. Она обратилась повторно (3 цикл) за получением займа для покупки посуды для пополнения оборотного капитала.
texts.en: Fotima is a native of an agriculture region of northern Tajikistan.  After her divorce from her husband, she was left alone and became financially dependent on her retired parents.  She didn't have experience or education to work and feed herself or her child.  Fotima became a saleswoman in a shop selling food and cold drinks, but earned a tiny salary, which was not even enough to buy food.  Work in retail became Fotima's only option to pay off her debts, and she decided to open a stand at the local market and start her own business.  In the beginning she had only a small amount of capital, but years passed, and Fotima increased her working capital.  Fotima has now been working for 8 years buying and selling household goods like dishes, etc.  Fotima now rents a store in the central bus station and has regular customers.  She is asking again (3rd cycle) for a loan to purchase dishes to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy dishes to increase working capital

loans.name: Lukiya

texts.en: Lukiya is married with five children, only one of whom goes to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business of selling of used clothes. She has applied for a loan of 2000000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She moves door to door selling used clothes. She sells six days out of every week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to get a permanent business premises and to educate her remaining child through university. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of their good customer work. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Dora Esmeralda

texts.es:
Dora, nuevamente hará uso de los créditos para continuar mejorando su situación económica y aportando para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, con el capital que requiere comprara aceita, azúcar, bebidas, granos básicos, golosinas, pan, entre otros productos que sus clientes demandan a diario.
Con la ayudad del crédito anterior ha mejorado el inventario de la tienda, su rentabilidad aumento y su familia vive en mejores circunstancias.
texts.en: Dora will again make use of loans to continue improving her financial situation and contributing to cover her family's basic needs.  With the requested amount, she will purchase oil, sugar, beverages, basic grains, snacks, bread, and other products that her customers demand on a daily basis.  With the help of the previous loan, she has been able to improve the inventory of her store, her profits increased, and her family is living in better conditions.

loans.use: purchase oil, sugar, beverages, basic grains, snacks, bread, etc.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en: Prossy is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for 7 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more secondhand clothes. She moves door to door selling second hand clothes and works seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include thieves and the rainy season. She is aspiring to get a permanent business premises and to have a fully stocked boutique. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores cuyes, pollos, gallinas, gallos, patos, pavos, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 35 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Oyotún district, a community that is devoted to agriculture, commerce and livestock, located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region.

She works raising and selling small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, hens, roosters, ducks and turkeys.  Her business is located in back of her house.  She has requested a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed to fatten up her animals.  This will allow her to generate greater earnings for her family.

loans.use: purchase balanced feed to fatten up her animals.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes, plaguicidas, herbicidas, abono, semilla y pagara mano de obra que le ayuden a preparar el terreno para continuar cultivando maíz  y sacar el mayor provecho de la época de invierno.
Con la buena inversión del crédito anterior tuvo a su disposición los insumos agrícolas necesarios con los que aumento la productividad de sus cultivos y tiene una mejor economía familiar.
texts.en:
José is asking for a new loan in order to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, compost, seeds and to pay for the laborers who help him prepare the land in order to continue growing corn and to make the most of wintertime. 

By investing his previous loan wisely he had the agricultural supplies needed to increase the productivity of his crops and his family finances have improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, compost, seeds, and to pay for laborers

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 37 years old and lives with her six children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has sold fruit for many years from a manual cart. He can easily reached the customers. The people like to buy fruit at their door instead of moving to the market. Due to the fruit’s freshness, he has a regular customer base and makes enough money to contribute to the family's income. Due to his reputation the demand for fruit has increased and his stock is usually depleted by noon each day.

Shamim feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. She requests this loan for her husband so that he would be able to buy seasonal fruit. She wants to save the  profit for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 45-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. 

Her husband owns an oil shop in which he sells different types of hair-using oils, such as Avocado oil, Castor oil, Coconut oil, olive oil, Safflower oil etc. He has been running this business for the last seven years. He buys hair oils from the main market at wholesale rate and resells at profit rates in his shop.
He manages his household necessities from his own shop as well. He speaks with monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. 

Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His hair oil shop is very famous in town, which is the reason his business is running well. He wants to increase his business, therefore,  Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband so that he would be able to buy more stocks of hair oils for resale.
 
Zahida seems very glad, and thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of hair oils for resale.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 49-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home.

Her elder son provides services of shuttering work for making buildings. In this regard, her son needs raw materials, such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods, and sheets for manufacturing Iron's accessories to improve his shuttering work, so that he can generate more income to financially support his family. He manages his household necessities from his shuttering work as well. 

Khursheed is applying for loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her son's work so that he would be able to buy raw materials, such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods, and sheets for manufacturing Iron's accessories.

Khursheed is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods, and sheets for manufacturing Iron's accessories.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 52-year-old woman who lives with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is a responsible mother and her children have reached the age of marriage. She wants to save money so that she can provide better living facilities to her children but it seems impossible without a profitable source of income.

Her son has driven an auto rickshaw for many years and his income is insufficient to feed the entire family. He has to repair the body of the rickshaw but does not have enough money to fix the problem. 

Musarat requests a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son would be able to make the repairs.
 
She hopes that she would be able to save money to meet any future expenses. 

She thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain the rickshaw.

loans.name: Naila's Group

texts.en:
Naila is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She is the mother of five children and her husband works in a firm and earns low wages. 

Naila runs a small home-based boutique and sells garments at very reasonable rates. She purchases fabric from the market at low prices, sews it, and then sells it at a profit. 

The ladies from her town like her collection of garments. The demand for ladies' dresses has increased due to the attractive designs and colors. 

She wants to increase the variety of clothing and requests a loan to  buy a variety of garments to meet the demand. 

Naila wishes for a bright future for her children and her dream to is to provide them with a better education. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fabric for sewing.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a 35-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
She belongs to a poor family; her family are passing their lives by hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells ladies and gentlemen's clothes. He has been running this business for ten years and cherishing his whole family. 

It is his misfortune that he could not built up a good relationship among his customers. This is the reason that he could not establish his enterprise well. He wants to offer seasonal clothes to his customers.

Now with the increase in their needs, they consider it necessary to grow the business also. But the lack of capital is a major problem for her husband's business. Therefore, Nabeela took a loan for her husband’s clothing business. With the help of this loan, her husband will purchase more clothes to resell. 

Nabeela thanks to the Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Shibani

texts.en:
Shibani is 39 years old.  She is married and a loving mother of three children (two sons and one daughter).  All of them are students and in grades 10, 10 and 9 only.  She lives with her husband, Subhas, and children in a remote village of Jalpaoguri district Raypara.  Both Shibani and her husband received education up to grade 8.

Shubani's husband is a seller of betel nut (a kind of mouth freshener used by the people in rural areas).  He purchases betel nuts from his own village and neighboring villages which he sells in the local markets.  He has no consistent income.  Thus, Shibani practices livestock breeding to give financial support to her family. She has a cow and two goats in her farm. She started this business three years back when her husband's business was not going well and the income was very low to cover the household.

With the determination to further develop her business, Shibani turned to BJS to buy one more cow.  She is determined to increase the size of her herd in order to fundamentally increase her family's income so that they do not have to face any financial crisis.

She dreams of upgrading her house to a brick-built and concrete-made house with the profit.

She will be ever grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Anima is a young woman of 27 years who has completed a level of primary education, thanks to the support to her parents.  She is married, a housewife and a mother of two grown-up children who are students.  Together they live in their own kachha house (made of straw, bamboo and mud) in Shalbari which is a remote region in Jalpaiguri district.

Her husband is a farmer and has a plot of land. He works hard to come out ahead in vegetable cultivation.  He mainly grows potatoes, eggplant, bitter gourd etc.  He has seven years' experience working in his farm.  His products have much demand in the markets.  Anima is an energetic and hardworking woman.   Though she is a housewife who looks after her husband and children and does the household jobs, yet she helps her husband in his work a lot. Especially at the time of harvesting, she carries the products to the market for sale. The income of her family greatly depends on this agricultural business, so she and her partner want to develop it by growing some other vegetables.  They have chosen ribbed gourd to cultivate as it is a vegetable which is widely used in India.

So Anima is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to be able to support her for the purchase of agricultural inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.  Her dreams are to support her children in their studies, improve her quality of life in order to offer them better options in their lives, and continue strengthening their family assets with the profit of her business.

She dreams of constructing a concrete-made house for them in future and she is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating ribbed gourd.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 47-year-old women residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Her husband has been engaged in the towel-making business for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the demands of entire family and managing the household.

Mumtaz's husband needs to buy cloth in large quantities to make towels, but due to insufficient financial resources he is unable to buy cloth in bulk. Therefore, his wife Mumtaz has requested for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she can financially assist her husband to buy cloth in bulk and fulfill the needs of his business so that he can earn a higher income. For this financial support, Mumtaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cloth in bulk to make towels.

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati is a widow of 48 who lives with her two sons in the small village of Kalirhat in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She has a primary education.  Due to their poverty, she was not able to provide education to her sons. Now they are grown up and are working as masons.

After her husband's death, Arati has been engaged in her husband's business of puffed rice. She sells the puffed rice as tiffin (tea-time) snacks in their area.  Puffed rice is a very popular and a common snack in India.  It is made by heating sand in a pot, and then throwing in grains of rice.  The rice puffs up and is separated from the sand with a strainer.  It is called 'MURI' in the Bengali language. It is very popular and used on a wide variety of secular and religious occasions, or even just munched plain. So Arati works hard all day long to make this, and her sons help to deliver it to different shops in the market.  In order to cope with the growing needs of her family, she wants to enlarge her business.

So Arati has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase more ingredients for her business.  She hopes it will help her to fulfill the local demand and earn more profit through her business.

She wants to expand her business in order to strengthen the family economy and have a secure future for her family.

She will always be grateful to BJS and Kiva for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her puffed rice business.

loans.name: Mayram

texts.ru:
Эту 52-летнюю женщину зовут Майрам. Она является садоводом и растениеводом из района Сарбанд. Майрам арендует 1,10 га земельного участка, на половину которого выращивает пшеницу, картофель и бахчевые культуры, а на остальной части ее арендуемой земли расположен большой фруктовый сад. Майрам занимается данными деятельностями на протяжении более 5 лет. Члены семьи усердно помогают ей в этих деятельностях. У Майрам муж и четверо детей. Ее муж работает в ГЭС. 
Майрам скромная, честная, трудолюбивая сельская женщина. Ей нравится то, чем она занимается. Майрам сейчас хочет оградить свой сад и для этой цели ей не хватает 1700 долларов США. На эту сумму она собирается купить железные решетки и трубы, чтобы поставить ограждение. Этот кредит ей очень важен.
texts.en: This 52 year old woman is Mayram.  She is a gardener from the region of Sarband.  Mayram rents 1.1 hectares of land, and on one half raises wheat, potatoes, and melons, while the other half is a large orchard.  Mayram has been engaged in this work for more than 5 years.  Members of her family diligently help her in her work.  Mayram has a husband and four daughters.  Her husband works in hydroelectrics.  Mayram is a modest, honest, hard-working villager, and loves what she does.  Mayram wants to put a fence around her garden, but does not have the 1700 US dollars she needs.  With this money she plans to buy iron bars and pipes to build the fence.  This loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy iron bars and pipes to put a fence around her garden

loans.name: José Doroteo

texts.es:
José tiene 36 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno  grado, está soltero y vive con su madre, a quien cuida ya que se encuentra muy mal de salud desde hace muchos años.

Él es seguridad en un casino de la ciudad, ya tiene más de tres años de prestar sus  servicios, la necesidad y la oportunidad de tener una fuente de ingreso lo llevó a dedicarse a esto, donde por hoy  se ha ganado la confianza de sus empleadores, hace turnos de 12 horas y luego descansa, también se dedica a la agricultura, una actividad que realiza desde pequeño, el empleo le queda  a unos 20 kilómetros de distancia, el recorrido lo hace en bus por lo que todo los días tiene ese gasto. No tiene más actividades a las que se dedique ya que por el trabajo que tiene no le queda tiempo para más.      

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para invertir en la compra de electrodomésticos para la casa, pues desea tener sus propias pertenencias las cuales son fundamentales en el hogar.

Sus sueños son poder tener primero lo más necesario para su madre, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudará en satisfacer la necesidad de tener mejor arreglada la casa, ya que con esto le da una mejor presentación.
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old, studied until ninth grade, is single, and lives with his mother, whom he takes care of since she has been in a state of very poor health for many years.

He is a security guard at one of the city's casinos and has been working there for over three years now. The need and the opportunity to have a source of income led him take this job. He has earned the trust of his employers, working 12 hour shifts and then resting. He also works in agriculture, an occupation that he has had since childhood. His job is about 20 kilometers away. He commutes by bus because he has that expense every day. He does not have any other occupations because the job that he has does not allow him to have time for more.

He needs the loan requested to purchase appliances for his house, as he desires to have belongings that are fundamental for a home.

His dream is first to have the most necessary things for his mother, as he expects to work always as long as God gives him health and life. The loan will help him meet the need to have a better organized house which will give it a better appearance.

loans.use: to buy appliances for his house.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 34-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a trained gardener by profession. He provides services of gardening to different areas. He trembles the plants, waters them, and decorates them in good looking shapes by using different gardening tools, such as trowel, watering can, transplanting spade, fork, and edger.

He is very hardworking and expert in his gardening field. People of the society calls him for gardening services in their houses. 

He wants to buy some new tools, such as trowel, watering can, transplanting spade, fork, edger, etc. for gardening work. Therefore, Rubina has requested  a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband so that he would be able to buy gardening tools. 

This will help him continue his services. Rubina is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools, such as a trowel, watering can, transplanting spade, fork, edger, etc. for gardening work.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible house wife.  

Her husband runs a small boutique and sells garments at very reasonable rates. He purchases clothing from the market at low prices, sews it, and then sells it at a profit in his community.   Her husband meets all of the household expenses from his earnings.

The ladies like his collection and selection of garments. The demand for clothing has increased due to the attractive designs and colors. 
To cope with the demand,  he wants to increase the variety of clothing on daily basis.  This is the reason Nazia has requested a loan so that her husband can buy a variety of garments to meet the demands of his customers. 

Nazia wishes for a bright future of her children and her dream is to provide them with a better education. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of garments for her husband's boutiqe shop.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg (E) Group

texts.en:
Asanti, the lady standing with her hand raised, is 32 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in a house made of mud in a rural village of the Nayagarh district in Odisha, India. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice and vegetables that they sell in the market. Having been in this business for 10 years, she manages to earn about 5,000 INR per month and can save about 2,000 INR each month for future needs. 

This is a group loan for Maa Santoshi Self Help Group of 10 women. The members of this group are engaged in different kinds of activities. Some of them are managing grocery shops and others are doing farming. Asanti is leading her group to apply for a loan. She wants to use her loan portion to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her rice yield and earn more income to better her living conditions.

All the members of this group are very happy and grateful to Kiva for what they are receiving.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She is the mother of three children. Her elder son owns a small business to sell ready-made garments at a shop. He purchased garments from the market on low prices  and sells them for a profit. The ladies like his collection and selection of garments. 

The demand for garments has increased because the spring season has started and people require seasonal garments. He meets his expenses from his earnings. To cope with demand of his customers, he wants to buy a variety of summer garments.
  
Yasmeen requests a loan so that her son can buy a variety of garments to meet his customer's demands. 

Yasmeen wishes for a bright future of her children and her dream to is to provide a better education to her children.

 She is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy garments for her son's shop.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 43-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last many years. For the past few days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore, Rubina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him continue his business. 

Rubina is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 40-year-old house wife who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. 

Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges. He is interested in offering a variety of fruit to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings. 

Due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult.  Therefore his wife, Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase a variety of fruit and sell it in the market at a profitable price. 

Her husband will use the profit to grow his business in the future. 

Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit.

loans.name: Dinomoni

texts.en:
Dinomoni, 40 years old, is a very hardworking woman who lives with her husband Balen in a small village named Bairatiguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Their only daughter is married.  Both of them are illiterate and can sign only their names.  They could not go to school because of the limited financial resources of their family.

Dinomoni's husband, 56, works in agriculture and has been working more than 10 years.  He learned about working hard in the agricultural field from his father when he was a small child. Now, he works on his own land and grows mainly vegetables like potatoes, beans, gourds etc.   He works every day from dawn till the afternoon.  His produce is in good demand, but his main challenge is limited capital. For this reason, he cannot fulfill his customers' demands or earn a steady income for his family.

Dinomoni wants to help her husband by actively engaging in the business herself.  She wants to cultivate eggplants. With this aim, she has asked for financial support from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  She wants to purchase agricultural inputs like seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.  She hopes it will be a lucrative business and provide a good profit to strengthen her family's economy.

She wants to purchase more farmland in the future with her profits.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Sabitri is a rural woman from the remote village of Kalirhat in Jalpaiguri district.  She is married and is blessed with three children (one son and two daughters).  All are receiving an education in grades 10, 8 and 5.  Sabitri is very much concerned about her children's education as she is illiterate and was deprived of education due to the poor economic resources of her parents.   Her husband Rabindranath, aged 46, received education up to grade 8.

To earn a living Sabitri's husband operates his agricultural farm.  Sabitri, though a housewife, helps her husband in his agricultural business, while managing their household. For five years, they have been growing different kinds of vegetables in their farm. They sell the produce in the local market.  This is the only source of income for the family, so they work very hard to earn a good profit to cover all the household expenses.  But the inconsistent income can't give the family a better living.

In order to get a steady income, they want to grow jute, which is a profitable crop, in their farmland.  With that aim, Sabitri is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  She will utilize the loan to purchase jute seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to grow jute.  She hopes it will improve her family's living conditions.  She wants to set aside some money for constructing a concrete house in future.

She gives her full thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase jute seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 33-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband is responsible for providing for the needs of the entire family. Samina has also been doing her business of selling clothes for many years and contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household.

Samina needs to buy different types of clothes for resale, but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance Samina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of clothes in bulk

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is a married woman of 28; she could not get elementary education because her parents could not provide it due to their poor economic resources. She can only sign her name.  Her husband Swapan, aged 31, is also illiterate.  They live with their two children (one son and one daughter) in the small village of West Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district. One child is in grade 1 and the other is too young for school.

Namita's husband is a farmer who has a plantation.  He has a plot of agricultural land. He has been in the agricultural business for five years.  He grows vegetables like potatoes, gourds, eggplant and fruit like cucumbers.  Namita is also engaged in these agricultural activities.  She helps her husband in sowing, planting and harvesting, while managing their household.  They have a lot of customers who prefer their produce because they grow vegetables of high quality.   In order to earn more profit they want to cultivate jute in their farmland to strengthen the family economy. They have chosen this crop as it has a high demand and it thrives well in a tropical country like India. So this will be a lucrative business.

 Namita has taken a loan from BJS to purchase agricultural inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.  She believes that the business will provide additional profit to improve their living conditions.

She aspires to build a concrete house with the profit and she will be ever grateful to her lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials such seeds and fertilizers to cultivate jute.

loans.name: Jogomaya

texts.en:
Jogomaya is a 29-year-old woman from a remote region of Jalpaiguri district.  She is married, a housewife and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She is married to Shushil, 44 years old.  Both have attended school until grade five, but they are very much concerned about their children's education. Their children are in school in grade nine and grade five, respectively.

Jogomaya's husband is associated with a small business.  He works hard the whole day for their family, but his income is insufficient for their household.  In order to help her husband financially, Jogomaya wants to start a business making incense sticks.  It is a very profitable business in her area and does not involve much labor cost.

Jogomaya has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  She wants to purchase raw materials for making incense.  She will sell the incense sticks at the market as well as door to door to her neighbors for more profit.  There is a high demand for her product in her locality.  She hopes it will improve the family's financial condition.  She wants to further improve her business.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make incense

loans.name: Noorjaan

texts.en:
Noorjaan is a 52-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for providing for the needs of the entire family. Noorjaan has been doing her business of selling clothes for many years. She contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household expenses.

Noorjaan needs to buy different types of clothes for resale, but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy these clothes. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance Noorjaan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of clothes

loans.name: Oneyda Marili

texts.es: Oneyda tiene 23 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 11 mese y sus madre. Ella se gana la vida por medio de la venta de ropa y mediante la prestación de servicios domésticos. Es así como mantiene la economía de su hogar. Oneyda desea reparar el techo de la vivienda antes que el invierno llegue dado que se encuentra deteriorado y desea comparar materiales como: lámina galvanizada, polines y madera para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos para hacer el desembolso.
texts.en: Oneyda is 23 years old. She lives in her own home with her 11 month old son and her mother. She earns a living by selling clothes and by doing domestic services. That is how she manages the household budget. Oneyda wants to repair the roof on her house before the winter comes. It is in poor condition and she wants to buy materials such as: galvanized sheeting. rods, and wood for which she is asking FUSAI for a loan, since she doesn't have the resources to pay for it herself.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, rode and wood to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena tiene 31 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de gelatinas y chupetes, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de ingredientes y utensillos descartables para la elaboración de sus preparos y de esta manera tener mayores facilidades para dedicarse a vender.
texts.en:
Lorena, 31, lives in the Cayalti district, in a community with a warm climate.  Here the residents work in agriculture, animal husbandry, and commerce.  The area is located in Chiclayo province, which is in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru.

Lorena has a business selling gelatins and popsicles.  Her business is located in her home.  She is requesting a loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy ingredients and disposable items to make her products.  This way, her business will be better equipped.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and disposable items for her food business

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito por los buenos resultados que tiene al invertirlos en su negocio, comprara fertilizantes, insecticidas, abono y pago de mozos, limpiará el terreno para cultivar dos hectáreas de maíz.
El Sr. Lucio comenta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a crecer en su negocio su cosecha aumento, tiene más ganado y sus utilidades son mayores, ha cancelado su deuda, su familia tiene mejor alimentación, vestuario, salud y educación.
texts.en:
Lucio has decided to apply for another loan because of the good results he has had from investing in his business. He will buy fertilizer, insecticide, manure, and pay the workers. He will also clear his land for growing 2 hectares of corn.

Lucio mentions that his previous loan helped him to grow his business: his harvest increased, he had more livestock, his profits were higher, he paid off his debt, and his family has better food, clothing, health, and education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, manure, and pay the workers.

loans.name: Estrella Del Rosario

texts.es:
Estrella, utilizo el financiamiento anterior para comprar materia prima para la venta de tortillas, tiene una mejor condición económica por el aumento en sus ventas, también ha empezado a trabajar en un cafetín en su tiempo libre, la familia se encuentra en buenas condiciones de salud.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para fortalecer la venta de tortillas e incorporar la venta de pan, comprara maíz, leña, harina, sal, manteca, azúcar, levadura, bolsas, canela y otros materiales necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos, tendrá más ingresos con los que cumplirá con los diferentes compromisos que tiene.
texts.en:
Estrella used her prior loan to buy raw materials to make tortillas.  Now her financial situation is better because her sales have increased.  In addition, she has started working in a cafe in her free time.  Her family is in good health.

Estrella is requesting a new loan to fortify her tortilla business and to also start selling bread.  She will buy corn, firewood, flour, salt, butter, sugar, yeast, bags, cinnamon, and other supplies that she needs to make her products.  This way she will have more income and so will be able to cover the various financial obligations that she has.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, flour, salt, butter, sugar, yeast, bags, cinnamon, and other items

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 73 años de edad, es casado, en el hogar procrearon 6 hijos. La esposa trabaja en oficios domésticos. Estudio hasta 3º grado de estudio, los hijos  que más estudio realizaron  fue hasta 9ª grado por la situación económica. Un hijo de él vive en la misma vivienda con el cliente y  la esposa de él.

El cliente aprendió el  trabajo  del  cultivo de  maíz  y frijol cuando era muy chico y cultiva solo para el gasto familiar.  Pero él tiene experiencia en engorde de cerdos. Él no tiene otra actividad productiva solo eso porque cuando la familia estaba pequeña trabaja  de jornal día a día para los hijos sino se le morían de hambre. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar un terreno, porque donde él vive no es de su propiedad, sino de un amigo, allí donde tiene la humilde casa y quiere hacerla y que sea propio el pide a kiva que le ayude con el crédito. Para ir realizando ese sueño que tiene por años.   

El cliente, sueña con hacer la casa ya cuando tenga el terreno y vivir los últimos días en  algo que sea propio, este es un sueño de muchos años que atenido y le pide a Dios que se haga realidad.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 73, is married. He and his wife have 6 children, and she works as a housekeeper. He studied until the third grade, and ninth grade is the highest level completed by his children, owing to the economic situation.  One of his children lives with him and his wife in their home.

He learned to grow corn and beans when he was very young, and he farms on his own in order to pay the family’s expenses, although he does have experience with fattening pigs. He has no other occupation, as when the family was small he worked as a day laborer so that his children would not die from hunger. 

The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of a plot of land, as he does not live on his own property, but that of a friend. He wants to build a simple house of his own there, and he is asking Kiva to help him with a loan so that he can continue working toward this dream, which he has had for years. 

He dreams of building the house when he has the land; and of living out his final years in a place of his own. He has had this dream for many years, and he asks God to make it become reality.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land, as that where he lives does not belong to him, but to a friend.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is 53 years old, and an active borrower through BRAC Pakistan.  She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and eight children.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and is the guardian of the family, responsible for managing the household.  Zahida also contributes her income along with her husband by selling different kinds of oil stuff to support the family.

Zahida wants to purchase different varieties of oils, but due to insufficient financial means she is not in a suitable position to buy oil to resell.  Therefore, Zahida has applied for a Kiva group loan with another member from BRAC Pakistan.  This loan amount will enable her to buy a variety of oil stuff for resale purposes and earn a more profitable income.

On this financial support Zahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of oil for resale.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 64 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a una escuela, como todo buen salvadoreño  luchador, aprendió a leer  por sus propios medios, está casado y tiene 4hijos, su esposa es ama de casa, ella es la que se encarga de las labores del hogar, ya todos sus hijos han formado sus propios hogares, y él solo vive con algunos nietos y su esposa.
 
Él es agricultor, tiene más de veinte años de realizar la actividad, su padre desde pequeño lo indujo por el buen camino, siendo responsable. La parcela donde trabaja le queda de retirado a un kilómetro, el recorrido lo hace a pie, a pesar de edad su buen estado de salud es el que más bien tiene.  Cuando saca la cosecha una parte la vende y lo demás para el consumo, nadie más se involucra en la actividad, el trabajo lo hace por la mañana de 6:00 am a 12:00 MD.

El préstamo será invertido en el pago del arrendamiento de la tierra donde cultiva y en la compra de los insumos agrícolas.

Él sueña con seguir trabajando, ya que con esto mantiene sano su cuerpo y mente, que sus nietos puedan aprender de él.
texts.en:
Antonio is 64 years old. He did not have the opportunity to go to school. Like all good Salvadoran strugglers he learned to read on his own. He is married and has 4 children. His wife is a housewife. She is in charge of the household duties. All of their children have their own households, and he lives alone with his wife and some grandchildren.

He is a farmer. He has been doing this activity for more than 20 years, his father teaching him since he was young to take the right path, being responsible. He walks a kilometer to the land he works since retiring as despite his age he is in good health. When he harvests the crop he sells part of it and the rest is for consumption. No one else works with him. He works from 6:00AM until noon.

He will use the loan to pay for the lease of the land he is farming and to buy some agricultural supplies.

He dreams of working continually, because this keeps his body and mind healthy, and his grandchildren can learn from him.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the land he farms and to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Mamuni

texts.en:
Mamuni is a 27-year-old young and energetic woman.  She is married and a mother of one daughter who is still young. She lives with her daughter and husband in their own kachha house (a house made of bamboo, mud and straw) in Raypara in the district of Jalpaiguri. Mamuni is an Arts graduate and her husband has a higher secondary education.

Mamuni’s husband is a farmer by profession. He grows different vegetables in different seasons.  He learned this from his father at a very tender age.  He gives his best effort to growing good vegetables to satisfy his customers and meet the family expenses, but can't fulfill the basic needs of the family. In order to earn additional income, Mamuni has started a milk-selling business.  She has been successfully doing this business for the last four years.  She sells milk to her neighbors.  But her customers are increasing day by day.  So she needs to purchase one more cow to fulfill their demands.

She came to know about Kiva's partner BJS and has taken a loan from them to purchase a cow.  She dreams that her business will bring so much profit that she can help her husband to provide for the family's household.

In the future, she wants to make a better, decent house to live in.

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS for their financial help.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Shampa

texts.en:
Shampa, 24 years old, is a young and energetic housewife from the village of Raypara in Jalpaiguri district.  She lives with her husband Chandan and two children (one son and one daughter). One of her children is a student in grade one and the other is below school-going age. She received an education up to grade seven and her husband studied until grade nine.

Shampa's husband is associated with agricultural activities. He has been involved in this activity for five years.  He mainly cultivates rice on his own farmland.  He has a huge experience in paddy rice cultivation. Shampa helps her husband in many ways with the agricultural activities. Now he wants to boost his agricultural business to strengthen his family's financial situation.

Shampa heard that Kiva’s partner, BJS, gives business loans to rural women and she has taken a loan from them. She wants to use the loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.  Rice is the staple food of the people in her locality. So Shampa hopes it will be a profitable business. Her ambition is to enlarge the business. She is struggling hard to do this and hopes it will provide a good income and improve their family's financial standard.

She aspires to construct a concrete-made house and she gives her hearty thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase seeds,  fertilizers and pesticides for paddy rice cultivation.

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en:
Nabila is 28-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and four children. Her husband is a mechanic by profession, a business he has had for many years. He is the only one responsible for providing for the household.

He wants to buy different kinds of tools and other relevant accessories for his business, but due to some financial constraints he is unable to buy these tools and accessories to fulfill his business needs. Therefore Nabila has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, her husband can easily purchase the above mentioned merchandise for his business and earn more profitable income as well.

Naibla is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of tools and accessories for her husband's business.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 46-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and seven children. Her husband is the guardian of the family, and he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. He has been operating his own Moraa sitting chair business for many years.

He needs to buy different kinds of accessories for the Moraa chair-making process, but due to some financial constraints he is unable to buy these accessories. Therefore Salma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount her husband can meet the needs of his business by buying relevant business accessories.

Salma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy accessories for a Moraa chair-making business.

loans.name: Gregorio De Jesús

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene 78 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, está soltero, lamentablemente la madre de sus hijos falleció, sus hijos viven en el extranjero, por lo que en casa vive el solo.

Él  se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene más de 40 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, su padre y madre son quienes le enseñaron el respeto al prójimo y a sí mismos, por el tipo de actividad de la zona es que se dedican solamente a la agricultura, Gregorio ha sido un hombre responsable, ha criado a sus 3 hijos sin abandonarlos como muchos padres lo hacen hoy en día, el trabajo lo tiene cerca de su casa y se va a pie, y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 AM a 11:00 AM.

El préstamo lo necesita para preparar la  tierra para la siembra, para pagar mozos que le ayuden con los trabajos, lo demás del crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para el cultivo del maíz. 

Sus sueños son poder tener primero lo más necesario para la familia, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad del arrendamiento de la tierra.  Con la prestación de servicio que realiza y con las cosechas del de cultivo pagará la cuota del crédito y ahorrara para los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 78 years old, studied until second grade, and is single. Unfortunately, the mother of his children passed away. His children live abroad, so he lives at home alone. 

He works in agriculture. He has been making a living doing this job for over 40 years now. His father and mother taught him to respect others and himself, for in that area the only occupation is agriculture. Gregorio has been a responsible man. He raised his 3 children without abandoning them as many fathers do nowadays. His work is close to his home, so he walks there. His work schedule is from 6:00 AM until 11:00 AM.

He needs this loan to prepare the land for sowing, to pay laborers to help with the work, and the remainder of the loan will help him to buy supplies for the cultivation of corn.

His dream is first to have the most necessary things for his family, as he expects to work always as long as God gives him health and life. The loan will help him meet the need to lease the land. By working and harvesting crops he will pay the credit fee and save for the expenses of his family.

loans.use: to prepare the land for sowing, to pay laborers to help with the work, and the remainder of the loan will help him to buy supplies for the cultivation of corn.

loans.name: Josue

texts.es:
Josue es soltero, vive en la Ciudad de Chincha con su familia.
Desde hace 2 años trabaja como obrero en un Fundo.
Es un joven muy trabajador y emprendedor, sale desde muy temprano a laborar y regresa a altas horas de la noche porque quiere ahorrar dinero para construir su casa propia y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Gracias a los prestamistas kiva, Josue podrá utilizar el apoyo para remodelar su vivienda por temporada de invierno y así tener mayores comodidades y desempeñarse mejor en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Josue is single, and he lives with his family in the city of Chincha. He has been working on a farm for two years. He is very hardworking and enterprising, leaving for work very early and returning very late at night, as he wants to save money in order to build his own house and improve his family’s quality of life.

Thanks to the Kiva lenders, Josue will be able to use the loan in order to improve his home for the winter season. This way, he will have more conveniences and better carry out his work.

loans.use: to improve his house for the winter season.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for twenty years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make repairs on his taxi because its current condition is not good. It incurs more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is currently unable to make repairs on his taxi. Therefore Amina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Amina's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. Providing better transport facilities will earn a profitable income. Amina  also plans to make savings with some of the profit amounts of her husband's income in order to meet her family's future needs.

Amina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To cover the expense of repairing her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 49-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore Musarat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Musarat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To cover the expense of her husband's rickshaw repairs.

loans.name: Shephali

texts.en:
Shephali is a very young and energetic woman of 22 years.  She attended school until grade 10 and after that, she could not continue her studies because her parents could not afford her educational expenses.  Now she is married and a housewife. Her husband Tarun, 25 years old, is engaged in agricultural activities.  They are blessed with two little children (one son and one daughter).  They live in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Shephali's husband cultivates their farmland and grows various vegetables, such as gourds, eggplants, potatoes, tomatoes etc. He has been cultivating for more than five years.  He has a higher secondary education. He could not study further and started working in the family business of land cultivation.  He works hard on his farmland to grow good quality vegetables so that he can satisfy his customers. Shephali is not lagging behind. To give the family financial assistance, she works as a laborer on daily wages. She has no steady income. Their income is hardly sufficient to meet the expenses of their family. They aim to expand their vegetable farming to ensure a better yield. They want to grow cucumbers, which is a profitable business and is in much demand in their region.

They have inadequate capital, so she wants to take a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy seeds and fertilizers needed to grow cucumbers.  She believes that she will be able to expand her farm and have a plentiful harvest to give the family financial sustenance.

She dreams of constructing a better house for them with the additional profit.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs for cucumber cultivation.

loans.name: Khankhela

texts.en:
Khankhela is 44-year-old lady residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and four children. Her husband owns a mechanic shop where he has been operating his business for many years. He is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family.

Khankhela's husband needs to buy different types of tools and accessories for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to buy this merchandise. Therefore his wife, Khankhela, has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount her husband can buy these tools and accessories to fulfill the needs of his business and earn more profitable income.

Khankhela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of tools and accessories for her husband's mechanic shop.

loans.name: Samiya

texts.en:
Samiya is a 25-year-old mother of 3 children, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  Her husband owns a printing shop, he is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members.  Samiya has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years, she also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty saloon, but due to financial constraints she is not capable of buying these items for her business purposes.  Therefore, Samiya has applied for a Kiva loan.  This loan will help her buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers.  It will also help her earn the maximum amount of profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Samiya is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Shokat

texts.en:
Shokat is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her five children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running his own mobile phone shop for the past 3 years. 

He wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore Shokat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she’ll enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Shokat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of mobile phone accessories for the purpose of reselling them.

loans.name: Sarabala

texts.en:
Sarabala is a 50-year-old married woman from Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She lives in a Kaccha house (made of mud and straw) with her husband and two children. She is illiterate and only knows how to sign her name. Her poverty, ignorance and lack of knowledge have not allowed her to lead a smooth and peaceful life, but she is very much aware of providing an education to her children. Both the children (one son and one daughter) are receiving an education. One is in college and other is in the university.

Sarabala's husband is 62 years old, sick and unable to do any work.  Sarabala has her own animal husbandry business where she works all day long and looks after the animals.  She is the only earning member of the family of four including two students.  She works very hard so that she can give a bright future to her children as well as maintain other household costs.

Now she has taken a loan so that she can purchase another cow.  At present, there are two cows and one goat on her farm.  She sells milk to her neighbors to earn a livelihood. She wants to start a milk products business such as curd, paneer (cottage cheese), butter etc. to satisfy her customers' demand.  She hopes it will be a lucrative business to fulfill all of her dreams.

She wants to buy more livestock for her cattle herd in order to enlarge her business.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to sell milk and milk products.

loans.name: Pantaleon

texts.es:
Pantaleón, por el buen servicio que la institución le  brinda opta por un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes, abono, semilla, plaguicidas y concentrado para pollos, tendrá todo lo necesario para realizar la próxima milpa y fortalecer la granja.
El efecto que tuvo el crédito anterior al invertirlo en su negocio fue positivo, ya que ha crecido su cartera de clientes, las ventas y ganancias son mejores, poco a poco su estilo de vida va mejorando.
texts.en:
Because of the good service that the institution has given him, Pantaleón has decided on a new loan, which he will invest in the purchase of fertilizer, compost, seed, pesticide, and chicken feed.

He will have everything he needs to produce the next corn crop, and to improve the farm. Investing the previous loan in his business had a positive effect, as his customer base has grown, his sales and earnings are better, and his lifestyle is gradually improving.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, compost, seed, pesticide, and chicken feed.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is a 42-year-old lady. She is a very poor and needy woman. Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed her entire family. He has been doing this business for many years. He has been using wooden planks and bamboos, which he has used up over time.

Now he is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboos. Therefore, Rubina has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new smooth wooden boards and bamboos to continue his business again.  She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and that her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.
 
Rubina is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering material.

loans.use: to buy wooden planks, bamboos, and material for sheltering.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 58-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 6 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past two years. He is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. He wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g. rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business.

However, due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy all of these products for reselling purposes. Therefore Parveen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and will also help him to earn maximum profitable income for managing his household and business. 

Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To increase her husband's general store inventory.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her three children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running his own retail cosmetics shop for many years. 

He wants to purchase different types of cosmetics products for reselling, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these items. Therefore Nadia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she’ll enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business so that he can earn more income for managing his business and household.

Nadia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of cosmetics for reselling.

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
