Rizwana is a 32-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for many years. He is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

He needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, e.g. pieces of cloth, lace needles, and sewing machine accessories. However, due to some financial constraints he is not in a suitable condition for buying these items for his business. Therefore Rizwana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband in buying these tailoring accessories for his business, so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Rizwana is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy pieces of cloth, lace, needles and sewing machine accessories.

loans.name: Lailma's Group

texts.en:
Lailma is a 34-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of 7 children. Her husband has been running his own lighting business for many years. He is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. 

He wants to purchase different kinds of accessories, e.g. bulbs, wires, connectors and tools for business purposes. However, due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy all of these products for his business. Therefore Lailma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all of these items and also help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Lailma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of accessories for her husband's lighting business.

loans.name: Sanjima

texts.en:
Sanjima is only 24 years old and lives in a remote village of Kathapara in the district of Jalpaiguri. She has an elementary school education and she attended school until grade seven.  She is married and a housewife who is blessed with two little children (one son and one daughter).  Her husband Maijul Islam is a 30-year-old farmer.  Their children are receiving an education and are in grade one.

Sanjima's husband is the only breadwinner for the family. He is an experienced farmer who has been cultivating his farmland for the last seven years,  growing vegetables.  He grows mainly beans, chili, and gourds and sells the products in the local markets. This industrious man is fully dedicated to his agribusiness for raising his family well.  But his income is too scant for the family's well being.  So, Sanjima and her husband have decided to grow some other crop that is profitable and has much market demand and they have chosen to grow cucumbers.

In need of additional working capital, Sanjima has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).  She wants to purchase farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers etc.  She hopes that this business will provide her family with additional profit for covering the daily needs of her family.

She wants to keep aside money from her profit for her children's education.

She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies like seeds and fertilizers for cultivating cucumber.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 49-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her husband earns a very low income at his job. 

She owns a small business of selling ladies' clothing at home. She purchases clothing from the market at a low price and sells it for a high price in her community. The ladies of town like her clothing collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because the summer weather has started and people are demanding summer clothing. Her husband covers their family's expenses from his earnings, and she contributes her earnings only for savings.
 
She has requested a loan so that she can buy more variety of clothing to fulfill the demand. Zahida wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream to provide better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for reselling.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 35-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband is a turner by profession; he works over a lathe machine. He manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars, and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of vehicle and bike engines, such as turbines and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years, and his business is well established. He wants to buy damaged spare parts at a low cost, and then sell them for a higher price after repairing and renewing them. He is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy used parts.

Therefore, Sumaira has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy used parts for renewal. She hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business, as well as for her family.

loans.use: to buy used parts for renewal

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina is age 38, a mother of three children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible daughter, wife and mother. She has to look after her young babies, old parents and the sibling of her husband.  She wants to help her husband with the growth of his business. He owns a medical store in which he sells types of medicines, syrups and injections. His medical store is near a medical clinic; most of the patients are referred by the doctor of that clinic. Most of the medicines are unavailable due to high cost. Rubina knows that her husband could earn maximum profit if he could offer these missing medicines. Therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband.  She hopes that he will be able to buy medicine and can generate maximum profits.  Rubina thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy medicines, syrups and injections for the medical store.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en: Shaheen is a 44-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a poor family; her family passing their lives by hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells ladies’ and gent’s clothes. He has been running this business since 1994. It is his misfortune that he could not build up a good relationship among his customers. This is the reason he could not establish his enterprise.  Now, with the increase in family needs they consider it necessary to grow the business also, but lack of capital is the major problem for her husband.  Therefore, Shaheen took a loan for her husband’s business. With the help of this loan he will purchase more clothes to sell.  Shaheen thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her husband's business.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en: Razia, age 49, is a married woman. She is a hardworking and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother she wants to provide better facilities to her children. This is the reason she is doing extraordinary, hard work to keep her children smiling. She has been sewing cloths since the birth of her two children, when she observed that her husband failed to provide all necessities for her children. Then she decided to start tailoring at home and now she is sewing clothes in her community. She wants to enhance the beauty of her stitching, so she wants to buy a Juki machine. The professional people use this machine for tailoring because of its good speed and its work is very fine. She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and the local community people.  She has requested a loan to buy the new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. Razia is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a Juki machine for sewing fine clothing.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en: Ishrat is a 35-year-old lady, living with her spouse, three sons and a daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother;  two of her children are too young and fully dependent upon their parents. She belongs to a poor family; she has to feed her huge family. Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years. His income is insufficient to feed his all of the family. He needs to maintain the auto rickshaw body, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a new rickshaw body.  Therefore, Ishrat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy new body for the rickshaw. Ishrat hopes that she would be able to make enough savings until her young children are grown, and she would succeed to provide higher education for her children.

loans.use: to help her husband buy a new body for his auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Elmer Alexander

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 34 años de edad, estudió poco en la escuela, y vive con sus padres y hermanos.

La agricultura es la actividad a la cual Elmer se dedica,  tiene más de 20 años de trabajar la tierra, su padre fue quien le enseñó este trabajo, no tiene otro negocio al cual se dedique, la distancia que recorre para llegar al lugar es 500 metros aproximadamente, el recorrido lo hace a pie, sus hijos le apoyan cuando es la época de siembra, y trabaja en un horario de trabajo de 6: AM a 12:00 MD.

El préstamo será invertido para construir un cuarto de habitación en su casa pues por hoy es de lámina, y le da mucha pena que lo visiten familiares y no tener un lugar que ofrecerles para dormir, por lo tanto comprará materiales de construcción, cemento, hierro lamina etc. 

Su sueño es ir mejorando su casa para que en un futuro tenga mejor valor de adquisición, y prepararla para cuando se decida a formar una familia.
texts.en:
Elmer is 34 years of age and spent little time in school. He lives with his parents and brothers.

Agriculture is the activity that Elmer is dedicated to. He has spent more than 20 years working the earth. His father taught him this skill. Elmer has no other business he's involved in. The distance he covers to reach his fields is approximately 500 meters. Elmer goes there on foot. His sons help him during planting season and he works a daily schedule: from 6:00 am until 12:00 noon.

His loan will be invested in constructing a new bedroom for the house. Today, that area is covered with sheet metal and it gives him great pain to have family members visit and lack a place to offer them to sleep. For that reason, he will purchase construction materials, cement, laminated sheets, etc.   

Elmer's dream is to continue to improve the house so that in the future, it can have a higher value, and, also, to prepare for when he decides to expand his family.

loans.use: To build a bedroom onto his residence.

loans.name: Afsha

texts.en: Afsha is a 27-year-old, married woman, residing in the town of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of three children. Her husband conducted a shop in which he provides scarf dying services to his customers. He is very expert in his profession and people like his dyed cloths. He dyes cloth under boiled water with the mixture of color powders. He wants to buy gas cylinders and dying powder of various colors. Afsha has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy gas cylinders and dying powder of various colors. She hopes that this loan will work positively for business, which will cause increments in income and savings as well. She is very glad after receiving this loan and very thankful to the Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders and dying powder of various colors for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sabra

texts.en: Sabra is a 40-year-old widow, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has died, and now she is living in her own house with her two sons and a daughter. She is a medical nurse by profession; she has been doing this job in a hospital for the past fifteen years. After the death of her husband, she began running a maternity center at her home. She is experienced and professional in her work. She has been dealing with many cases of pregnancy and has a very successful operation. She is a very famous nurse in her area, and the ladies have full confidence upon her abilities.  Sabra wants to keep her stable reputation and wants to establish her maternity center. Therefore she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy an ultrasound machine and the latest medical instruments and equipment. Her daughter is getting a medical education from a medical institution, and she wants her daughter to do a medical course so that she could easily find a job in hospital.  Sabra is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an ultrasound machine.

loans.name: José Raimundo

texts.es: José tiene 63 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace tres años y de esta forma es como colabora con la economía del hogar. José es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable quien con mucho sacrificio ha sacado adelante a su familia. José solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir una pila para almacenar el agua y además, desea reparar el baño para lo cual necesita materiales como: cemento, ladrillo, arena y hierro.
texts.en:
José is 63 years old and has for three years run a business selling clothing, contributing financially to his household. José is a hardworking and trustworthy man who has sacrificed a great deal in order to help his family achieve progress. 

José is applying for a loan from FUSAI to purchase materials such as cement, bricks, sand, and iron. He will use these materials to install a basin for storing water in his home and also repair the bathroom.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, sand, and iron to install a basin and repair the bathroom.

loans.name: Silvia Carmelina

texts.es:
Silvia, necesita capital para abastecer con los materiales necesarios el negocio y seguir elaborando la venta de pupusas comprara aceite, harina, quesillo, aderezos, golosinas, condimentos, bebidas, pan, arroz, frijoles, etc., seguirá contando con la preferencia de sus clientes.
Con la ayuda de los créditos Silvia ha prosperado poco a poco, su negocio se ha mantenido activo dándole los ingresos que necesita para ayudar a su familia y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Silvia needs capital to stock up on the necessary items for her business and to continue developing the sale of pupusas. She will buy oil, flour, quesillo cheese, dressings, snacks, condiments, drinks, bread, rice, beans and more. She will continue to provide what her clients want.
With the help of the loans, Silvia has prospered gradually and her business has remained active, providing the income necessary to help her family and cancel her debt.

loans.use: to buy oil, flour, quesillo cheese, dressings, snacks, condiments, drinks, bread, rice, beans and more.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim’s son has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays daily fair because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He was worried for many days about how to abstain from the daily fair, so he decided to buy his own rickshaw.  She has been making savings for many days to buy new auto rickshaw for her son, but at the time of purchasing the money remained short.  Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan for her so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.  She hopes that now her son does not have any need to pay the daily fair, which caused the increase in expenditures.  Shamim is a 42-year-old woman, living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She hopes that now her son would be able to earn more income, because now he will not pay daily fair to anyone. She is very happy after taking this loan and thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en: As a married mother of one child, Jessel works hard to support her family.  She has a food market business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Jessel is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional vegetables, spices and other seasonings for her food market business. Jessel has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables, spices and other seasonings.

loans.name: Berlyn

texts.en: Berlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell school supplies business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of school supplies to sell for her business.  Berlyn has been in this business for five years. She also earns more income from farming rice and vegetables. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en: Haleema is a 38-year-old, married woman, living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore. She is a retailer of rice; she buys the rice from harvesters at low prices and sells in her locality. She buys rice of various kinds such as basmati, super kernel, etc. She has been doing the same practice for many years and has many customers who like to buy rice from her in large quantities. In this tenure she has built up positive relationships among her community.  With the increment of new customers and demand, she wants to buy rice in large quantities, so that she can easily cope with this rapid increase in demand. In this way, she would be able to increase her monthly income and savings as well. Haleema is the mother of six children; she has grown old now and hopes that her children would support her in old age.  Haleema praises our honorable support and thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice for reselling from her home.

loans.name: Rasoolan

texts.en: Rasoolan is a 53-year-old, married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of five children. Rasoolan has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for their football manufacturing business. She sews footballs along her husband. Her husband is a shoe and jackets manufacturer as well; he is very expert in his profession. They have been manufacturing footballs for many years. This is the reason they have gained lot of experience about this profession. In this way they are generating income for family. They want to expand their business according to the rapid increase in the needs of family members. They want to grow the manufacturing on a daily basis, but they do not have cash in hand to buy additional raw materials for sewing footballs. Therefore, Rasoolan has requested a loan so they can buy initial raw materials for their enterprise. Both are very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing footballs.

loans.name: Isaias Leonel

texts.es: Isaias es habitante de la comunidad el sardinal acá ha vivido toda su vida tiene 39 años de edad, creció rodeado de su familia estudio hasta cuarto grado de primaria en la escuela de la comunidad. dejo los estudios por que su padre se puso un poco mal de salud así que tenia que apoyarlo en trabajar las tierras que tenían lo que de ahí les permitía poder sacar el alimento de cada día. El dice que su padre fue un pilar muy importante en su vida ya que el le enseño a trabajar hoy en día el con mucho esfuerzo tiene su propia finca de café la que dice le da buena cosecha con esto a sacado adelante a su esposa y sus 6 hijos. como en la comunidad no cuentan con energía eléctrica el quiere optar a un préstamo para comprar un sistema solar para que su familia pueda disfrutar por las noches de tener luz y dejar de usar las candelas y candiles que les causan mucho mal a la salud.
texts.en:
Isaias is 39 years old and has lived in the community of El Sardinal all his life. He grew up surrounded by his family and attended the local elementary school  until the fourth grade. 

Isaias left school when his father developed a slight illness and Isaias had to help him work his land so the family could eat each day. Isaias says that his father was a crucial figure in his life, as he taught Isaias how to work. Through great effort, Isaias has established his own coffee plantation, which he says produces a good harvest. 

The coffee plantation has allowed Isaias to provide a better quality of life for his wife and their six children, but El Sardinal lacks electricity. Isaias therefore wants to take out a loan to purchase a solar power system so that his family can enjoy light in the evening and stop using candles and oil lamps, which are harmful to his family's health.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system.

loans.name: Sandhyabala

texts.en:
Sandhyabala is 44 years old, married, a housewife and a mother two sons. She is illiterate and can only sign her name.  She lives with her husband and sons in the small village of Kalirhat in Jalpaiguri district. Her sons are grown up and are receiving their education.

Sandhyabala's husband is engaged in a paddy business. He purchase paddy rice from wholesale market and sells it in the local bazaar and in his locality. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. Thus, he has goodwill in their locality and his customers are satisfied with his product and behavior. 

Now he wants to boost his business to satisfy his customers and to generate more income. To do so, he has to purchase good paddy from the wholesale market. 

So Sandhyabala has come forward to help her husband.  She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). Her ambition is to enlarge the business. She and her husband are grateful to both BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase paddy from the wholesale market

loans.name: Jhumpi

texts.en:
Jhumpi, only 24 years old, studied up to grade seven, but could not continue due to her parents' poor financial resources.  She is married to Ranjit, 27 years old, who produces different kinds of vegetables on their own plot of land.  He studied up to grade six and they live in the small village of West Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri.

They are raising three daughters.  One of them is a student in grade two and the other two are below school-going age. Jhumpi is a housewife who looks after her husband and son and does the household jobs. Her husband is a farmer who has been involved in land cultivation for many years. He  specifically grows potatoes, which are a vegetables widely used in India.  Jhumpi and her husband sell the products to different dealers in the area and to other buyers who come to buy vegetables.

 In order to earn additional profit, they have decided to cultivate cucumbers on their farmland but the lack of capital has not permitted them to go with their plan. Thus Jhumpi has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase cucumber seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

Jhumpi's goal for the future is to continue working in her husband's business so that they can earn more profit and give the family a better living standard.

She and her husband are grateful to both the lenders (BJS and Kiva)

loans.use: To purchase cucumber seeds and fertilizers for cultivation

loans.name: Chyana

texts.en:
Chyana is a very young and enthusiastic woman of 24 years who hails from Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is married to Sukhlal, 38 years old and they are raising two sons. She is uneducated and can sign only her name and her husband studied until grade five. But they are providing an education to their sons who are in grade seven and three.

Chyana’s husband is a fish vender who sells fish in the local market.  It enables him to take care of his family with very much difficulty.  In order to help her husband, Chyana does farming.  She has an animal husbandry business where she has one dairy cow and a few goats. She sells milk to her neighbours and earns for her family.  Chyana gets satisfaction from raising dairy cows because the milk brings in good income. Her biggest challenge is increasing the family's income. So, she wants to expand her business by purchasing another cow.

Chyana chose BJS for this loan because it caters to the interests of small-scale businessmen.  The loan will enable her to add more cows for milk production and thus, generate more income.  She wants to use the profit to educate her children and improve her family's living standards.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Jose Rosas

texts.es:
José tiene 64 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, junto a su esposa a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Pucara, sus hijos son mayores de edad, con compromiso independizados y viven fuera del hogar. El sector donde vive Jose se denomina Caserío Molino que pertenece al Distrito de Querocotillo que pertenece a la Provincia de Cutervo, ubicada en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de Arroz de la variedad moro, tiene sembrado 1 ha, actividad que realiza desde que se caso, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de arroz y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José is 64 years old and lives with his wife in their own home, which is made of recycled building materials, 40 minutes from the city of Pucara. The couple's children are grown, have left home, and live independently. José in the northern Sierra of Peru, in an area called Caserío Molino, which belongs to the Querocotillo District in Cutervo Province in Cajamarca Region.  

José has been a farmer since he married, and grows mostly Moorish rice. He has planted one  hectare, and has applied for a loan of 2,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa. He will use the loan funds to purchase manure for the maintenance of his rice crop so that he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to take care of his crops

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: As a widowed parent of four children, Sarah works hard to support her family. She has a butcher shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Sarah is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase pigs for her butcher shop business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Sarah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy more farmlands.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her business.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela is 49 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Marcela is borrowing PHP 24,500 through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vaccines and other supplies for her business. Marcela has been raising livestock for 20 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a very active lady of 30 years.  She lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) in the small village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri. She and her husband Dhanonjoy, 39 years old, both have a secondary education. Their children are also getting an education and are in grades eight and one.

To make a living for the family, Kalpana's husband has been farming potatoes and other vegetables on their own plot of land. He has been doing this for many years, and he is the only breadwinner for the family. He works arduously to get ahead. He sells the produce from his agribusiness to the local markets. This agribusiness supplies them with the necessary finances to provide their children, as well as themselves, with clothing, food, medicine etc., although with many constraints.

Now they want to expand their business by cultivating eggplant, which is a vegetable in great favor in their locality and is widely used in Indian dishes.  Kalpana has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase eggplant seeds, fertilizers and agricultural inputs that will help her to have smooth cultivation of the vegetable.

Her goal is to continue increasing the cultivation of the product, strengthening her children's future and saving money to purchase a tractor in the future with the profit earned from this business.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating eggplant.

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Anima is a very energetic young woman of 26 years from Dhupguri, a town located in Jalpaiguri district. She has a primary education.  Due to a lack of economic means, she was not able to pursue a higher education.  She is married and a responsible mother of two school-going children who are in grade two and grade one.

Anima's husband Uttam is a mason by profession.  His inconsistent income obliged Anima to work in order to help with the household expenses. She is hardworking and responsible with a great desire for her personal as well her family's success. She runs a grocery store as her economic activity.  She sells food products and grocery items in her shop such as rice, sugar, oil, eggs, bread, detergent etc.

Now she aims to extend her business to obtain better income. Thus, she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS.  The objective for her loan is to buy more grocery items so she can give financial sustenance to her family and provide a better education to her children.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Shephali

texts.en:
Shephali is an active and energetic lady from the small village of West Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district. She is married to Subal, who is 46 years old. Together they are raising two grown-up sons who are students. One is in college, and the other is in grade ten. Both Shephali and her husband have studied up to grade ten. They live in their own kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo).

Vegetable cultivation is the primary source of livelihood of most of the people of the village where they live. Shephali's husband is also a farmer. Shephali and her husband manage the cultivation farm. They produce vegetables like eggplant, potatoes, cauliflower, carrots, etc. on the farm and sell the products to the traders of the nearest town who come to take vegetables from their farm. Their earning is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of their family as well as the farm expenses.

Shephali wants to expand her business by cultivating cucumbers, which is a profitable business, and it is the best season for cultivation of cucumbers. So, she wants to take a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides. She expects a good return by expanding her cultivation. She hopes to help her whole family by giving them a bright future through her farm work. 

She thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and necessary agricultural inputs for cultivating cucumbers.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She owns and operates a farm where she plants, harvests and sells rice to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than four years, earning well to support the needs of her child. She also works in a private institution and earns a good salary. With her generated income, she was able to successfully repay her previous loans that she used for farming. She took a new loan recently to buy organic fertilizer to realize her plan of improving her farm. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to help her children complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 53 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su hija, yerno y nieto en el distrito de Cayaltì, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al comercio de animales menores cuyes y cerdos, tiene un corral ubicada en la parte posterior de su domicilio donde se engorda a los animales con pasto de tiene en su chacra y maíz amarillo, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos peqeuños para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecerlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Zoila is 53 years old. She lives in her own house with her daughter, son-in-law and grandson in the district of Cayaltì, located in Chiclayo Province which belongs to Lambayeque Region on the North Coast of Peru. The people in this community with varied climate work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

Zoila works raising small animals, guinea pigs and pigs. She has a corral back behind her house where she feeds the animals from her farm and yellow corn. She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 PEN to buy young pigs to fatten and sell for a higher price.

loans.use: to buy young pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Hilda Flor

texts.es:
Hilda Flor tiene 29 años de edad, vive en casa rentada tiene un hijo bajo su poder en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedicada al comercio de fruta, ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de fruta y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hilda Flor is 29 years old. She lives in a rented house with her son under her care in the district of Pucará, located in Jaén province, which belongs to Cajamarca Region in the North Andes of Peru. The people in this community work in the fruit business and raise livestock.

Hilda works selling seasonal fruit. Her business is located in the back part of her house. She has requested a loan of 3000 PEN to buy a greater quantity of fruit to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Juana Del Tráncito

texts.es:
Juana tiene 35 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con su madre que depende de sus ingresos. 

Ella es comerciante, es una mujer muy emprendedora capaz de lograr sus metas, se dedica al comercio de ropa, ya tiene más de 6 años de dedicarse al negocio, una tía que vendía ropa antes la motivó a dedicarse al comercio, dejándole el puesto y la oportunidad que se desempeñara como vendedora. No tiene más actividades a las que se dedique, el negocio lo tiene en el mercado del pueblo, la distancia que recorre es de un kilómetro diario, y se va a pie, con un horario de trabajo de 7:00 AM a 5:00 PM.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para poner a la venta, el mejoramiento que el préstamo le dará es el poder ofrecerles más variedad a los clientes, la necesidad satisfecha será el comprar por mayor  para ahorrar.

Ella sueña con tener primero lo más necesario para su madre, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida.
texts.en:
Juana, 35, studied through high school.  She's single and has no children.  She lives with her mother, who depends on her income.

Juana's a merchant.  She's very enterprising, capable of achieving her goals.  She makes a living selling clothing and has more than six years of experience in the business.  An aunt who used to sell clothes inspired her to work in the business, giving Juana her stall and the opportunity to work in sales. She doesn't have any other jobs.  Her business is in the town market.  She goes about a kilometer a day on foot to get there, working from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m.

She needs the loan to buy more merchandise to sell.  The improvement she'll derive from the loan is being able to offer her customers a greater variety.  It will satisfy her need to buy wholesale so she can save money.

Juana dreams of having what her mother most needs, so she hopes to always work as long as God gives her health and life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sati

texts.en:
Sati is a woman of 52 years. Her family consists of her husband and two sons.  They live in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Both Sati and her husband studied until grade eight.  Their sons were deprived of an education due to their poverty and now they are grown up and earn their means by driving cars.

Sati is a housewife and her husband Horigopal, 52 years old, runs a small restaurant in their locale. Sati is also involved in this business to assist her husband.  Foods like cooked rice, curry, dal, cold drinks, fish, meat etc. dishes are available in their restaurant.  The local people take their lunch and dinner at their restaurant. There is a high demand for their dishes in their area. Each and every person in their area relishes their quality food. There is no other restaurant in their locality so Soti and her husband decided to open their restaurant. Sati is a good cook. She directs the laborers to prepare various dishes and sometimes she cooks food for her customers with her own hands. 

Now with the increase of prices of essential commodities, the costs of ingredients of food such as oil, rice, potatoes, salt, sugar, flour, spices have also increased.  So they are facing difficulties in continuing the existing business and satisfying the demands of their customers. 

So, Sati applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase different ingredients and grocery items so they can go ahead with the business, earn a lot of profit and satisfy the demands of their customers.

Sati and her husband express their heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase necessary ingredients and grocery items for her restaurant business.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa tiene la edad de 44 años, habita en el municipio de El Sauce al lado de su padre y sus hermanas quienes dependen de ella. Es soltera y se desempeña como secretaria en una Institución de dicho municipio donde tiene más de veinte años de laborar.
Toda su vida se la ha dedicado a su familia y gracias a los distintos préstamos que le ha otorgado Kiva a través de Ceprodel ha mejorado las condiciones de su casa y resuelto problemas de salud donde hoy su familia tiene mejores condiciones de vida.
María Teresa es una hija bien preocupada y responsable en todo lo que se refiere a su padre, por este motivo en este momento tiene la necesidad de un préstamo para pagar consultas médicas y realización de exámenes que necesitan hacerle para controlar su enfermedad y no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para llevar a cabo este gasto.
Solicita a los inversionistas de Kiva que le apoyen con este financiamiento para mejorar la salud de su papá donde les agradece por esta noble causa.
texts.en:
María Teresa is 44 years old. She lives in the municipality of El Sauce with her father and her sisters who are dependent on her. She is single and works as a secretary at an institution in said municipality. She has been working there for more than 20 years.

All her life, she has devoted herself to her family. Thanks to the various loans that Kiva has awarded her through Ceprodel, her housing conditions have improved and health problems have been resolved. Now, her family has better living conditions.

María Teresa is a very concerned and responsible daughter in everything concerning her father. For this reason, at this time, she needs a loan to pay for doctor visits and testing that he needs to manage his illness. They do not have the resources necessary to pay for this expense. She is asking that Kiva lenders support her with this funding to improve her father's health. She is grateful for this noble cause.

loans.use: to pay for doctor visits and testing.

loans.name: Tito

texts.es:
Tito tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Chaupe, una zona rural del distrito de Querocotillo, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región, Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de maíz, lo comercializa en las comunidades aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de mayor cantidad de maíz para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Tito is 46 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the hamlet of Chaupe, a rural area in Querocotillo district.  Its population is devoted to farming, trade and cattle breeding. It is located in Cutervo Province belonging to the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountains of Perú.

Tito cultivates corn and sells it in communities adjacent to his district. He has requested a loan of S/.2,000 from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a larger quantity of corn to offer his customers and in this way generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of corn to offer his customers.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel is 38 years old and single.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Marivel is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marivel has been in the pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foliar sprays, manure and fertilizer to assist her crops.

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Bimala is a 40-year-old woman from the small village of Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district. She is married and is blessed with three children (two sons and one daughter). All are receiving education. They are in grade 10, grade 11 and grade 12.  Bimala and her husband, Paresh, both attended school until grade 10.

Bimala is a housewife, and her husband is a farmer. Her husband decided to farm, as they have their own land and her husband has experience in this field. He grows different vegetables in different seasons, but it does not provide much profit to run the family well. So, they have decided to cultivate rice paddy on their land. Being a staple food of the people, there is a great demand for rice in West Bengal. So, in the next monsoon, which is the suitable time to cultivate this crop, they want to start cultivation. They need financial help,

Bimala has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase seeds, pesticides and insecticides for the farming of rice paddy. After the harvest, they will sell the product in the wholesale market.

She hopes she will develop her business and with the profit, she can improve her family's condition and save money to buy an auto-rickshaw in the future.

She is thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva for the funding.

loans.use: to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Santiago Antonio

texts.es: Santiago tiene 26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeña hija de un año de edad. Santiago se gana la vida mediante la venta de fruta de forma ambulante y de esta forma mantiene la economía de su hogar y busca la forma de dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Santiago ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio de venta de frutas dado que desea incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para hacer la inversión en la compra de variedad de frutas como: piñas,sandía, melones, naranjas, etc. Espera poder lograr su objetivo y de esta forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Santiago is 26 years old and lives in his own house with his life companion and one year old daughter. Santiago make his living selling fruit on the streets and in this way he supports his household  and tries to find ways to improve the living conditions of the family. Santiago has taken the decision to invest in his fruit selling business by buying a variety of fruit like pineapples, watermelon, cantaloup, oranges, etc. He hopes to achieve his objective and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, watermelon, cantaloup, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Lakkhi

texts.en:
Lakkhi is an energetic and optimistic woman of only 28 years. She is married and lives with her husband and two school-going children in the small village of Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district. She is a housewife who attended school up to grade 8, whereas her husband has a secondary education. Their children are students of grades 3 and 6.

Lakkhi’s husband, Anutosh, is a farmer by profession. He has a small plot of land of his own. He works hard in his field from dawn to dusk to grow vegetables. His neighbours are his main customers, as he grows good-quality vegetables. But, due to the shortage of enough working capital, he is unable to grow varieties of vegetables.  So, his meager income is on the verge of being exceeded by their expenses, and it gets increasingly difficult to keep their children in school. At the same time, it is hardly possible to maintain the family household. They have now decided to cultivate jute, as it is a crop in great demand in the market.

Lakkhi heard about BJS and that they provide financial help to needy women to start businesses. So, Lakkhi is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase necessary agricultural inputs like seeds and fertilizers to cultivate jute. She hopes the new crop will provide them with good returns to overcome their financial hurdles. She dreams to construct a concrete-made house in the town.

She and her husband are thankful and grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating jute.

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Pramila is a young housewife of 37 years from the small village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri, where she lives with her husband, Suresh, and two children (one son and one daughter). Pramila got an education up to grade 10. Her husband is a farmer by profession. They are providing education to their children with great difficulty, as they cannot afford their educational expenses due to their poverty.

Pramila's husband has been involved in agricultural activities for more than ten years. He learned land cultivation from his parents, and now he has experience in this field. He grows different vegetables in different seasons. He grows quality products, and his customers are satisfied with his products as well as his polite behavior. But his biggest challenge is capital, because of which he is unable to diversify his business. As a result, it is hardly possible for him to make ends meet. Now he wants to cultivate sesame, which is a useful crop, but he lacks the capital.

Pramila wants to help her husband to fulfill his dream. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She wants to utilize the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation of sesame. This agribusiness is the only source of income for their family, so she wants to continue it. Moreover, sesame is a crop that has a lot of potential. So, she expects a good profit from it to look after her family's well-being.

In the future, she wants to increase her agribusiness. She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate sesame.

loans.name: Juvencio

texts.es:
Juvencio tiene 57 años de edad, vive en casa propia hace 2 años, en el distrito de Cañaris, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Ferreñafe que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a prestar servicios de elaboración de diferentes tipos de estructuras, cuenta con clientes de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de materiales como fierro y pintura y de esta manera seguir brindando este servicio.
texts.en:
Juvencio, age 57, has lived in his own house for two years.  The house is in the Cañaris district, which is in a community that devotes itself to agriculture, commerce and livestock.  It is in the Ferreñafe province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He provides the service of making different types of structures.  He has customers in his district.

He has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy materials like iron and paint.  This way he will continue providing this service.

loans.use: to buy materials like iron and paint.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
This is Ronel, 36, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines.  Coron is one of the affected areas in the Philippines when typhoon Haiyan hit last November 2013. He is married to Vilma, who is a therapist. He has three children and all of them are in school. A few months after the typhoon, Ronel’s business continues to recover and he and his wife are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Ronel maintains a tricycle business. He owned and drives one Tricycle unit (motor cycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He works from early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives the late evening until the wee hours in order to have a larger profit. His regular customers are their neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 300 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a loan of Ph 50,000. He will utilize the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. Ronel also owns a small variety store and likewise raises and sells pigs.

Ronel hopes to avail another tricycle unit and dreams of having their own house. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling personal products. Virginia is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

Virginia  has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Darna

texts.en:
Darna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell for her fish business.

Darna has been in this business for 2 years. Darna earns additional income from fishing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Darna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya aged, 51, is a responsible mother and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her first loan with the brac and Kiva as well. 
Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and selling it to the recycling factories. Nowadays due to household expenses he does not have cash in hand to buy scrap goods nor have scrap to sell for generating money.
Therefore, Suriya has requested a Kiva loan for her husband so he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 
It would be impressive and honorable support for her. She wishes to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, brac Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap goods for resale to the recycling factories.

loans.name: Marygin

texts.en:
Marygin is 38 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Marygin works very hard to provide for them.

Marygin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like rice, candies, coffee, milk, canned goods, diapers, sanitary pads, snack foods, etc. to sell.

Marygin has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items in her general store.  

Marygin would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, candies, coffee, milk, canned goods, diapers, sanitary pads, snack foods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Puspalata

texts.en:
Puspalata is 35 years old and a differently able lady. She lives in a small village in the Dhenkanal district of Odisha state, India with her father, two brothers and two sister-in-laws. She owns a grocery shop where she sells basic household items and makes a profit of 3,000 INR per month. Her father and both her brothers are farmers and they help Puspalata in her business.

Puspalata has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase of rice, sugar, flour, edible oil, toothpaste, spices etc. in bulk. She also wants to start a vegetable shop attached to her grocery shop to increase her customer base and make more profit. She is very happy and thankful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, flour, edible oil, toothpaste, and spices in bulk

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is 43 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is in school.

Segundina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Segundina requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Segundina has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Segundina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Santosh

texts.en:
Santosh is 29 years old and a differently able man who lives with his father, wife and three children in a small village in the Dhenkanal district of Odisha state, India. He has two sons and one daughter and all are in school. Santosh is a carpenter and engaged in a furniture-making business. He has involved three other carpenters in his shop to make furniture. He makes different types of furniture and sells it to the Dhenkanal city market. Currently, he is earning 8,000 INR per month, which is not sufficient for a family's monthly expenses when the family consists of six members, as he is the only person earning an income in his family.

Santosh has applied for a loan of 30,000 INR to purchase high quality wood, paints and advanced tools. He has a dream of opening a furniture showroom and workshop in a nearby market. He hopes to make a house for his family and wants to give a quality education to his children.

loans.use: to purchase high quality wood, paints and advanced tools

loans.name: Kaushalya

texts.en:
Kaushalya is 40, married and a loving mother of two children (one son and one daughter).  She has an elementary education and could not go for higher studies due to the poor economic resources of her parents.  Her husband Asaru, 43 years old, is a mason by profession. They are very much concerned about their children's education. Her son is in grade 12 and her daughter is in grade 10. They live in the small village of Bagnan in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Kaushalya’s husband is a mason by profession and has no steady income.  As a result, it has become very difficult to meet the household and educational expenses of his children with his meager income. So Kaushalya wants to start cultivation of jute on their own land to have higher earnings and fulfill her dreams of a more stable life.

Kaushalya has heard that BJS gives business loans to needy rural women.  So, she has taken a loan from them to buy high yield jute seeds, pesticides and manure.  She wants to start the cultivation as early as possible because the rainy season is at their doorstep, which is the ideal time for this crop.  She hopes the business will be a lucrative one and she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family and provide her children with a good platform for higher studies.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, pesticides and manure for jute cultivation.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Mercy has been in this business for eight years now.

Mercy has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina is 46 years old.  She is married, a housewife and a mother of four children (one son and three daughters). All her daughters are married. Their only son works as a laborer in a factory.  Mina attended school until grade eight but could not continue further studies due to poverty. She lives with her son and husband Nikhil, 50 years old, in the small village of Khagrabari in Jalpaiguri district.

Mina's husband is a street hawker.  He sells daily necessities like tubs, mugs, pitchers, cups etc. and earns for the household.  As he has grown old and feeble, it is a very tedious job for him.  As a result, his income can barely cover his family's household.

Mina is responsible, goal-driven and considerate.  She wants to do some income-generating work on her own.  She wants to start a milk supply business with the purchase of one dairy cow. She expects to get earnings by selling milk to her neighbors.

With this aim, she has asked for financial help from BJS to purchase a cow. She hopes the earnings from the business will bring financial sustenance for her family and give them a smooth life. She thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is a 43-year-old woman from the remote village of Bagnan in Jalpaiguri. She is married and is blessed with three children (two sons and one daughter) who are students. She studied up to grade 10 but could not study further due to her parent's lack of economic resources.

Namita’s husband works as a manager at a tea garden.  He earns so little that it is hardly sufficient to cover the basic needs of the family of five members, which includes three students. So at present, they are facing a financial crisis to make ends meet. They have a plot of ancestral land. They have decided to cultivate tea plants there.  Tea leaves are in good demand in West Bengal, so they are hopeful that their business will be a lucrative one and they can earn more profit from this business.

Namita is requesting a loan to buy inputs such as tea saplings, manure and fertilizers to start tea cultivation. With this support, she will be able to fulfill her mission. Her dream is to grow more tea plants so that she will be able to generate more income for the well being of her family and the future of her children.

She also wants to improve her crop a little every day to increase the variety and quality of her harvest.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase saplings and manure to grow tea leaves.

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
Nilima is 32 and lives in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and a housewife. Her family consists of her three children( one son and two daughters)and her husband. All the children are students and read in grades two, six and seven. She studied up to grade eight, but her husband Nikhil is illiterate and can only sign his name.

Nilima's husband is a rickshaw puller. A rickshaw is a kind of transport that is widely used in rural areas in India, especially in West Bengal. He carries people in his rickshaw to earn money to cover the expenses of his family's household. Very recently, the rickshaw was damaged in an accident.  As a result, his income has stopped and they are facing an acute financial crisis. They thought it over and have decided to purchase one new cycle-van but lack the capital.

Nilima heard that BJS gives financial assistance to rural women and she took a loan to purchase a new rickshaw for her husband.  This will allow her husband to carry on earning an income to strengthen their family's economy. She wants to buy more rickshaws to expand the business.

She and her husband give their hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Saúl

texts.es: Saúl tiene 56 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida. Saúl se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado desde hace 8 años. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos  y es lo que le permite llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y mantener la economía de su familia. Saúl solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea invertir en la compra de ganado para engordarlo y venderlo aun mejor precio. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Saúl is 56 years old and lives in his own house with his life companion. Saúl  has been buying and selling cattle for the past 8 years. This business is his principal source of income and it allows him to provide the daily sustenance  and maintain his family's economy. Saúl is requesting this loan from FUSAI as he wants to invest in buying cattle to fatten and sell them at a higher price. He hopes to get this loan and in this way increase his revenues and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale.

loans.name: Jenny Lota

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Jenny Lota works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and farming rice. Jenny Lota is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Jenny Lota has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Florterlita

texts.en:
Florterlita has been managing a vegetable garden business for more than eight years and earns good income from this. She also has a banana farm where she earns income for her family.  She had a previous loan from GDMPC  that she used to buy fertilizer. The loan was repaid successfully for her farm was managed well. 

Recently, she requested a new loan to buy organic fertilizer for her banana farm. She is hopeful that she will have an abundant harvest of produce in return for her investments. Florterlita plans to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is happily married and has five children. She is 58 years old. She is managing a store for income. She usually makes PHP 200 daily in selling grocery items. She has been in her business for over five years and now she is asking for additional capital to use in the business. She would like to add more goods that is why her loan of PHP 5,000 will be used in buying canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell. It will help increase sales capacity and gain good profits as well.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mildred is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Mildred has a food vending business in the Philippines. Mildred requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients,  including rice, meat, fish, noodles, and vegetables, for her food production business.

Mildred has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Mildred would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, including rice, meat, fish, noodles, and vegetables, for her food production business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 37 years old and married with four children.  With three children in school, Rosalie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and school supplies. 

In the future Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 41 years old and married with five children. 

Natividad is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Natividad requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Natividad has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Natividad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: José Simón

texts.es:
José de 66 años de edad, es agricultor en pequeño, en un tiempo estuvo acompañado pero por motivos personales él se separó de su compañera de vida, actualmente está soltero, tiene cinco hijos.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde hace cinco años,  esto lo aprendió de su padre que se dedica a la agricultura desde siempre, aparte de dedicarse a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y frijol también se dedica a realizar trabajos extras como por ejemplo ir a cortar leña, cada que alguien lo busca él va porque sabe que se gana su par de dólares y que en casa ya le sirven para la comida de sus hijos, el terreno donde él va a cultivar le queda a unos quince minutos de su casa,  así que se traslada caminando, sus hijos mayores le ayudan ya viene el tiempo donde les toca ir a limpiar el terreno para tenerlo preparado, su horario dice que es dependiendo cuanto trabajo tenga.


El préstamo será invertido en la preparación de la  tierra para la siembra, comprara abono, semilla, pesticidas, herbicidas, hoy que viene la época de invierno, con el apoyo de sus hijos no invierte en personas que le ayuden, pero si en los insumos agrícolas eso si le toca comprarlos para cultivar de esta manera tendrá con seguridad un inicio de la comidita para sus hijos y para él ya que su esposa lo abandono y a cargo de él están sus hijos.

Desea tener primero lo más necesario para la familia, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad que ahorita tiene de comprar los insumos para tener listo, ahora que ya viene el invierno tener preparado para iniciar a cultivar.
texts.en:
José, age 66, is a small scale farmer.  At one time he was in a relationship, but he separated from his life partner for personal reasons.  He is currently single, and he has five children.

José has been farming for five years.  He learned this from his father, who has been farming forever.  Besides growing corn and beans he also does extra jobs like cutting wood, for example.  Every time someone looks for him he goes because he knows that he will earn a couple of dollars that will be used for food for his children.  The land that he will cultivate is 15 minutes from his house.  He gets there by walking.  His older children help him when it is time to clear the field in order to have it prepared.  He says that his schedule depends upon how much work he has.

The loan will be invested in preparing the land for planting.  He will buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides and herbicides now that the winter season is approaching.  He will do this with the help of his children.  He does not pay people to help him.  However, he does invest in the agricultural supplies.  It behooves him to buy them in order to work the land.  This way he will securely have a start on the food for his children and for himself.  His wife abandoned him, and the children are under his care.

First of all, he wishes to have what is most needed by his family.  Therefore, he hopes to always work while God gives him health and life.  The loan will help him to satisfy the need that he now has to buy supplies in order to be ready.  Now that winter is coming he will be prepared to start cultivating.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 38 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

Raquel is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Raquel requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Raquel has been in pig fattening for 7 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Raquel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
Дилором мирная и законопослушная жительница города Кургантюбе. Она работает в детском саду. У нее двое детей школьного возраста, которых она воспитывает одна, так как мужа нет в живых. Дилором уже 42 года. Смыслом жизни для нее является ее дети, воспитанию которых она уделяет особое внимание. Она очень заботливая мать.
Дилором сейчас имеет проблемы со здоровьем зубов, она обратилась к зубному врачу и тот сказал, что срочно необходимо лечить зубы. Однако для лечения у нее нет финансовой возможности, поэтому она просит кредит. Этот кредит очень нужен ей. Дилором ожидает вашей поддержки.
texts.en: Dilorom is a peaceful and law-abiding citizen of the city of Qurgan-Tube. She works at a kindergarden. She has two school age children, who she is raising alone since her husband is no longer living. Dilorom is already 42 years old. She finds her life's meaning in her children, and she devotes her primary attention to raising them. She is a very caring mother. Dilorom is having dental health problems. The dentist she went to told her she needs to receive treatment immediately. However, she doesn't have money for the treatment, so she is asking for a loan. She really needs the loan. Dilorom is waiting for your support.

loans.use: pay for dental work

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin has been providing transportation in their community for more than six years. He earns well from this, in addition to his farm.

With his generated income, his previous loan, used for buying tires and accessories, was successfully repaid. He needs to buy a new helmet and rain coat for his transportation and he took a new loan from GDMPC recently to purchase his needs. He earns well but it is enough for their daily expenditures.
 
He wants to send his children to finish a course to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy a new helmet and rain coat

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children now at their school and infant age. 

She has been engaged in gardening activity, particularly in the flower and ornamental plants production business, for 10 years already. Arlene earns approximately PHP 5,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house improvements.  

Arlene has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Arlene hopes to expand her flower and ornamental plants production business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house improvements

loans.name: Naziramo

texts.ru: Назирамо живет и осуществляет свою деятельность в городе Куляб. Ей 53 года. Она по профессии педагог и работает в средней школе уже 15 лет. Назрамо замужем. Ее муж работает в жилищно-коммунальном хозяйстве. У них пятеро детей. Сыновьям по 28,25,24 лет, а дочерям по 27 и 21 год. Назирамо счастлива, что имеет хорошую семью. Ее дочери помогают ей в ее швейной деятельности. Назирамо одновременно занимается пошивом женских платьев и обучила этому ремеслу своих дочерей. Сейчас она планирует расширить деятельность  купить новую швейную машинку. Для реализации цели Назирамо просит кредит. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Naziramo lives and works in the city of Kulob. She is 53 years old. She is a teacher by training and has worked in a high school for 15 years already. Naziramo is married. Her husband works in housing and utility services. They have five children. Their sons are 28, 25, and 24 years old and their daughters are 27 and 21. Naziramo is happy that she has a good family. Her daughters help with the sewing business. Naziramo both sews women's dresses and teaches her daughters the craft. Now she is planning to expand her business by buying a new sewing machine. To do this, Naziramo is asking for a loan. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and grow her sewing business

loans.name: Neciforo

texts.en:
Neciforo raises livestock, primarily pigs, for sale.  He has been in this business for many years, earning good for the family, and was able to repay his previous loans successfully.  He used his previous loan to improve his piggery business. He also saved a portion of his revenue for his future needs. 

Recently, he requested a new loan to purchase feeding supplies. Neciforo hopes to improve his income in order to provide a better living for the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresita is 56 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Teresita has been in this business for nine years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 54 years old, married with five children. Two of her children are in school, and she is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Luciana requested a PHP 23,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her abaca weaving business.

Luciana has been in this business for twenty-two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is a widowed woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Agustina is 44 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Agustina requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Agustina has been in this business for five years. In the future, Agustina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosyl

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosyl works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Rosyl is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy gasoline, a fishing net, and other fishing materials  for her fishing business.

Rosyl has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, a fishing net, and other fishing materials

loans.name: Izatmo

texts.ru:
Изатмо одна из жительниц маленького городка Куляб. Как и для многих женщин для Изатмо главное семья, дети и домашний уют. У нее двое детей. Сыну 27 лет. Дочери 29 лет. Она танцует в этнографическом ансамбле. Изатмо гордится своей дочерью. У нее потрясающий талант. 
   Изатмо сама занимается торговлей одежды и хозяйственных товаров. Ей 63 года и около 10 лет она работает именно в этой сфере деятельности. Изатмо покупает товары оптом и перепродает их в далеких селах и деревень. Таким образом она помогает жителям которым трудно добраться до города за вещами. На данный момент ей необходимо приобрести новые товары для перепродажи. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Поддержите Изатмо.
texts.en: Izatmo is one of the residents of the small city of Kulob. Like many women, Izatmo's priorities are family, children, and household comfort. She has two children: her son is 27 years old and her daughter is 29. The daughter dances in a traditional ethnic ensemble. Izatmo is proud of her daughter. She has tremendous talent.
