Izatmo herself sells clothing and household goods. She is 63 years old and has worked in this sphere for about 10 years. Izatmo buys goods wholesale and resells them in remote towns and villages. In this way she helps residents who have a hard time getting to the city for shopping. She currently needs to buy new goods to sell. To do this, she is asking for a loan. Support Izatmo.

loans.use: To buy goods for resale

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 58 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children who are now at their adult age. 

She is engaged in managing a little store and has been selling groceries and other consumable products for 20 years already. She is also engaged in the hog raising activity. Loreta earns approximately PHP 5,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house improvement and the rest for additional capital for her existing sari-sari store. 

Loreta has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Loreta hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house improvement and to have additional capital for her existing sari-sari store

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. Jinky earns more income from fishing.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, soap, etc., for her general store business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business.

Jinky has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs like fertilizer, manure, herbicides, etc to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Adelinda

texts.en:
Adelinda is 53 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, detergent soap, noodles, canned goods, etc., to sell.
,
Adelinda has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, detergent soap, noodles, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Promodini

texts.en:
Promodini is a 55-year-old, rural housewife from the village of Bagnan in Jalpaiguri district. She has an incomplete education of secondary level. Due to poverty, she could not continue her studies. She is married and a mother of three grown-up children (one son and two daughters). Their children are married. Her husband Gobindo, aged 58 years, is a laborer on daily wages.   

Promodini's husband does not have a steady income. So, he cannot cover all the household expenses with his small income. Moreover, he is beyond the age of work.  He has grown old and feeble. So, it has now become impossible to run the family.

Now Promodini wants to help her husband financially by cultivating tea plants in their agricultural field. She learnt the agricultural trade at a very early age from her parents. She wants to utilize her experience. She plans to cultivate and sell the tea leaves in the local market and in the stores of the city.

So, she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase tea saplings, good manure and other necessary agricultural inputs.
Her goals are to improve her quality of life and strengthen her assets for her family. The agricultural inputs will help her to maintain healthy tea plants in this season and provide good revenue to fulfill her goals.

She is thankful to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs like saplings, manure, etc. to cultivate tea leaves.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima belongs to a remote village, Madhabdanga, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a very young married woman of 24 years. Her family consists of her husband and their only son. Their son is too young for school. Purnima has an education until grade 9 and could not go for higher study because of her family's poor economic resources. After her marriage with Manotosh, she is now a housewife.

Purnima's husband is engaged in paddy rice cultivation. He grows paddy on his own farmland. The income from the business is not sufficient to meet the family's expenditures, and with the daunting responsibilities, he is finding it difficult to run the household. He wants to take on additional paddy cultivation to have a sustainable income and also to give their son a good education.

With the aim to help her husband in cultivation, Purnima is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BJS. She will utilize the loan to purchase high-quality paddy seeds, fertilizers and manure. This will increase the production as well as earnings, and she will be able to fulfill the dream of a secure future for her family. She hopes to buy new farmland from her savings in the future.

Purnima and her husband really thank the investors (BJS and Kiva) for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and paddy seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and bags, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Parvona

texts.ru: Парвона 24-летняя замужняя женщина. Она рано вышла замуж. Ее старшему сыну сейчас 8 лет, младшему сыну 5 лет, а дочери 6 лет. Парвона у себя дома занимается швейным делом. Она по заказу клиентов шьет национальные женские платья разных фасонов. Этой деятельностью она занимается последние 4 года. Парвона со своей семьей живет в столице, в городе Душанбе. Муж работает, старший сын учится в школе, остальные дети еще маленькие и сидят дома с матерью. Парвона в данный момент намеревается приобрести еще одну швейную машинку, чтобы расширить деятельность. Поэтому она берет кредит. Планы Парвоны на будущее - открыть возле дома собственной ателье.
texts.en: Parvona is a 24 year old, married woman. She got married early. Her oldest son is now eight years old, the youngest is 5, and her daughter is 6. Parvona runs her sewing business from home. She sews traditional women's dresses to order in various styles. She has done this work for the past four years. Parvona and her family live in the capital, the city of Dushanbe. Her husband works, her oldest son is in school, and the other kids are young and still at home with her. Parvona is currently planning to get another sewing machine, to expand her work. This is why she is requesting a loan. Her plans for the future are to open a dressmaking studio near the house.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine to develop her sewing business

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es: Nataly es una  joven mujer emprendedora de 28 años de edad la cual tiene un pequeño hijo de 6 años de edad. Comenzó su negocio de elaboración de pizzas ante la urgencia de generar ingresos en el hogar puesto que su esposo gana un salario mínimo y en ocasiones se ven muy ajustados para cancelar la totalidad de sus cuentas. Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos de pizzería con los cuales al igual que sus pizzas le ayudara a moldear un futuro creciendo como empresa, como empresaria y como ser humano
texts.en:
Nataly, 28, is an enterprising young woman who has a small child, age 6.

She started her business making pizza when she urgently needed to generate income for her household.  Her husband earns a minimal salary and sometimes it's very tight to pay all their bills.

Nataly's requesting a loan to buy pizzeria supplies so her pizzas will help her to grow as a business, as a businesswoman, and as a human being.

loans.use: to buy pizzeria supplies such as dough, sausage, vegetables, and cheese

loans.name: Rosa Emerita

texts.es:
Rosa de 41 años de edad,  es una persona que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que los padres no tenían la facultad como mantenerle el estudio.  Esta acompañada el esposo se dedica a la agricultura, ellos han procreado tres hijos en esta relación,  dos de ellos están en la escuela y uno que ya está en hogar aparte;  Rosa solo vive  con los dos hijos  y el esposo.

Rosa  trabaja desde hace tres años vendiendo tortillas en el mercado, ella en vista que no puede encontrar otro trabajo por no poder leer le solicito trabajo a una amiga y le ha dado a cargo un puesto de tortillas. Ella para llegar a este trabajo hace 25 minutos y viaja a pie; pero también Rosa vende productos por catálogo, cuando ella sale del trabajo de la venta de tortilla les ofrece esos productos.  Ella en el puesto de las tortilla esta de las 6 am a las 2 pm

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar productos por catálogo, como lociones, cremas, ropa, cosméticos, ya que ella hace los pedidos y luego se queda vendiéndolos  a las personas que les guste los productos,  lo que más vende son lociones y tintes para el cabello y esto le da más ingresos a ella que poder andar presentándolos en la revista.
texts.en:
Rosa is 41 years old and is somebody who did not have the chance to study, as her parents did not have the possibility to provide her with an education. She has a husband who works in agriculture. They have three children -- two of them are in school and another one has his own home. Rosa only lives with her two children and husband. 

Rosa has worked for three years selling tortillas in the market. As she could not find a job because she cannot read, she asked a friend for work and this friend gave her a tortilla stand. It takes her 25 minutes to get to this job, as she walks. Rosa also sells catalog products, which she offers after finishing work at the tortilla stand. She works at the tortilla stand from 6:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. 

She is requesting this loan to buy catalog products to sell, such as lotions, creams, clothes, and cosmetics. She places the orders and sells the products later to people who like them. What she sells most are lotions and hair dyes, which give her a larger income.

loans.use: to buy catalog products to sell, such as lotions, creams, clothes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Isirma Yaneth

texts.es:
Isirma de 21 años de edad, es una joven que está estudiando segundo año de bachillerato a distancia,  aun esta soltera, ella está viviendo con los padres y dos hermanos por lo tanto solo el papá y la mamá dependen de ella


Isirma está trabajando actualmente en un comedor donde vende pupusas,  ella se dedica a esto desde hace dos años,  ella decidió trabajar en este lugar para mantenerse ella misma los estudios;  ya que los padres por el nivel de pobreza no ajustaron a ponerla al bachillerato pero ella ha decidido esforzarse mucho y poder seguir estudiando este año si DIOS  le permite podrá graduarse. 

 Este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la casa y viaja en bus,  este trabajo lo hace de las 6 am a la 1 pm de lunes a viernes ya que el sábado ella estudia. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar tres sacos de abono y un litro de veneno, alquilaran la parcela donde sembrara el maíz,  ya la tienen pero con el préstamo la terminaran de pagar esto le ayudara mucho ya que con el sueldo que tiene en la pupuseria no le ajusta para darle de una sola vez el dinero, pero así comprara todo para la agricultura.

Los sueños que tiene es siempre poder seguir estudiando,  poder prepararse académicamente,  conseguir un buen trabajo y ayudarle a sus padres.
texts.en:
Isirma, 21, is a young woman who's in her second year of college study via distance learning.  She's still single and living with her parents and two siblings, and only her mother and father depend on her.

Isirma is currently working in a restaurant where she sells pupusas [stuffed tortillas].  She has done this work for two years.  She decided to work in this place to support herself in her studies.  Her parents, because of their level of poverty, could not send her to school.  However, she has decided to work hard so she can keep on studying this year and, God willing, she'll be able to graduate.

Her job is about 15 minutes from her house on the bus.  She works from 6 a.m. until 1 p.m. from Monday through Friday, because she studies on Saturday.

The loan she's requesting from CrediCampo is to buy three sacks of soil amendments and a liter of poison.  They'll rent the plot of land where she'll grow the corn.  They already have it but with the loan she'll finish paying.  This will help her a lot because the salary she earns making pupusas doesn't give her enough money all at once.  That way she'll buy everything for the farming.

Her dreams are to be able to keep on studying, get an education, get a good job, and help her parents.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of soil amendments and a liter of poison, and to rent a plot of land

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Мухаббат порядочная, добрая и общительная женщина. Замужем. Мать троих детей. Ей 47 лет. Муж Мухаббат Исроил и их старший сын  уехали в Российскую федерацию на заработки. Сама Мухаббат занимается торговлей, она на центральном рынке района продает женские и мужские обуви. Мухаббат товары привозит с города. Но кроме этого она еще дома шьет национальные платья для женщин. Она на протяжение двадцати лет занимается шитьем. Ей очень нравиться шить национальные платья с разными фасонами. 
Мухаббат и ее семья усердно трудились чтобы достроить свой дом. Мухаббат всегда мечтала жить в красивых домах со всякими удобствами для этого она  копила деньги  для установки пластиковых окон и дверей. На данное время установка пластиковых окон и дверей стало очень модно и удобно. Но это не главное преимущества пластиковых окон. Эти окна и двери дослуживающие, сохраняет в комнате теплоту, что не мало важно для человека, особенно в холодное время года. Мухаббат для покупки пластиковых окон и дверей не хватила денежных средств, поэтому она подала заявку на кредит. Мухаббат заранее  благодарна организации Арванд за своевременную оказанную помощь и надеется на долгосрочную сотрудничество с Арванд.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is an honest, good and sociable woman. She is 47 years old, married and the mother of three children. Her husband Isroil and her oldest son have left to work in Russia. Muhabbat herself sells men's and women's shoes at the district's central market. Muhabbat bring the goods in from the city. In addition, she also sews traditional women's dresses from her home. She has been doing this for the past 12 years. She enjoys sewing the dresses in various styles. 

Muhabbat and her family worked indefatigably to build their home. She always dreamed of living in a beautiful home with every comfort. To do this she has been saving money to install plastic rimmed windows and doors. These plastic windows and doors have become very popular and convenient recently. But this isn't their main benefit. These doors and windows are useful: they keep heat in, which is quite important for humans, especially in the cold winter months. Muhabbat doesn't have the money to buy the windows and doors so she has applied for a loan. She thanks the organization Arvand in advance for the timely assistance, and hopes to continue to work with them.

loans.use: purchase and install plastic windows and doors

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro tiene 54 años de edad vive en la comunidad de el sardinal desde la edad de 9 años, el estudio en la escuela de la comunidad hasta tercer grado de primaria aprendió lo básico  como es leer y escribir dice que hubiera deseado haber podido ser un profesional pero lamentablemente no fue posible ya que el era el único hijo varón y se dedico a trabajar con su padre en labores del campo siembra de granos besicos y hortalizas, también trabajaba en haciendas en las temporadas de corte de café para ganar dinero extra y asi comprar sus cosas personales. Cuando cumplió 18 años dice que fue reclutado para cumplir con el servicio militar que era algo obligatorio en esos tiempos, Da gracias a Dios por que regreso con vida fueron tiempos muy difíciles. hoy el tiene sus manzanas de tierras  las que cultiva y le generan ingresos para sobrevivir y apoyar a su madre . En esta Comunidad viven a oscuras se iluminan con candiles por las noches , Hoy dice estar contento porque tiene la posibilidad de hacer un préstamo para comprar un sistema solar asi el podra tener luz en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Pedro is 54 years old. He has lived in the Sardinal community since he was 9 years old. He studied in public school until the third grade in elementary school; he learned the basics like reading and writing and says he wishes he could have become a professional but regrettably this wasn’t possible as he was the only male child and had to work with his father in agricultural labor like planting basic staple grains and vegetables. He also worked in ranches during the coffee harvesting season to earn extra money and thereby buy personal items.

When he turned 18, he was recruited for the military service which was mandatory in those times. He thanks God for coming back alive in those difficult times. 

Today he has his land with apples that he tends to, and they generate income to survive and to support his mother. In this community they live in darkness. today he says he e is happy to have the chance to get a loan to buy a solar panel system to have light in the house where he lives.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel system

loans.name: Aurora Del Carmen

texts.es: 5 años de experiencia hacen constar del buen desempeño y éxito que ha tenido la señora Aurora en la venta de productos por catálogo los cuales los venden desde la comodidad de su casa y realiza visita a sus clientes más frecuente. Madre de 2 hijos la señora aurora siempre está buscando la oportunidad de mejorar en bien a sus dos retoños y es por esto que solicita un crédito para la compra de una vitrina más grande en el cual pueda ofrecer más variedad de productos y surtirla buscando siempre atraer nuevos “familiares”, es así como Aurora llama a sus clientes puesto que una vez que comprar se quedan con ella tanto tiempo que entablan una bonita relación y es este la razón de su éxito, con el crédito no solo se benefician sus clientes que tendrá mas variedad de productos si no La señora aurora y sus dos hijos la cual se trazó un sueño y es montar su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Five years of experience make up the good performance and success that Aurora has had selling catalogue products, which she sells from the comfort of her home and visiting her most regular customers.

The mother of two children, Aurora is always looking for the opportunity to improve her two little ones.  This is why she's requesting a loan to buy a bigger display case so she can stock and sell a wider variety of products.  She's always looking to attract new family members, as Aurora calls her customers.  Once they buy from her they stay with her so long that they start a nice relationship, which is the reason for her success.

With this loan not only will her customers benefit because they'll have more product variety, so will Aurora and her two children, because she planned a dream to set up her own store.

loans.use: to buy a display case and a variety of products, as seen in the photo

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a 61-year-old widow living in Jimenez-Butuay, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines.  She has 5 children who are now adult aged.  Paulina has been engaged in a snack vending business for the past 5 years earning approximately 3,000 PHP each month in this business.  

Paulina has requested a loan to be used for purchasing construction materials for house improvements.  She has been a member of PMPC for almost 9 years.  In the future, Paulina hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Ma. Tessie

texts.en:
Ma. Tessie is 46 years old and married with two children.

Ma. Tessie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Tessie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en: A micro-entrepreneur, Guillerma is 67 years old and married from Oroquieta City. She is tending her sari-sari store selling basic commodities. The start-up capital came from PMPC and she took several loans for revolving funds as well. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase canned goods, laundry soap, oil and sugar to sell. Guillerma hopes to save more to have her house repaired.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, laundry soap, oil and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is 55 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with eight children who are now at their adult and school ages. Susana has been engaged in operating a little sari-sari store for five years, and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work.  She is also engaged in hog raising activities. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing three piglets and three sacks of feed. She will use the remaining amount for her sari-sari store. Susana has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her hog raising and sari-sari store businesses.

loans.use: to purchase three piglets and three sacks of feed.

loans.name: Allah Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Allah Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store. Allah Joy is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and has now requested an additional loan to build her business further.

Allah Joy has been sustaining her business activities through the past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 54 years old and married with four children.  With one child still in school, Amelita works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soft-drinks, biscuits, canned goods, dried fish, cooking oil, and noodles to sell.  Amelita has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, biscuits, canned goods, dried fish, cooking oil, and noodles.

Amelita successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft-drinks, biscuits, canned goods, dried fish, cooking oil, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Remedios works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Remedios is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to make dried fish for her dried fish-making business.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loans, and now has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Analyn works hard to support her family. She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Analyn is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her abaca weaving business. Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en: Bernarda is 52 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Bernarda has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her weaving business. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Bernarda has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Bernarda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Felicidad works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling recycled materials business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Felicidad is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more recycled materials.

Felicidad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Carmelita has been in this business for six years now.

Carmelita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like abaca fiber, rope, etc. for her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Carmelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like abaca fiber, rope, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anna Theresa

texts.en:
Anna Theresa is 47 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has five children now, school and infant age. 

Anna Theresa has been engaged in managing a gasoline station business for four years already. She earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing stock of gasoline and diesel fuel for sale. 

Anna Theresa has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to expand her gasoline station business.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing gasoline and diesel fuel.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio previously accessed a PHP 51,000 loan that he used to purchase more quantity of fish to expand his product inventory. Florencio's earnings were a big help for his children’s education, and his family's personal, household and business expenditures.

To be able to expand his inventory further, Florencio is requesting another PHP 53,000 loan. He will use the loan to pay for additional fish he needs in his business. The more variety of fish displayed at his stall, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Florencio's earnings from the business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs, his children's education and other expenses. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Florencio hopes that his family will always live abundantly and he dreams to prosper in his business. Florencio meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish for his business.

loans.name: Ceriza

texts.en:
Ceriza is a 41-year-old married woman with seven children. Three of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ceriza has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Ceriza requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more abaca fiber for her weaving business.

Ceriza has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ceriza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more abaca fiber for her weaving business

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 31 years old and married with one child, who is currently in school. Connie works very hard to provide for them.

Connie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, fabric conditioners, shampoo, cooking oil, body soap, etc. to sell.

Connie has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, fabric conditioners, shampoo, cooking oil, body soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 55-year-old married woman with seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Delia has a tobacco retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of tobacco to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 15 years.  In the future, Delia would like to save enough money in order to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Crecelyn

texts.en:
Crecelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Crecelyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and tools for her business. She has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Crecelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Deborah works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from boarding house rental.  Deborah is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, chips, etc. for her general store business.

Deborah successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Deborah has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, chips, etc.

loans.name: Dionelyn

texts.en:
Dionelyn is 37 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Dionelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Dionelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Dionelyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sanitary pads, diapers, toothpaste, cereals, coffee, sugar, etc. 

In the future, Dionelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 45 years old and married with one child.

Rebecca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rebecca has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from an internet café.

Rebecca aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita is 46, married and has only one child. She lives in a rural community and manages a small retails store. She and her husband aim for a happy and successful life someday. They help each other in generating income to cover their necessities and save for their future. Jovita wants to improve her retail store to increase her income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail a loan of PHP15,000.00 to buy more stocks of noodles, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps,snack foods and soft drinks to sell. Through patience and strong determination, she believes that she will make her dreams into reality.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of noodles, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps, snack foods and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: John Paul

texts.en: John Paul is a native of Nampicuan Nueva Ecija. His father works as a tricycle driver while his mother focuses on taking care of him and his siblings while doing the household chores. At 22 years of age, John Paul realizes that he should finish a college education to help him find a permanent job and a better future. He also believes that he can help his family financially with a college diploma. Because of \that, he wants to enroll in Microfinance Technology Course. However, due to financial constraints he is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders thru ASKI for PHP40,000 to pay for his tuition fee. John Paul hopes that the kind-hearted lenders will approve his loan request.

loans.use: pay his tuition

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, egg, milk, chips, etc for her general store business.

Letecia has been in this business for 10 years. Letecia earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, egg, milk, chips, etc

loans.name: Emerlita

texts.en:
Emerlita works hard to support her family. Emerlita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Emerlita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Emerlita has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Emerlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Swardana

texts.en:
Swardana is a 29 year-old housewife and is married to her 33 year-old husband Mus. They have three children, a 13 year-old who is in the 2nd year of Junior High School, a 7 year-old who is in the 2nd grade of Elementary School and a 4 year-old.
 
Swardana’s husband works as a fisherman. Swardana’s husband has one boat which he uses to catch fish. As a result of his catches, his income has grown. In order to generate more income, Swardana has saved some money to buy one more boat but still need more cash to afford the new one. Therefore, she has submitted a loan application amounting to IDR 4.500.000 from TLM. Swardana is now in her 2nd loan cycle. She had a good repayment record for her first TLM loan. The loan will be spent on pieces of plank for the boat’s body.

loans.use: to buy wood planks for a fishing boat

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, soy sauce, vinegar, coffee, etc. for her general store business. Susan has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, soy sauce, vinegar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 41 years old, married with six children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Carolina has a recycled materials business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more recycled materials.

Carolina has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials.

loans.name: Nueva Picaflor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA PICAFLOR” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Josefina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de sombreros, tienda de barrio, venta de artefactos electrónicos, venta de papa, chuño y tunta (papa deshidratada), venta de legía, tejido de manta de, venta de empanadas, taller de cerrajería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Josefina es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio al observar la necesidad de ella y de sus vecinos de contar con un espacio de comercio cercano a su domicilio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, los ahorros, el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen no se encuentra una de las socias, ya que por razones personales decide no salir en la imagen.
texts.en: The "Nueva Picaflor" group will be starting its third loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer from its center in Senkata. The group consists of eight members and has a board of directors with Josefina as president. The members' businesses are varied and include selling hats, running a neighborhood store, selling electronics, selling potato products, selling bleach, weaving blankets, selling empanadas, and locksmithing. The loan will benefit these small businesses, including Josefina's. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, joining on the invitation of a girl friend who is a fellow member. Currently, Josefina runs a neighborhood store. She started the business after seeing a need for one in her neighborhood. She plans to use the loan to increase her working capital and purchase groceries wholesale from the farmers markets in El Alto to later sell in her store. This work will allow her to generate income to support her family, since she is married and has seven children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Josefina responded that she likes the loans, the savings, the clean environment and the training offered at the institution. In the photo, one of the members isn't pictured for personal reasons.

loans.use: to purchase groceries wholesale

loans.name: Jonny

texts.es:
Jonny es soltero y vive en la Ciudad de Chincha en su casa propia.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica al negocio de transporte y le va muy bien debido a que es un hombre trabajador.
Sus compañeros de trabajo afirman que es una persona muy amable, responsable y emprendedora por lo que tienen una buena relación con él. 
Jonny está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado él podrá comprar electrodomésticos para amueblar su casa y así podrá cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños: “Mejorar su calidad de vida y mejorar su vivienda”.
texts.en: Jonny is single and lives in his own home in the city of Chincha. For the past five years he has made a living in transportation, and it is going very well since he is a hard worker. His co-workers attest that he is a very friendly, responsible and enterprising person with whom they have a good relationship. Jonny is grateful for Kive lenders because with your support he will able to purchase household appliances to furnish his home and thus fulfill one of his biggest dreams: improving his home and his quality of his life.

loans.use: to purchase household appliances

loans.name: Assion

texts.fr:
En 2013, Assion  aujourd’hui  âgé de 28 ans ouvre  un moulin .Professeur d’anglais de profession, il mène cette activité secondaire pour arrondir ses fins de mois. Il a engagé une personne pour la cause. Célibataire et sans enfants,  son goût  pour le travail  et les horaires avantageuses   de son moulin pour les ménages augmentent sa clientèle. Avec ce premier crédit, Assion veut étendre  ses services, il veut installer un nouveau moulin et  payer les frais d’installation d’électricité.
 Avec ce  crédit de 450000FCFA sur une durée de 12mois Assion espère épargner au maximum pour enfin bâtir solidement un foyer.
texts.en:
Assion, who is 28 years old, opened a mill in 2013. He is a professor of English, but took on this secondary job to supplement his income. He has hired one person to help him. He is single and has no children. His taste for work and his mill’s attractive hours have helped grow his client base.

With this first loan, Assion would like to expand his services. He would like to install another mill and pay for initial installation and electricity. With this loan for 450,000 FCFA over 12 months, Assion would like to save as much as he can to solidly establish his household.

loans.use: to buy a new mill.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Evelia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her abaca weaving business. She has been in this business for 41 years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her abaca weaving business

loans.name: Armie

texts.en:
Armie is 32 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines, and she is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling cashews.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 48-year-old woman with five children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Evelyn has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for 28 years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business

loans.name: Jose Gregorio

texts.es:
José, utilizo el préstamo anterior para abastecer con la materia prima necesaria el inventario de la panadería, mejorar la calidad, productividad y servicio. Su situación económica le permite dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida y cancelar puntualmente las cuotas de su deuda.
La demanda de sus productos es mayor y necesita tener materia prima suficiente para no descontinuar su trabajo, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de harinas, azúcar, aceite, manteca, pasas, levadura, latas, huevos, canela y otros.
texts.en: José used his previous loan to stock up on necessary ingredients for his bakery and to improve his quality of life, productivity and service. His financial situation has allowed him to give his family a better lifestyle and payoff debt. Demand for his products is growing, and he needs to purchase enough supplies so as not to interrupt his work. He is requesting the loan to purchase flour, sugar, oil, lard, raisins, yeast, tins, eggs, cinnamon and other items.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, oil, lard, raisins, yeast, tins, eggs, cinnamon and other items

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 54 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Lourdes has a blacksmith business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her business. She has been in this business for twenty-seven years. 

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her blacksmith business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell, ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried fish vending. Fe is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear, such as pants, shorts, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to sell in her business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear pants, shorts, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 35, living with her two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is providing services for polishing newly constructed floors. He polishes the concrete and marble floors. For this purpose he uses a floor polishing machine. He has been providing this service for many years. A few days ago his polishing machine broke due to a fluctuation in electricity. To continue his floor polishing services, he wants to buy a new machine but he does not have enough savings.

Therefore, Naseem requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy a new polishing machine. In this way he can continue his services well. Naseem is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a floor polishing machine for marble work.

loans.name: Anagban

texts.fr:
Bè est un quartier au centre-ville de Lomé capitale du Togo, avec un marché dans le quel Anagban étale ses produits fruitiers depuis 2012. Depuis 1982 et même à l’âge de 52 ans, Anagban  n’abandonne pas la vente ambulante dans les quartiers environnants et au grand marché de Lomé. 
Anagban a 3 enfants, suite à la perte d’emploi de son mari, elle a la charge des besoins domestiques et ne cherche qu’à augmenter ses bénéfices afin de réaliser un bénéfice pouvant lui permettre de les prendre en charge. Manque de soutien, elle s’accroche au crédit qui momentanément lui permet d’avoir une stabilité financière. Ainsi elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de mangue et d’avocat.
texts.en:
Bè is a neighborhood in central Lomé, the capital of Togo. There, there is a market where Anagban has been displaying her fruit since 2012. Since 1982, and even at 52 years old, Anagban still sells on foot in the area around the Lomé Grand Market.

Anagban has three children, and after the loss of her husband's job, she is in charge of the household needs. She is looking to increase her income in order to make a profit and help her meet those needs. Without support, she depends on this loan that can give her more financial stability. She is asking for this loan to reinforce her stock of mangoes and avocados.

loans.use: to buy six baskets of mangoes and two baskets of avocados.

loans.name: Amé

texts.fr:
Amé est logée gratuitement dans une maison familiale avec son mari et ses 3 enfants et a la chance d’avoir une débenture lui permettant d’exposer ses produits depuis l’an 2000 où elle avait commencé le commerce d'Akpan glacé, une appellation locale qui est le mélange de la boule d’akassa, de l’eau, du sucre et de la glace. En 2007 elle n’arrivait plus à résister à la chaleur du feu qui dégage lors de la préparation de la boule d’akassa, elle décide alors de faire le petit commerce des produits divers.
Amé ne se lance pas dans ses activités sans avoir étudier préalablement l’environnement dans lequel elle se trouve, c’est ce qui lui a permis tout comme la première activité d’avoir une clientèle importante.

Ce crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter  d’acheter 2 cartons de biscuit sucre et 3 cartons de biscuits salé.
texts.en: Amé lives rent-free in a home with her husband and three children. She is lucky to have loan that has allowed her to display her products since 2000. She started out by selling frozen akpan, a local beverage that is a mix of akassa (corn flour porridge), water, sugar, and ice. In 2007, she was tired of dealing with the heat of the fire that comes with preparing akassa, so she decided to sell various other items. Amé doesn't jump into businesses without learning a lot about her environment. This helped her acquire a large client base with her first business. This loan will help her buy two boxes of sweet biscuits and three boxes of salty biscuits.

loans.use: buy five boxes of biscuits.

loans.name: Masan

texts.fr:
Commerçante d’œuf depuis 1990 et de couche jetable depuis 2000, Masan est aussi femme au foyer avec 5 enfants. Agée de 39 ans, elle habite en couple dans le quartier Tokoin à Lomé dans leur maison dont elle exerce pour son activité. Elle a un niveau d’étude moyen qui lui permet d’aller au-delà des frontières pour s’approvisionner en couches jetable d'origine ghanéennes. 
Voulant réduire sa fréquence d’approvisionnement à une fois tous les 2 mois au lieu de une fois par mois elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter un des produits supplémentaires de couche de marque SANY  et autres.
texts.en:
An saleswoman of eggs since 1990 and of disposable diapers since 2000, Masan is also a housewife with five children. She is 39 years old and lives with her husband in a home the Tokoin neighborhood of Lomé where she also runs her business. She has a decent level of education, which allows her to cross the border to buy disposable diapers from Ghana.

She wants to reduce her restocking frequency to twice a month, so she is asking for a loan to buy extra Sany brand and other diapers.

loans.use: to buy 9 packages of disposable diapers.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 44 years old, married and lives with her family. She has a retail store serving several customers. She sells assorted groceries and beverages to generate additional income while her husband works as a welder.

Alma has five years experience in this field. She works hard in order to meet their needs.

Alma requested this loan to buy additional goods and bottled products to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and be able to provide a better living for the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional goods and bottled products to sell

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es:
Adriana es una emprendedora mujer de 49 años con vasta experiencia en diferentes campos.
Ella tiene un negocio multifacético ya que tiene una tienda de abarrote de lunes a viernes, los fines de semana vende licor en su establecimiento y de igual modo ofrece el servicio de billar.
Es una mujer trabajadora y genera empleo a una persona todos los días.
Ella desea aumentar su capital de trabajo y tener un inventario de productos mucho más nutrido para ofrecer a sus clientes, por esta razón pide un auxilio económico para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y así abastecer sus estanterías con multiplicidad de productos.
Su principal desafío es la situación económica y la ejecución de unas obras al frente de su negocio.
texts.en:
Adriana, 49, is an entrepreneur with vast experience in different fields.  She has a multi-faceted business since she runs a grocery store Monday through Friday, sells liquor on the weekends and also has a billiard game activity.

She is a hard-working woman and employs one other person every day.

She wants to increase her work capital and stock a wider variety of products for her customers, so she is requesting support to buy staple goods to stock her shelves with different products.

Her biggest challenge is her economic situation and the fact that there is construction work going on right outside her business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of staple goods for her business.

loans.name: Armando Diego

texts.es:
Armando estudia mecatronica industrial en un instituto técnico, es un alumno muy aplicado y con gran deseo de superación. Su familia es de condición económica humilde, sus padres son profesores en un colegio nacional y ganan muy poco, en el Perú es una profesión muy mal remunerada, ellos hacen un gran esfuerzo para poder solventar los estudios de Armando, sin embargo no podrán continuar haciéndolo debido a problemas económicos de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Armando se encuentra cursando su tercer semestre y esta a la mitad de culminar sus estudios, el desea poder continuarlos para ser un buen profesional, es por esto que se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva por ayudarlo a cumplir con éxito esta meta y por apostar por la educación de miles de jóvenes en todo el mundo.
texts.en:
Armando is studying industrial mechatronics at a technical institute.  He is a hard-working student who is determined to get ahead.  He is from a humble family as his parents are teachers at a national school and earn very little.  In Peru, this profession is not well paid.  They make a great effort to pay for Armando's education but are unable to continue doing so without the support of Kiva lenders.

Armando is in his third semester and halfway through his education.  He wants to be able to continue in order to become a good professional, so he is very grateful to Kiva lenders who are helping him reach his goal successfully and supporting the education of thousands of youth around the world.

loans.use: To pay for his industrial mechatronics studies.

loans.name: Luis Oscar

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre pujante y carismático, amante de su familia y de buenos hábitos.
El se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su motocicleta alrededor del municipio de Santafé De Antioquia, Colombia. Es una actividad muy popular en dicho municipio donde los jóvenes desde muy temprana edad la ejercen.
Con su trabajo ha logrado salir adelante al lado de su familia y ha podido hacerle reformas a su vivienda para poder gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para realizarle mantenimiento y reparaciones a su moto ya que presenta dificultades y esto hace que su trabajo no sea tan eficiente.
Con el préstamo podrá tener su motocicleta en óptimas condiciones para continuar con su labor y seguir generando ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Luis is an energetic, charismatic family man who has good habits.  He has a motorcycle taxi business around the town of Santafé de Antioquia, Colombia.  It is a very popular business in a town where youth start working in the activity from a very young age.

Through his work, he has been able to support his family and renovate his home in order to enjoy a better quality of life.

Luis is currently requesting a loan for motorcycle repair and maintenance so his business will run more efficiently.  With the loan he will be able to keep his vehicle in optimum condition so he can continue his work and generate income for his household.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle repair so he can continue working.

loans.name: Señoras Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEÑORAS LUCHADORAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teresa es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas, tejido de busos y mantas, venta de ropa tradicional, venta de repuestos de autos, venta de salteñas (empanadas bolivianas).

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teresa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tejido de chompas y gorras; da a conocer que la técnica de tejido lo aprendió en un club de madres hace varios años, desde entonces decide emprender este negocio con un capital reducido.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se encuentra la esposa del socio, quien acompaña al grupo ella esta vestida con un sombrero café.
texts.en:
The "SEÑORAS LUCHADORAS" communal bank is beginning its first Pro Mujer loan cycle at the Panamericana Social Center.  It is comprised of nine members and has a board of directors.  Teresa is the secretary of the group.  The businesses that the members are involved in are varied and include:  knitting of sweaters, jackets and blankets, sales of traditional dress, sales of auto parts, and sales of "salteñas" (Bolivian meat pies).

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners such as Teresa who just joined Pro Mujer by invitation through a representative of the institution who visited her at home.  She currently runs a business selling knitted sweaters and hats.  She says she learned the knitting technique at a club for mothers several years ago.  After that she decided to establish her own business with a small amount of capital.

The loan she is requesting now is to increase her work capital so she can buy wool wholesale at the fairs in the city of el Alto.  Later she will sell the products she makes at her sales stall.  Through her work she has been able to generate resources to support the family.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the loans, health area and training offered by the institution.

The wife of one of the members appears in the photograph.  She is the one wearing a brown hat.

loans.use: To buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Wendy Gloribel

texts.es:
Wendy de 26 años de edad, está estudiando en la universidad, es soltera, con ella vive su mamá y su hermano, de ella depende una persona. 

La cliente invertirá el dinero para pagar la mensualidad de la universidad y también invertirá en la granja de pollos que tiene. Ella planea pagar y salir bien con sus estudios y que su granja crezca y así tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Wendy, 26, studies at the university.  She is single and lives with her mother and brother, and she has one person who is dependent on her.

The loan will be used to pay for her monthly university costs and also to invest in the chicken ranch she has.  She plans to finish her education and wants her ranch to grow so she can earn more income.

loans.use: To pay for monthly education costs and to invest in her chicken ranch.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es: El señor Fermin  es agricultor de hortalizas y legumbres vive en la provincia de sipe sipe lugar de un clima húmedo y con bastante riego para los terrenos agrícolas, sus padres también son agricultores y de ellos aprendió a manejar la tierra desde muy pequeño, como sus padres le dejaron parte de un terreno se dedicó al cultivo de maíz, cebolla, zanahoria y otros llegando a comercializar sus productos a los mercados de la provincia en temporadas de cosecha, pero por motivos de un accidente no le fue fácil continuar con su trabajo, es por eso que los ingresos de los productos de su última cosecha fueron para sus medicamentos y atención médica, ahora que se encuentra mejor de salud, le falta capital por ello requiere un crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y semillas, de esta forma podrá continuar con  su actividad e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sr. Fermin is a farmer. He grows different varieties of vegetables. He lives in the province of Sipe Sipe where the climate is mild with lots of rain for his fields. His parents are farmers too and as a young boy, Fermin learned from them how to look after the land. As his parents gave him part of their land, he started to grow maize, onions, carrots etc. and sell the produce to local markets after the harvest.  

However, because he had an accident, it wasn't easy for him to continue this work and the income from the crops was used to pay for medication and doctor's visits. Now he is feeling better but lacks the money to buy manure, fertilizer, and seeds. Then he will be able to continue farming and increase his income.

loans.use: buy manure, fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Josael Alexis

texts.es:
Josael de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta 4 grado, esta acompañado, trabajo siempre en la agricultura, los hijos viven en casa, no van a la escuela todavía, tres personas dependen de él.

 Él se ha dedicado a la agricultura toda su vida, sus padres le enseñaron este trabajo desde pequeño, también se dedica a trabajar con tractor arando y rastreando tierras, también es ganadero, cría, engorda y vende ganado. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra para sembrar maíz. 

El planea mejorar su vida ya que tendrá mas ingresos y granos suficientes para vender y consumir las ganancias, las invertirá en compra de ganado.
texts.en:
25-year old Josael has a grade 4 education, is married, and is a farmer. His children live at home and don't yet go to school. He is supporting three members of his family.

Josael has always been involved in farming as his parents taught him about looking after the land while he was a young boy. Now he uses a tractor to till the earth. He also raises animals and sells them once they are fully grown. 

Josael plans to use the loan money to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide and pay for laborers to plant maize. He hopes to improve his life as he will have more income. He also hopes for a good harvest so he will have enough produce to sell and income to buy items for his family, as well as money to invest in more livestock.

loans.use: buy manure, fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide and pay for laborers to plant maize

loans.name: Dellanira

texts.es: Dellanira una mujer que junto a su madre inicio un negocio de venta de arepas y comidas los fines de semana hace aproximadamente dos años, ya que todos sus procesos los hace empíricamente se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de un asador, un molino eléctrico y el resto en materia prima no perecedera como papa, chocolate, maíz etc. Este crédito la beneficiara enormemente ya que agilizara sus procesos y lo más importante tendrá más tiempo para dedicarle a su familia conformada por sus 3 hijos o los cuales lucha incansablemente para brindarle todas las comodidades que estén a su alcance
texts.en: Together with her mother Dellanira started a business about two years ago selling corn tortillas and meals at weekends. Now that time has passed she sees a need to buy a BBQ, an electric flour grinder, and other non-perishable  items like potatoes, chocolate, corn etc. The loan will help her enormously as it will speed up preparation time, and more importantly give her more time to spend with her family. She has three children for whom she works very hard to provide them with as good a life as she is able.

loans.use: buy a BBQ, an electric flour grinder, and ingredients such as corn

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en: Being a responsible housewife, Joanna helps her husband earn income. She is 41 years old and has only one child. She operates their motorcycle transport business within the local community to generate income. She aims to earn and save more income in order to support the education of her child. To continue using the motorcycle, Joanna requests a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy the needed motorcycle parts and accessories. Through this loan, she believes that she will provide safe transportation to her passengers and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy the needed motorcycle parts and accessories.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 31-year-old married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children. Her husband provides white wash and oil paint services to his customers in the community; sometimes he has to go out of the city also. 

He has gotten a new contract for white wash and oil paint on a newly constructed house but he does not have the paint brush and rollers he needs to provide services. This is the reason Rubina has requested a loan for her husband so he will be able to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil, etc.

Rubina wants to change the living conditions of her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial to her husband's business. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil, etc.

loans.name: Flordilona

texts.en:
Flordilona is 44 years old and married. She has four children who are in school.

Flordilona is in the agricultural business. She raises chickens in the Philippines. Flordilona has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional chicks, feed and vitamins for her business.

Flordilona has been raising chickens for five years now, and she has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Flordilona would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional chicks, feed and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw materials and animals.

loans.name: Paradi De Dolval Group

texts.fr:
Yvonie est le coordinatrice de son groupe Paradi de Dolval. Elle est marié mais elle a 3 enfants. Elle habite dans la ville de Ouanaminthe d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Yvonie a dirigé son business pendant les 6 dernières années. 

Yvonie voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du cosmetiques et accessoires. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres de Paradi de Dolval ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson. Yvonie dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant.
texts.en:
Yvonie is the coordinator of the Paradi de Dolval group. She is married and has 3 children. She lives in the Haitian town of Ouanaminthe, where electricity is rare and the supply of water is very limited.

Yvonie has been running this business for the last 6 years. She would like to use this loan to buy cosmetics and accessories. She hopes that this loan will help her to grow her business. The other members of the Paradi de Dolval group need their loans to buy merchandise like charcoal, rice and fish. Yvonis says that her main challenge is the constant lack of buyers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Ndiague's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 24 décembre 2010. Ce banc regroupe des membres qui habitent le même village et ceux des environs.
Adji debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont une fille. 
Avec le prêt elle entreprend de faire de l'embouche ovine en achetant 2 moutons à 25000f l'un. Pour nourrir le bétail elle achète de l'aliment de bétail et des vaccin pour la santé des sujets. Au bout de quelques mois d'embouche elle pourra vendre un mouton à 45000f voire 50000f.
Les bénéfices lui servent à renforcer son épargne au niveau du banc villageois et à réinvestir dans son activité d'embouche.
texts.en:
This group of women are part of the "banc villageois" which was created on the 24th of December, 2010. This "banc" groups together members who lives in the same village and surrounding villages.

Adji, standing on the right of the picture and raising her hand, is 30 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children, one of whom is a girl. She will use this loan to start her sheep-fattening business and will buy 2 sheep for 25 000 francs apiece. She will also buy feed for her livestock and will spend money on vaccines to ensure their health. After a few months of fattening, she will be able to resell each sheep for 45 000 francs, maybe 50 000 francs. Part of the profits will be used to build her savings at the "banc villageois" and part will be reinvested in her livestock-fattening business.

loans.use: to buy 2 sheep.

loans.name: Floremi

texts.en:
Floremi is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear and kitchenware business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to her customers.

Floremi has been in this business for 2 years. Floremi earns more income from selling Avon products.

Floremi has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia, 31, is a married woman and mother of three children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now the vehicle requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and little bit of engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Nazia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain a rickshaw.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom, 64, is a housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her elder son owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges in his shop. Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. Moreover, he has decided to sell vegetables from his shop as well. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Kalsoom has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her elder son to purchase variety of fruits and vegetables from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit, her son wants to grow his business in the future. Kalsoom is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
Luis, comenta  la satisfacción de los resultados que ha tenido al invertir el crédito anterior en su negocio, tuvo a su disposición los insumos agrícolas que necesitaba para lograr una cosecha abundante y libre de plagas, su estabilidad económica ha mejorado y su familia vive en mejores condiciones.
Solicita un nuevo crédito para continuar cultivando maíz y frijol, comprara abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas e insecticidas, se limitara a comprar los materiales básicos.
texts.en:
Luis says that the results that he had by investing the previous loan were satisfactory. He had available to him agricultural materials that he needed to achieve an abundant harvest free of pests. His financial stability has improved and his family lives in better conditions. 

He is asking for a new loan to continue growing corn and beans. He will buy fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide and insecticide. He will limit himself to buying basic materials.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and insecticide.

loans.name: Rubenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rubenia, está acompañada, es madre de cinco hijos en edades de 18, 16, 15, 9 y 2 años de edad, todos viven juntos, no tienen familiares en el extranjero, su negocio consiste en vender café con pan y algunas meriendas para desayunar, ya tiene cinco años de desarrollar esta actividad, lo hace de lunes a sábado, de 5:00 a.m. a 10:00 p.m., a la fecha no representa ninguna dificultad para realizar este trabajo.
Comprará café, azúcar, pan, aceite, huevos, plátanos, crema y queso, está mercadería es de mucha ayuda para abastecer el negocio y contar su preferencia de los clientes, con las ganancias cancelara sus cuotas así como también continuara apoyando a sus hijos.
Su sueño es tener los recursos económicos para facilitarles a sus hijos oportunidades de culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rubenia, partnered, is the mother of five children, ages 18, 16, 15, 9 and 2. They all live together and don't have any relatives overseas. Her business is selling coffee with bread and some snacks for breakfast and she has developed this business for five years. She does it Monday through Saturday from 5:00 am to 10:00 pm; currently there are no problems in doing this work. 

She will purchase coffee, sugar, bread, oil, eggs, bananas, cream, and cheese. This merchandise is a great help in stocking her business and meeting her  customers' preferences. With the earnings, she will make her payments and also continue to support her children.

Her dream is to have the economic resources to allow her children opportunities to finish their schooling.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, bread, oil, eggs, bananas, cream, and cheese

loans.name: 12 De Junio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “12 DE JUNIO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de artefactos electrónicos, tejido de manta de, venta de empanadas, taller de cerrajería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dora es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo trabajó desde hace treinta años, cuando se inició la feria de su zona
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros, el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "12 DE JUNIO" communal bank will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, which is part of the Centro Focal de Senakata. It is comprised of eight members and is directed by an executive board of which Dora is the president. The businesses of the association's members are varied and include a neighborhood store, sale of electronic goods, knitting blankets, empanada sales, and a locksmith shop.

The loan that they get will benefit the small microbusinesses of which Dora is a member. She says that two years ago, she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of her friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling clothing. She said that she has worked in this business for thirty years, since the regional festival began.

The loan that they are getting now is to increase the capital (purchase of clothing in bulk) that she will purchase at the festival in the city of El Alto, and later will resell in her sales area. This work allows her to generate resources to help her family, since she is single and has four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings, the health center, and the training sessions that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 57 años  de edad y habita en casa propia junto  a sus dos nietos de 20 años y 11 años de edad. Ella posee una tienda en la cual vende variedad de productos como: arroz, frijoles, detergente, aceite, golosinas, etc. Este negocio es muy importante dado que es su principal fuente de ingresos y desea invertir en el para satisfacer una mayor demanda y así poder aumentar sus ventas e ingresos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de productos de tienda como: azúcar, frijoles, arroz, detergente, aceite, pan dulce, etc. De esta forma confía que podrá dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Julia is 57 years old and lives in her own home with two grandchildren, ages 20 and 11.
