She has a store where she sells a variety of products such as rice, beans, detergent, oil, candies, etc. This business is very important since it is her primary source of income and she wants to invest in it to meet a greater demand and so increase her sales and income. For this reason, she asks for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of a variety of products for her store such as sugar, beans, rice, detergent, oil, pan dulce, etc. In this way, she expects to be able to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans, rice, detergent, oil, pan dulce, etc.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
La señora Águeda de 61  años de edad vive  con su compañero de hogar y su nieto su residencia habitacional  es en el caserío del caimito San Lorenzo valle se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de venta de pan, frescos, jugos, agua, etc., sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan.
Con el apoyo del préstamo ella pretende mejorar su negocio ya que necesita el capital para surtir el negocio y comprar pan, jugos, frescos y agua, de esa manera obtener mejores utilidades, es cliente nuevo para prisma y Kiva.
Doña Águeda su sueños es tener más grande su negocio.
San Lorenzo, honduras - Abril del 2014.
texts.en:
Águeda is 61 years old and lives with her housemate and her grandchild.  Her home is in the village of Caimito San Lorenzo Valle. For the past five years, she has worked at her business of selling bread, soft drinks, juices, water, etc. Her customers are her neighbors and friends who visit her daily. With the help of the loan, she hopes to improve her business since she needs the capital to stock her business and to purchase bread, juice, soft drinks and water, and in this way increase her profits. She is a new client of Prisma and Kiva.

Águeda's dream is to have a bigger business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2014.

loans.use: to purchase bread, juice, soft drinks and water for her business.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan es agricultor, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado académico, el cual no pudo seguir estudiando debido a la muerte de su padre y tuvo que tomar las riendas de su hogar y mantener a su familia, ahora él está casado y tiene tres hijos de los cuales uno todavía está estudiando en la universidad, su esposa viajó a otro lugar del país para trabajar y así apoyar a su esposo en darle el estudio a su hijo, los otros dos están acompañados.

Juan trabajaba como motorista en un autobús, pero tuvo que dejar de trabajar puesto que la situación delincuencial no le permitió que siguiera laborando, ahora él tiene alrededor de 6 años de dedicarse al cultivo de la jícama la cual le proporciona buenos resultados para cubrir los estudios de su hijo, también tiene un pequeño taller de reparación de llantas de automóviles el cual le genera ingresos diarios para complementar los gastos del estudio de su hijo junto a la ayuda que le dá su pareja.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar un compresor de aire ya que el que tenía anteriormente se le arruinó y no se puede reparar, además de esto necesita surtir su taller de neumáticos para tener listos para la venta.

Juan tiene planeado ya no dedicarse a la agricultura y dedicarse más a trabajar en el taller, porque tiene más rentabilidad y deja ingresos diarios para ayudar a su hijo a que termine sus estudios, ya que él no tuvo esa oportunidad, su mayor sueño es que su taller tenga mejores condiciones para tener mejor atención al cliente y así tener más ingresos que les permitan tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Juan is a farmer. He is 45 years old. He went to school through the 6th grade. He wasn't able to stay in school due to the death of his father. He had to take the reins in the home and support his family Now he is married and has three children. One of them is still in college. His wife travelled to another part of the country to work and thus help her husband give their child and education. The other two children are married.  

Juan worked as a bus driver, but he had to stop working because of the crime that wouldn't let him keep working. Now he has been growing jicama for about 6 years. It gives him good results to cover his son's education expenses. He also has a small automobile tire repair workshop which generates daily income to pay for his son's education expenses along with what his spouse contributes. 

The loan he is asking  CREDICAMPO for is to buy an air compressor. The one he had before was ruined and can't be repaired. In addition, he needs to stock his tire workshop so he can have some ready for sale. 

Juan is planning on not farming any more and spending more time in his workshop. It is more profitable and brings in daily income to help his son finish his education, because he never had that opportunity. His biggest dream is for his workshop to be in better condition so he can better serve his customers and thus have more income to allow for a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor since the one he had before was ruined and can't be repaired. In addition, he needs to stock his tire workshop so he can have them ready for sale.

loans.name: Asuncion Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Asunción de 42  años  de edad,   vive con su conyugue y sus tres hijos  en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace  10  años al negocio de venta de golosinas, pan, tamales su venta es de forma ambulante, sus cliente son los amigos y personas que a diario ella visita y que le visitan en su casa, doña Asunción es una mujer trabajadora que desea salir adelante y es un ejemplo de trabajo y de superación ya que ella ha dado el estudio a sus hijos con este negocio. 
Doña Asunción está solicitando el préstamo para compra de verduras, harina, maíz, leña,  maseca, leche y otros productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del préstamo ella  pretende mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con PRISMA, y es su octavo  préstamo que solicita.
 Su sueño es mejorar  su  negocio.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2014.
texts.en:
Asunción is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children.  For ten years, she has worked at her business selling snacks, bread, and tamales.  She sells as a street vendor.  Her customers are the friends and people that she visits every day and who visit her house.  Asunción is a hardworking woman who wants to succeed.  She is an example of work and self-improvement, since she has been able to send her children to school with her business.

Asunción is requesting this loan to purchase vegetables, flour, corn, firewood, corn flour, milk, and other products for her business.  With the support of the loan, she intends to improve her business and her quality of life.  She is very happy to continue working with PRISMA.  This is the eighth loan she has requested.  Her dream is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2014

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, flour, corn, firewood, corn flour, milk, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Perlita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making nipa roofing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested additional loan to further build her business. 

Perlita is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 36 years old and married with three children who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Luz runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for eight years, and sells a variety of items such as rice, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell scrap materials business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell for her buy and sell scrap materials business.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from firewood vending.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Mary  Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 53 years old, married, and lives with her family. She has a retail business selling pillow cases and bedding to her customers; she sells her products  to generate additional income, with the help of her husband.

Mary Jane has 10 years of experience in this field. She earns well to support her family.

Mary Jane requested this loan to buy more pillow cases and bedding to sell. 

She is aiming to develop her business to make it a business for their family. The couple wants to give their children a better education in the future.

loans.use: to buy more pillow cases and bedding to sell

loans.name: Leilanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Leilanie works hard to support her family.

She has a video gaming machine rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Leilanie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional gaming unit for her business

Leilanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional gaming unit for her business

loans.name: Shanthi

texts.en:
Mrs. Shanthi is a member of a Self-Help Group (SHG), managed by the local NGO "PAT". She lives in a small hamlet in a rural area of Kathiramangalam in Tanjore District. She is married to Mr. Sethuraman and she has studied up to 10th grade. They have two children. The first son Sanjay is studying in 9th grade and Dhurshanth, the second son, is studying in 5th grade in a school in the same village. They live in a house with a thatched roof.

Shanthi has received loans from PAT before and has paid her dues promptly on time. She and her husband have a handloom weaving machine (as seen in the picture) and earn enough to run their family.

Shanthi is looking forward to receiving this Kiva loan to purchase a smokeless stove to use in her kitchen, thus providing healthier conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a 45-year-old woman.  She is married and a housewife.  She is married to Robin and they have three daughters. Two daughters are married and one is a student in grade 5.  She and her husband both are illiterate and can sign their names only.  They live in their own house in Magurmari in the district Jalpaiguri.

Saraswati's husband is a cycle-van puller.  He carries people and loads on his van and earns money to support his family.  His income is inconsistent and insufficient to maintain all the costs of a family of five members.  Saraswati, though a housewife, is very energetic and optimistic.  She has self-confidence to do something of her own. She wants to start a milk supply business because the demand for milk is high in their locality.  She plans to sell milk to her neighbours.  She has also planned to start a milk products business selling curd, paneer (cottage cheese), butter etc., so she wants to purchase a cow and its fodder.

She heard about BJS and has taken a loan from them with this purpose. She hopes this business will help her to develop her family's financial condition and with her daughter's education.

She will be ever grateful to her lenders for their financial help.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk and milk products business.

loans.name: Syeda Yasmeen

texts.en:
Syeda Yasmeen is 48, living with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running a mobile shop for many years, generating income for his entire family. He sells mobile accessories such as chargers, bodies, data cables, etc, provides the recharge facilities of different networks, and can troubleshoot mobile phones as well. 

Nowadays, there is a lot of demand for mobile accessories and for recharging; sometimes he has to refuse his customers. But he does not have savings to further invest into business because he already has spent his all savings for household expenses. 

Therefore, Syeda Yasmeen has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy additional accessories and extra credit for the recharge facility. 

She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy mobile accessories to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 53 years old and married with two children.  She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Josefina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josefina has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lederia

texts.en:
Lederia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a charcoal vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Lederia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Lederia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years old, and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Myrna has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Myrna requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like snack food, rice, and other miscellaneous items.

Myrna has been in this business for 23 years.

 In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like snack food, rice, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 56-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has owned an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidered dresses by machine in his nearby town for many years. He has been recruiting skilled persons for embroidery work for daily wages; he also brings some material home for Allah Rakhi because she helps him in the embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession; he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his art, and appreciate his efforts. 

He wants to cope with the demand for bridal dresses; that is why he wants to buy a stock of thread, fancy material, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

She requires some capital to buy the desired inventory for her son, but she does not have sufficient cash in hand. 

So she humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan; through this loan her son would be able to buy a stock of thread, fancy material, sequins, and pearls of various colors. 

She is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread, fancy material, sequins, and pearls of various colors

loans.name: Loie

texts.en:
Loie has been providing transportation services in their community for more than five years. He earns well from this, aside from farming, the main source of their income. His children are still studying and he has to sustain his living.

Recently, he took a new loan to buy fertilizer to improve his farm. In the future, he wants to sustain his transportation business while at the same time improving his farm and wants to save his profit to use it when they get old.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve his farm.

loans.name: Shah Bano

texts.en:
Shah Bano is 25 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by trade. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last seven years. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order, so he is unable to generate any amount of income.  He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. 

Therefore Shah Bano has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Shah Bano is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Srity

texts.en:
Srity is only 30 years old.  She is married and a mother of one little daughter.  She lives with her husband and daughter in Anandanagar, in Maynaguri of Jalpaiguri district.  She is a housewife who studied till grade 10.  Her husband, Pintu, aged 29 years, is associated in a small business.

Srity's husband is the only breadwinner for the family.  His income is so scanty that it is hardly possible for him to maintain the expenses of his household.  Srity is a sincere and hardworking woman.  She always works to improve her living conditions. To help her husband, she needed to find a source of income very badly. Thus she opened a grocery shop in her house, where she sells different varieties of grocery items like rice, wheat, sugar, salt, oil, biscuits, spices, etc. Her main customers are her neighbors. As it is the only grocery shop in her area, she generates a good profit. Now she wants to expand her business by purchasing more stocks of grocery items.

With this aim, she has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase varieties of grocery items.

This business income will help to cover her family's everyday household needs and the educational expenses of her daughter.  Srity dreams that her business will grow more. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart for her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her existing grocery shop.

loans.name: Tulsi

texts.en:
Tulsi lives with her husband, Dayamoy, and their little son.  They are from a remote region, Bagnan in the district Jalpaiguri. The village is one of the most remote in the region and lacks basic amenities like pacca houses (those made of concrete and mortar) and electricity.  Tulsi is a very young and hardworking lady of only 27 years who studied up to grade 9; after that she got married.  Her husband is a mechanic in a local garage.  Their only son is too young for school.

Tulsi is a housewife who looks after her husband and child and does the household jobs. Her husband has no steady income to fulfill the basic needs of his family and give them a decent lifestyle.

Tulsi is very energetic, enthusiastic and determined to shape her future through sheer hard work and cooperation.  Now to help her husband to run the family smoothly, she has decided to cultivate tomatoes.  They have some farmland of their own.  She wants to utilize the land for growing tomatoes.  Then she will sell them at the local bazar. She has chosen this product as it has much demand in the market and she hopes it will be is a profitable business.

So she is seeking financial help from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary things to start cultivation.

She is very thankful to BJS and Kiva for their support, which will be help her to raise her standard of living and give proper education to her son with the profit from her business.

loans.use: To purchase tomato seeds, fertilizers and other necessary agricultural inputs for cultivating tomatoes.

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
La joven Carla Patricia tiene la edad de 33 años, habita en el municipio de El Sauce ubicado al occidente del departamento de León, es madre de tres hijos que están en edad escolar y día a día lucha desempeñándose como maestra de primaria en una escuela de la localidad donde tiene ya varios años.
Hace pocos meses su esposo tuvo que emigrar para Estados Unidos a laborar, sacrificándose por separarse de su familia pero haciendo el esfuerzo para darles una vida mejor, además pensando en el futuro para sus hijos los cuales van creciendo y tienen que ir a la universidad y con el salario de una triste maestra no podría cubrir estos gastos.
Carla en este momento tiene la necesidad de un financiamiento para reparar el techo de la cocina con el cual piensa comprar zinc, perlines, clavos, ya que se acerca la temporada de invierno y necesita reparar porque se pasa el agua inundando parte de su vivenda.
Solicita a los inversionistas de Kiva que le apoyen con este financiamiento a través de Ceprodel para llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Carla Patricia is 33 years old and lives in the municipality of El Sauce, located in the eastern part of the León department. She is the mother of three school-aged children and works as a primary school teacher in a local school, where she has worked for many years.

A few months ago, her husband emigrated to the United States to work, sacrificing time with his family in order to make an effort to provide them with a better life. He kept his children's future in mind, since they are growing and will need to go to university. A teacher's salary will not cover those expenses.

Carla currently needs a loan to repair the roof in her kitchen and will need to purchase zinc, roof beams, and nails. It is almost winter, and she needs to repair it since water floods this part of her home. She requests the help of Kiva lenders to support her through Ceprodel to bring this loan to life.

loans.use: to purchase zinc, roof beams, and nails.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 48 years old and widowed. She lives in a rural community, buying and selling dress and footwear for almost 13 years. Due to hardship of living, she aims to improve more of her business and increase her income in order to satisfy her necessities and save some for future emergencies. 

She wants to acquire more stock of the said products to sell but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 47,000 to buy more stock of dresses, slippers, sandals, and shoes to resell. 

Through her patience and determination, she is hoping that she will further improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dresses, slippers, sandals, and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle so that his son can work.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan; she is an old member of BRAC and is taking a new loan after three prior loans. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw by trade; he hires the rickshaw on a daily basis but he has to pay fares for it also. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw but his savings do not allow him to make any purchase. 

Therefore, Nazia contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and requested a Kiva loan. She hopes that after buying a new rickshaw, her husband’s income will increase and she can look after her children in a better way. 

Nazia seems very happy over this honorable act and thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Ishrat's Group

texts.en:
Ishrat is 45, living with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband manufactures belts for jeans; he purchases pieces of leather, stitches them on his sewing machine, puts a buckle on them, then sells them in the market.

He wants to grow his monthly income by manufacturing more belts but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy additional raw materials. Therefore, Ishrat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy various types of rexine, buckles and leather for manufacturing belts. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rexine, leather and buckles for manufacturing belts.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 50-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of seven children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last ten years. 

For the past few days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He decided to buy a new auto rickshaw because it is useless to pay more as a repairing cost on this ten years-used rickshaw. 

Due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Naseem is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new rickshaw for her husband's business.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma is a 35-year-old lady living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother; her children are too young and fully dependent upon their parents. She wants to make some savings so she can provide better living facilities to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years but his income is insufficient to feed the entire family. He has to maintain the auto rickshaw's body but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. Therefore, Salma has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to fix the auto rickshaw's body. 

She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw body.

loans.name: Amancay Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANCAY” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: ejido de macramé de mantas, tienda de barrio, tienda de lubricantes, venta de comida, venta de plásticos, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nena es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de lubricantes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres quienes tenían el mismo negocio, cuando ella tuvo su hijo decide independizarse.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lubricantes por mayor) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros, y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Amancay" community association will begin its first loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani focal center. The group is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors, of which Nena is the president. The businesses that the members run are varied and include: macrame weaving, a neighborhood store, a lubricant store, food sales, plastic sales, and cheese sales.

The loan that they are requesting will benefit small businesses like Nena's. She joined Pro Mujer one year ago after a consultant from the institution visited her home. She currently has a business where she sells lubricants. She learned this business from her parents, who had the same business. She decided to become independent when she had a child.
 
The loan that she will take out is to increase capital by purchasing lubricants in bulk, which she will acquire from distributors in the city of El Alto and sell at her store. This job allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is single with a child. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase lubricants in bulk.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a 49-year-old mother who is running a small retail store within the local community. She and her husband aim to improve their living status in order to educate their three children and give them a better future. She has been in the business for almost 23 years. She would like to increase her product offerings and income in order to help in financing the education of her children. 

Having inadequate capital, Nelly is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy bread, canned goods, snack foods, noodles, soft drinks, beverages, seasonings and vegetables to resell. She is hoping that she will access her loan  to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy bread, canned goods, snack foods, noodles, soft drinks, beverages, seasonings and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth works hard to support her family. Lilibeth has a live-in partner and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Lilibeth requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lilibeth has been in this business for seven years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is a 47-year-old married woman living along with her husband and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son owns a small gemstones shop, in which he sells precious gemstones for rings, earrings and necklaces. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case for the attraction of customers.  

He has only one source of income, and he has to afford the expenses of utility bills, the school fees of his children and household expenses alone. Therefore, Samina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan so her son can increase the inventory by purchasing gemstones, and increase his earnings as well.

Samina is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her basic requirements.

loans.use: To buy gemstones for reselling.

loans.name: Doa  Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
Doa Al-Hodeidah is a group that consists of five hardworking women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They have requested a group loan of 240,000 YER from AMB and will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

Mona is a very active woman from a poor family. She is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is the leader of the group. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. With time, he became unable to look after of his family. Mona wanted to help him in this responsibility so she decided to sell women's clothes door-to-door. 

She has been selling women's clothes with a small capital for four years. Her income from this business is very low and she wants to improve it. For this reason, she has turned to AMB to take a loan of 60,000 YER to purchase more clothes to resell to the customers in her area.

Mona looks forward to expanding her business more. She hopes to save a lot of money in order to renovate her house. She is waiting your support. She is a very grateful and kind woman.

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes to resell to the customers in her area.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
Elvia de 24 años de edad es madre de 3 hijos que depende de ella, radica en la comunidad de él  Guayabo, Nacaome  Valle al sur de Honduras, vive en casa de propia con su conyugue  y se dedica desde hace 2  años  a la venta de frescos , golosinas como tacos, enchiladas, tajaditas, churros,  etc. sus clientes son los estudiantes de la escuela aledaña a su casa, también amigos y personas que a diario llegan a su casa ELVIA es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, ya que tiene tres hijos que sacar adelante, tiene casa propia y tiene esposo que le ayuda en el hogar.
Elvia está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de arena, cemento, arenilla y mano de obra  ya que desea repellar su casa para mejorar su calidad de vida, esta contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y Kiva  es su segundo préstamo que solicita. 
Su sueño es ver su casa bonita.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2014.
texts.en:
Elvia, age 24, has three dependent children.  She is from the Guayabo community in the Nacaome Valley in southern Honduras.  She lives in her own house with her husband.  

For two years she has been selling fresh food and sweets like tacos, enchiladas, ‘tajaditas’ [fried plantains], and churros, etc.  Her customers are the students at the neighboring school.  Her customers are also friends and people who come to her house every day.  Elvia is a hard-working woman with the desire to get ahead.  This is because she has three children to get ahead.  She has her own house, and her husband helps her in the home.

Elvia is requesting the loan to buy sand, cement, and grit and to pay for labor.  She wishes to plaster her house in order to improve her quality of life.  She is happy to continue working with Prisma and Kiva.  This is the second loan she has requested. 

Her dream is for her house to be beautiful.

San Lorenzo, Honduras   April, 2014

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and grit and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Michelle Lyn

texts.en:
Having no other source of income, Michelle Lyn runs a small variety store to help her husband in gaining income. She is 35 years old and has no children yet. Together with her husband, she aims to become financially stable in the future. With this regard, Michelle wants to improve her business in order to increase her income. 

Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to avail a loan of 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more stock of soft drinks, rice, canned goods, noodles, snack foods, beverages, seasonings and load wallet mobile credits to resell. She believes that someday, she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks, rice, canned goods, noodles, snack foods, beverages, seasonings and load wallet mobile credits to resell

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 61 years old and widowed with ten children. 

Lucita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Lucita requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lucita has been farming vegetables for 45 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lucita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: María Olimpia

texts.es: María tiene 63 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus nietos de 9 años y 12 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras desde hace 20 años y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. María es una mujer emprendedora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para mantener su negocio activo dado que es una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el negocio en la compra de planos, tomates, papas, aguacates, chile verde, pepino, yuca, etc. De esta forma espera mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: María is 63 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her grandchildren who are 9 and 12 years old. She has been buying and selling vegetables for 20 years and this is how she makes a living and supports her household. María is an enterprising woman who does everything she can to keep her business active given that it is one of her main sources of money. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of tomatoes, potatoes, avocados, green chili, cucumber, yucca, etc. By doing this she hopes to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, avocados, green chilies, cucumber, yucca etc.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos es un hombre soñador y muy creativo, vive en el municipio de Cañas Gordas al lado de su esposa (Foto) y su hijo de 15 años.
El ha vivido toda su vida en el campo y por esta razón conoce las actividades agropecuarias y de producción de animales.
El desea iniciar con un pequeño negocio de producción, cría y venta de pollos de engorde, actividad que aprendió y heredo de su madre quien toda su vida la ejerció.
Al lado de su esposa tiene grandes proyectos como el de sacar a su hijo adelante con una educación de calidad y buenos valores.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la construcción de un galpón y en la compra de sus primeros animales, así podrá emprender con su negocio y mejorara notablemente los ingresos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Carlos is a dreamer and is very creative.  He lives in the municipality of Cañas Gordas with his wife (pictured) and their 15 year-old son.  He has lived in the countryside his whole life, and for this reason, he knows agricultural work and animal raising very well.  He wishes to start a small business producing, raising and selling broiler chickens, an activity that he learned from his mother who did it for her whole life.  He and his wife have big projects planned such as getting their son ahead with a quality education and good values.

The requested loan will be used to build a barn and to purchase his first animals.  This will allow him to start his business and notably improve his household income.

loans.use: build a barn and purchase his first chickens to sell.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 30-year-old married woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children, and her husband is a motorbike repairing mechanic by profession. Her husband has been providing services to the people in the form of motorbike repairing. He has been running a motorbike repairing workshop in the market, where he performs his services. He has also spare parts in the workshop to exchange in motorbikes during repairing. 

He needs to purchase some equipment for his workshop. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the needed things. Therefore, his wife, Saira, has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. This loan will help him to buy workshop items like tires, tubes, axles, brake shoes, etc. Saira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tires, tubes, axles, brake shoes, etc., for the motorbike workshop

loans.name: Carina

texts.es:
Carina vive en Yarinacocha junto a su esposo con quien trabaja de la mano para sacar adelante a su familia.
Desde hace 3 años se dedica  a la actividad agrícola, teniendo a la Yuca como producto principal. 
Ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, todos los días sale desde muy temprano para poder cuidar de sus cultivos y ofrecerlos a un precio competitivo en el mercado.
Carina está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que con su gran apoyo ella comprará insumos para poder hacer un mantenimiento a la tierra hasta el tiempo de cosecha. De esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos, mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y cumplirá su mayor sueño: “Ser la mayor productora de yuca de su Ciudad”.
texts.en:
Carina lives in Yarinacocha with her husband, who works as a laborer to get his family ahead.

She has worked in agriculture for three years, yuca being her main crop.  She's a very responsible and hardworking person.  She goes out very early every day to be able to take care of her crops and sell them at a competitive price in the market.

Carina's very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their great help she'll be able to buy inputs to maintain her land until the harvest.

This way she'll earn more income, improve her family's quality of life, and achieve her biggest dream: to be the biggest yuca grower in her city.

loans.use: to buy inputs to take care of her land until the harvest

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio has been farming for years and was able to provide for his family's basic needs. He plants and harvests bananas to sell in the local community in order to earn a living. Aside from this, he also earns by working for hire in the neighborhood.   

Recently Dionesio borrowed a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer for his banana production business. In the future, Dionesio would like to save money in order to create an emergency fund for the future and to cultivate his vacant farmland.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Yennis Roxana

texts.es:
Yennis, con el deseo de continuar trabajando por el bienestar de su familia opta por un nuevo crédito que utilizara para comprar gas propano, harina, bebidas, aderezos, tomates, aceite, chicharrón, quesillo y frijoles, son la materia prima para elaborar la venta de pupusas.
Con el préstamo anterior logro comprar lo necesario para potenciar su negocio y seguir teniendo los ingresos que necesita para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y cancelar las cuotas de la deuda abquirida.
texts.en:
Yennis wants to continue working for the welfare of her family. She has chosen to request a new loan in order to buy propane gas, flour, beverages, seasonings, tomatoes, oil, pork skins, cheese, and beans. These are the main supplies that she uses of making and selling “pupusas” (tortillas stuffed with various fillings).

With her previous loan, Yennis was able to buy the things she needed to strengthen her business and continue generating income for covering her family’s basic needs and repaying the debt she had acquired.

loans.use: to buy propane gas, flour, beverages, seasonings, tomatoes, oil, pork skins, cheese, and beans.

loans.name: Ma. Jocelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Jocelyn is 45 years old and single.  

Ma. Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, seasonings, detergent, soap, shampoo, coffee, chocolate drink, etc., to sell.

Ma. Jocelyn has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, seasonings, detergent, soap, shampoo, coffee, chocolate drink, etc. 

In the future, Ma. Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, seasonings, detergent, soap, shampoo, coffee, chocolate drink, etc., to sell

loans.name: Melonie

texts.en:
Melonie is 29 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Melonie is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy an additional piglet, feed, and other supplies for her business.

Melonie has been in pig fattening for five years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Melonie would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an additional piglet, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Melva Del Carmen

texts.es:
La  tienda de Melva es pequeña pero muy surtida.  En ella se puede encontrar una  gran variedad de artículos, desde ropa interior femenina y masculina hasta cosméticos, maquillajes, una línea de cremas corporales, bebidas,  vegetales y granos básicos.  Su sonrisa es su mejor arma para atraer más público.  Sus clientes la prefieren por su amabilidad y  por la excelente atención que brinda diariamente. Melva desea continuar invirtiendo en su tienda. 
Planea ampliarla y contar con más artículos para abastecer las necesidades de sus consumidores. Por lo tanto, decidió recurrir a un financiamiento en KIVA Mi Crédito, ya que esta institución siempre apoya a personas emprendedoras como ella,  que aspiran a un futuro mejor. El dinero lo utilizará para la compra de granos básicos, cosméticos y ropa interior,  productos que cuentan con mucha demanda en su tienda.
texts.en:
Melva’s store is small but well-stocked. There, one can find a great variety of items such as men’s and ladies underwear, cosmetics, makeup, a line of body creams, beverages, vegetables, and basic grains. But when it comes to attracting more customers, her smile is her best weapon; her customers prefer her because of her friendliness and the excellent service that she provides every day.

Melva wants to continue investing in her store; she plans to expand it and have more items in order to provide for her customers’ needs. For this reason, she decided to seek a loan with Kiva, MiCrédito, as this institution has always supported enterprising people like her, who aspire to a better future.

She will use the loan to purchase basic grains, cosmetics, and underwear, as these products are very much in demand in her store.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, cosmetics, and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase supplies to treat and prevent pest contamination in her coffee crops.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a 45-year-old housewife who lives with her husband and one son in the small village of Tekatuli in Jalpaiguri district. She is uneducated and can just sign her name. Her son is in grade 10 and will appear for the Board Examination in the coming year. They live in their own house.

 Saraswati's husband is engaged in a small business, but he has a scanty income. That's why he can't give sufficient financial sustenance to his family. With the goal of having her own source of income, Saraswati wants to establish a small grocery shop on the porch of her house. She wants to sell different grocery items, such as rice, dal, oil, sugar, salt, biscuits, etc., to her neighbors. She wants to start the store from her house. She is very hardworking and energetic. She wants to devote full efforts to establish the business.

So, she has taken a loan from BJS to purchase merchandise for the inventory of her business. With the help of this loan, she will be able to start her shop and consequently improve their living conditions.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to start her grocery shop.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 23 décembre 2010. Ce banc regroupe des membres qui habitent le même village et ceux des environs.
Khady debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont une fille.
Avec le prêt elle envisage d'acheter un mouton à 25000f, elle va acheter aussi de l'aliment de bétail pour les besoins de l'engraissement.
Les bénéfices lui permettent d’appuyer son mari dans la gestion de la famille, d'ailleurs c'est son mari qui l'épaule dans son activité d'embouche.
texts.en:
This group of women belongs to the banc villeageois created on December 23, 2010. The bank’s members live in the same village or nearby. Khady, the one standing on the right raising the hand in the photo, is 34 years old. She is married and has three children, including one daughter.
With this loan she would like to buy a sheep  at 250,000 West African francs as well as the fodder for her animals, to fatten them well. Her revenues will allow her to help her husband with household expenses. Her husband also helps her with the livestock business.

loans.use: to buy a sheep.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 54, married, and raises his family in a rural community. Despite the hardship of living, he aims to uplift their status of living in order to give his family a better life. With this regard, he and his wife help each other to generate income. Aside from farming, he also runs a small variety store to have an additional source of income. He wants to further improve his store, but he has insufficient capital. 

For this reason, Jimmy wants to obtain a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, snack goods, assorted candies, beverages, noodles, and seasonings to sell. He hopes that, someday, he will make more improvements in his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, snack goods, assorted candies, beverages, noodles, and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia works hard to support her family. Nemesia is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Nemesia has been in this business for 20 years now.

Nemesia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like abaca fiber for her business.

In the future, Nemesia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials like abaca fiber for her business.

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es: El señor Braulio vive en la provincia de Tiraque, se dedica a la producción agrícola no cuenta con muchos recursos económicos y además tiene cinco dependientes de sus ingresos que son sus hijos, el señor muestra ser muy trabajador con capacidad técnica y con muchas ganas de superarse, vive con su cónyuge y trabaja arduamente en su actividad económica, para la siembra y cosecha utiliza personal eventual, tiene una casa propia pero rustica,  desde pequeño ayudaba a su padres en la producción agrícola ahora para realizar su trabajo utiliza tracción animal que son sus propias yuntas, (vacas), actualmente solicita un crédito para capital de operaciones para compra de abono, semillas de papa y haba de esta forma lograra aumentar su producción agrícola y  mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Braulio lives in the province of Tiraque. He works in agriculture and does not have many economic resources and also has 5 people, his children, who are dependent on his income. He has proven himself to be a hard worker with technical capacity and lots of desire to get ahead. He lives with his wife and works hard at his economic activity. He uses day labor to plant and harvest. He has his own house which is quite modest. Since he was young he helped his parents with their agricultural work and now he does his own work using animal power. He has a team of cows he uses. He is requesting a loan for working capital to buy manure, potato and green bean seeds and in this way increase his agricultural production and improve the quality of living for his whole family.

loans.use: to buy manure and potato and broad bean seeds.

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is 55 years old and married, with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Porferia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Porferia has been in this business for ten years and also earns additional income from vegetable-vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Raida

texts.en:
Raida, age 39, fattens pigs to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for seven years now, and she has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to help sustain it.

She and her husband have four children, three of whom are currently enrolled in school.

Raida has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase sacks of feed as well as vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.
 
In the future, Raida would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 45-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy more stock, such as soap, crates of sodas and bags of sugar, to sell. He is a businessman who owns a retail shop to earn a living. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand. He has hopes of becoming a prominent businessman.

George is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy women’s and men’s clothes, blouses, undergarments, children’s clothes, and to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera,  vive en el  municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, ella es costurera, elabora bolsas para mujeres, monederas y otros,  los vende en otro municipio que  es muy visitado por turistas nacionales e internacionales, se dedica a la costura desde hace 10 años, comenta que requiere de mucha paciencia por es un trabajo dedicado. Josefina solicita un crédito por Q. 5,000.00 para comprar materiales de construcción (hierro, cemento y block), con las ganancias de su actividad piensa aplicarle repello a un cuarto. Josefina es una persona muy creativa piensa aprender más sobre costura, ella también se dedica a cultivar la tierra.
texts.en:
Josefina is 38 years old, single, and lives in the city of Sololá in the state of Sololá.  She is a seamstress who makes bags for women, wallets, and other items.  She sells them in another city that is heavily visited by national and international tourists.  She has worked as a seamstress for the past 10 years, and she states that it requires a lot of patience as it is very dedicated job.

Josefina is a seeking a loan of Q. 5,000 to purchase construction materials (iron, cement, blocks) in order to apply plaster to a room.  Josefina is a very creative woman who plans to learn more about sewing.  She also works farming the land.

loans.use: purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is the age of 38, living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a weaver and knots blankets at home. Wool is being used for knotting blankets. There is no better kind of blankets than blankets made by hand, though this is far from implying that all hand-tufted blankets are superior to all machine-made ones. 

Her husband is very expert and knots very fine blankets. This is a very slow and time consuming procedure; he knots blankets over nights. This is the reason her husband sells at a high price, but the problem is, the customers do not agree upon the demanded cost. The demand for fine blankets has been increasing time to time.

However, he wants to buy more raw materials for knotting blankets, but he does not have enough savings to make this purchase possible. Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy wool for knotting blankets.

loans.use: To buy wool for knotting blankets.

loans.name: Sarfaraz

texts.en:
Sarfaraz is a 37-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has six children and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She needs to provide them with good food, health, and education. She needs to earn sufficient income to support her family well.

She has been manufacturing bangles at home along with her husband. Her husband buys silver wire coils from the market, and with a machine they give them round shapes, glue on sequins, and pack them in polythene, then sell them into the market. 

She is in her sixth loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan. She has requested a loan to buy more materials for manufacturing so she can increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

Sarfaraz is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy silver wire coils for making bangles.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, age 43, operates a small clothing business from her home. She purchases clothes from the market at low prices and sells them at a profit to members of her community. The ladies of her town are enthusiastic about her garment collection and appreciate the selection she offers. 

Parveen's husband works in a small business and receives a low wage, so her family is grateful for the extra income that is generated by her efforts. She and her husband have six children. The family lives in Lahore.

Now that the summer season is in process, she would like to buy summer clothing items to offer for sale. Due to household expenses, she does not have the available cash to make these purchases. She has therefore requested a Kiva loan so that she can buy summer clothes, allowing her to cope with customer demand. 

She hopes to use her income to provide better living conditions and facilities for her family. Her greatest wish is to help ensure a bright future for her children.

She is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing items to offer for sale in her community

loans.name: Aroosa

texts.en:
Aroosa is the age of 22, living with her two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a small vegetable shop for many years in a nearby town and earning insufficient income. To grow his business, he is thinking of selling fruits in the evening so that he can grow his monthly income. 

With the passage of time, inflation increases day by, day but the sources of income remain constant. To increase income, he wants to turn his enterprise toward progress. For the purchasing of fruits, he does not have sufficient cash in hand; he tried to borrow some money from his friends and relatives but nobody helped him. 

Therefore, Aroosa has requested a loan for her husband so that he would be able to buy additional fruits to sell in the evening.

loans.use: To buy fresh and seasonal fruits for reselling in the evening.

loans.name: Eudomar

texts.es:
Eudomar es soltero y vive en el Distrito de Huaytara.
Es un joven muy amable y luchador. Actualmente estudia la carrera de Computación e Informática y trabaja como Técnico en Soporte e Instalaciones de Enlace Inalámbrico desde hace dos años y medio.
El mayor sueño de Eudomar es ser un gran profesional y tener su propio negocio, de esta manera podrá retribuir toda la ayuda que le han brindado sus padres.
Eudomar estará eternamente agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo cubrir algunas necesidades personales y de estudios y así continuar con su profesión y graduarse dentro de poco tiempo.
“Gracias Kiva”
texts.en:
Eudomar is single and lives in the District of Huaytara. He is a very friendly and determined young man. Eudomar is currently studying for a degree in Computer Science and Information Technology. He has been working as a wireless installation and support technician for the past two and a half years.

Eudomar’s greatest wish is to become a successful professional and have his own business. This would enable him to repay his parents for everything they have given to him. Eudomar is eternally grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, he will be able to cover a few personal needs and his studies. This will allow him to continue in his profession and graduate in a short amount of time. He says, “Thank you Kiva.”

loans.use: to pay for his studies and a few personal expenses.

loans.name: Karla Stefany

texts.es: Karla tiene 23 años de edad y habita junto a su grupo familiar. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa variedad de productos como: golosinas, sal, café, azúcar, pan dulce, etc. Este negocio es muy importante para la economía de su familia dado que con lo que percibe de su tienda logran cubrir los gastos del hogar. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de mercadería como: pan dulce, cereales, café, sal, golosinas, detergente y de más productos demandados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Karla is 23 years old and she lives with her family. She has a store in which she sells a variety of products such as candy, salt, coffee, sugar, sweet bread, and other items. 

This business is very important for her family’s economy, as with the income from her store they are able to cover the household expenses. For this reason, she is requesting a loan with FUSAI in order to invest in her business, purchasing merchandise such as sweet bread, cereal, coffee, salt, candy, detergent, and other products requested by her customers.

loans.use: to purchase sweet bread, cereal, coffee, salt, candy, detergent, and other items.

loans.name: Rhina

texts.en:
Rhina is 21 years old and married. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years, and she sells a variety of items, including shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, coffee, juice, and biscuits.

Rhina has requested a PHP 16,500 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy additional inventory for her store, like shampoo, canned goods, and coffee. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan, to further build her business. In the future, Rhina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her store, like shampoo, canned goods, and coffee.

loans.name: Leydi Viviana

texts.es: Leidy es una hermosa joven emprendedora que hace dos años inicio con un proyecto de negocio el cual es la venta de ropa enfocándose en las damas, actividad que surge ante la necesidad de generar capital para sus gastos universitarios, vende blusas jeans, abrigos, conjuntos deportivos entre otros. Leidy es una mujer soñadora que aspira a tener un establecimiento constituido en el cual sus clientes que básicamente son estudiantes, amigos y vecinos puedan acudir y constituirse como un almacén elite en la ciudad, solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía; jeans, blusas, pantalones, que son los artículos que más le piden. Su principal sueño es montar un almacén propio y sabe que este crédito es un buen comienzo para encarrilar este tan anhelado sueño.
texts.en:
Leidy is a lovely and enterprising young woman. Two years ago, she started a business project that involved selling clothes geared toward women. This venture came about because she needed to generate capital for her university expenses.

Leidy sells blue jeans, coats, sportswear, and other items. She is a dreamer who aspires to have an establishment where her customers consisting of students, friends, and neighbors can come and buy at an elite shop in the city. Leidy is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise such as jeans, blouses, and trousers, which are the items that are most requested. Her main dream is to establish her own shop. She knows that this loan is a good start toward getting her long-awaited dream back on track.

loans.use: to buy jeans, blouses, and trousers.

loans.name: Lucy Lorena

texts.es: Lorena es una señora tranquila, tiene 2 hijas y es madre soltera, Lorena vive con sus 2 hijas de 4 y 7 años y las niñas asisten a la escuela, Lorera vive en una ciudad pero debido a que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería ella se traslada todos los días al campo, el crédito lo va invertir en la compra de chanchos para tenerlos en una chanchera  que le presta una familiar, la aspiración de Lorena es incrementar su negocio y que mediante este no les falte nada a sus hijas.
texts.en: Lorena is a calm woman.  She is a single mother of two daughters.  Lorena lives with her two daughters, ages four and seven who both attend school.  Lorena lives in a city, but given the fact that she works farming and raising livestock she travels everyday to the countryside.  She will invest her loan in purchasing pigs to keep them in a pigsty that a relative lends her.  Loren's aspiration is to expand her business and through this, ensure that her daughters never lack anything.

loans.use: purchase pigs.

loans.name: Hirari

texts.en:
Hirari is 35 years old. He is married and has three children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer, during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. He wishes to invest his profits from farming in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs, during rice production.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Rosalinda earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en: Juanito operates a food-vending business in his local community to earn a living. He has been in business for more than seven years and, with the help of his wife, earns well to provide for the needs of his family. His previous loan from GDMPC micro-credit was successfully repaid. Currently, he has requested a new loan to purchase more ingredients to cook. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to cook

loans.name: Junel

texts.en: To generate income, Junel raises hogs within the local community. She is 20 years old and single. Her ambition in life is to become successful and financially stable in the future. She has been in business for more than six years. She aims to improve and strengthen her business to earn a higher income and help her mother sustain their daily needs. Due to financial insufficiency, she needs a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. She believes that her loan will enable her to further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 24-year-old widowed woman with one child, who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosemarie has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosemarie has been in this business for five years. Rosemarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sulpicia

texts.en:
Sulpicia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her weaving business.

Sulpicia has been in this business for 11 years. Sulpicia earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Sulpicia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Warlina

texts.en:
Warlina, age 47, fattens pigs to earn an income. She has been in this business for two years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to help sustain it.

She and her husband have three children, one of whom is still in school.

Warlina has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Her goal is to continue to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en:
Leonie is 51 years old, married, and has six children. She would like to use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer to increase production. With profits from farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Annuarite

texts.en:
Annuarite is married with four children. She would like to use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer to increase production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a 41-year-old married man with five children, four in school. He has operated a transport business for 18 years and also owns a drug shop for additional income. Amos began the businesses to educate his children. He has a vision of starting up a well-equipped transport company around Kasese. Amos is requesting a loan to to buy a car for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a car for his transport business.

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
Hamid, age 30, runs a butcher shop to earn an income. Initially, his family was in such financial crisis that he chose to take any available job in order to support them, and he started as a worker in a restaurant in the capital city. Little by little, this very talented and responsible professional young man was able to accumulate and save enough money to start his own business. He has operated his business for six years now, selling meat to restaurants and individuals in the capital city. 

Hamid and his wife have two children. The family lives in a rented house in Sana'a.
 
Hamid's first loan from Kiva lenders assisted him in improving his business. Now that he has completed repayment, Hamid has decided to apply for a second loan in the amount of 200,000 YER from AMB. He will use his loan funds to further improve his business by purchasing a greater quantity of meat to offer for sale to local customers and restaurants. 

Hamid looks forward to further expanding his business. He hopes eventually to purchase a piece of land and build his own house. He is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy meat to offer for sale to local restaurants and individuals

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.en:
Annonciata is married to a farmer, and they have five children. She would like to use a Kiva loan, to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer, in order to increase production. She wishes to invest her profits from farming in the business, so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs, during rice production.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is married and has three children. He would like to use a Kiva loan, to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer, in order to increase production. He wishes to invest his profits from farming in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs, during rice production.

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju, 40, lives and manages her farms in the Chittoldiya village, Deoghar, Jharkhand. She is married and the mother of three sons. Her husband and elder son help her in taking care of the dairy farm. Her second son works as a mason while the youngest son works in agriculture fields. The family has about 15 acres of cultivable land.
   
Manju joined the local NGO called “MESP”, which helps low-income people with financial support for their projects. She is very energetic, hard working and is very confident. Manju purchased just one cow and started her farm. She raises the cow and sells the milk in her locality, as there is good demand for it. She earns around INR 400 per day. 

Manju along with her husband (seen in the picture) wants to buy another cow. For this reason, she needs a loan. The loan will help her to expand her dairy farm and earn more profit, which will enable her to give a better life to her family. 

Manju hopes to save enough for her family’s growth. 

This is her first loan from Kiva. She is very much excited about the loan and is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 45-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. 

Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building-making. In this regard, her husband needs raw materials, such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods, and sheets to manufacture iron accessories to improve his shuttering work. 

So that he can generate more income to financially support his family, Razia is applying for a loan from Kiva field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband's work. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods, and sheets for shuttering work.

loans.name: Janneth Alexandra

texts.es: Alexandra tiene 28 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 12 años que asiste a la escuela, vive con su esposo que es chofer y con su hijo, se dedica a la   crianza de chanchos desde hace 2 años, también se dedica a trabajar de empleada domestica a medio tiempo en dos casas, esta señora responsable va a invertir el crédito en la compra de chanchos para tenerlos en chancheras que le alquilan para que tenga sus animalitos, Alexandra aspira que le siga yendo bien en su negocio para que a su hijo no le falte nada y siga estudiando.
texts.en: Alexandra is 28 years old and has a 12 year old son who goes to school. She lives with her husband who is a driver and her son. She has been raising pigs for 2 years. She also works as a domestic employee part time in two houses. This responsible woman is going to invest the loan in buying pigs and put them in the sty that she rents to keep her animals. Alexandra hopes that her business continues to go well so that her son lacks nothing and continues with his studies.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien is single. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase  production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).
