Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia is 58 years old and married with six children.

Virgenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like detergent soap, shampoo, coffee, sugar, bath soap, and snack foods to sell.

Virgenia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from firewood vending.

Virgenia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like detergent soap, shampoo, coffee, sugar, bath soap, and snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is a 35-year-old, single woman. She has five children, four of them going to school. Scovia sells cassava flour on a busy street, working six days a week and eleven hours a day. She began the business, to get income to pay school fees for her children, which is her greatest desire. She also desires to expand her business into new markets. She meets the difficulties of inadequate capital and competition.

Scovia needs this loan, to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has a boutique in Hoima, Uganda. She is thirty-one years old, single, and has three children. Two of her children attend school. She works six days a week, having started the business in 2006. She started the business for profit-making purposes. She earns additional income from farming. She intends to expand her business, despite weather changes that hinder her business.

She will use the loan money to buy new clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for selling.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 45 años de edad vive con su hijo de 14 años que asiste al colegio y las 3 hijas mas ya son independientes, Lucia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y entre estos a la crianza de cuyes que son un buen negocio ya que este es un animal muy consumido como plato típico de la provincia en la que reside Lucia, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para incrementar su negocio, ella vive en una casa que le presta un familiar y su sueño es que su negocio se mejor y que su hijo estudie hasta que saque un titulo universitario.
texts.en:
Lucia, 45, lives with her 14-year-old son, who goes to high school. Her 3 daughters are already independent. Lucia raises small livestock among those are guinea pigs which is a great business as this is an animal that is consumed a lot because it’s a typical dish in the province which Lucia resides. 

Lucia will invest the loan to purchase guinea pigs to increase her business. She lives in a rented house owned by a relative. Her dream is for her business to improve and that her son receives a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mercedes Briggitte

texts.es:
El aroma de los deliciosos Hot Dogs de  Mercedes despierta el apetito de todos los habitantes de su comunidad. Junto  con su esposo, transitan diariamente en su carrito  por las calles  de su barrio  ofreciendo  los mejores Hot Dogs que existen.  Ha logrado buenas ventas  y fieles consumidores  que la prefieren por su sazón y exquisito  sabor de los ingredientes que  agrega a  su comida. 
Gracias a sus ahorros adquirió  el carrito para la distribución de sus deliciosos  Hot dogs. Las ganancias han sido buenas y desea mantener ese mismo nivel de ventas. Mercedes recurrió a un financiamiento para la compra de salchichas, pan, mostaza, salsa de tomate, productos que utiliza en la preparación  de los Hot Dogs, asimismo, anhela obtener una computadora con el fin de contabilizar los ingresos  de su negocio.
texts.en:
The aroma of Mercedes’s delicious hot dogs whets the appetite in all the residents in the community. Mercedes and her husband travel daily with their cart through the neighbourhood streets offering the best hog dogs ever.  She has had good sales and loyal customers who prefer her products for the taste and exquisite flavours of the ingredients that she adds to her food. 

With her savings, she purchased a cart to sell her delicious hot dogs. The earnings have been very good and she wants to maintain this level of sales. 

Mercedes is requesting a loan to purchase hot dogs, bread, mustard, and ketchup, products used in the preparation of the hot dogs. Also she wishes to have a computer in order to do bookkeeping for her business.

loans.use: to purchase hot dogs, bread, mustard and ketchup.

loans.name: Jose Helder

texts.es: José, tiene 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos, y reside en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  José lleva 4 años de dedicarse a cultivar café, cuenta con su propia parcela de donde saca sus ingresos para la manutención familiar. El préstamo que solicita es por 25,000 lempiras para limpieza y fertilización de 3 manzanas de cultivo de café. El propósito es mejorar las condiciones del cultivo, aumentar la producción y poder tener un nivel económico mejor.
texts.en: José is 24 years old and lives with his common-law wife and two children in the community of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. José has been growing coffee for 4 years. He has his own piece of land where he generates the income to support his family. The loan he is requesting is for 25,000 HNL to clean and fertilize 3 manzanas of coffee production. His goal is to improve the growing conditions, increase his productivity and be able to enjoy a better financial situation.

loans.use: to clean and fertilize 3 manzanas of coffee crops.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi, 27, is a responsible mother and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her fifth loan with BRAC Pakistan as a long-time member. She has been taking out loans to meet the needs of her family.
She belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to fulfill all her household expenses with low earnings. Her husband has been changing the nature of his business due to the weather. He decided to sell fish, which has a very expensive inventory. He does not have cash in hand to buy fish because the prices have risen higher than last year. 
Therefore, Allah Rakhi has requested a Kiva loan for her husband so he can buy fish to carry on his business. She is very impressed with this honorable support. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fish for reselling

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en: Fouzia is 35 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver, by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the past ten years. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of regular use. He believes that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore, Fouzia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use this loan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will enable him to continue his business. Fouzia is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of a new auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing services related to demolition of buildings and road construction, for the past 10 years. For example, he removes raw materials of old buildings and assists in road construction, by driving his jack machine.

Fouzia's husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. He needs to buy a new jack machine, because the current condition of his jack machine is not good. Therefore, Fouzia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Fouzia's husband can afford the cost of a new jack machine. In this way, he will be able to provide better services to earn the profitable income. Fouzia also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income, to meet her family's needs in future. Fouzia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new jack machine

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie has spent eight years in rice production. She is married and has four children. She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer, during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. She wishes to invest profits from her farming in her business, so that in the future she will be able to acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs, during rice production.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge es una persona de 32 años de edad, viven con su familia en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, tiene 4 hijos, 2 hombres y 2 mujeres, se dedica a cultivar papa y maíz, los vende en el mercado del municipio, la otra actividad que le genera ingresos es la elaboración de trajes típicos de forma artesanal, la mayoría de trajes los vende en el lugar donde vive, Jorge solicita un crédito por un monto de Q. 5,500.00 para comprar insumos para el cultivo de papa (semilla de papa, fertilizante, abono orgánico y otros) con las ganancia que obtenga Jorge piensa aplicarle repello a uno de los ambientes de su casa, con fin de mejorar las condiciones donde vive con su familia.
texts.en: Jorge is 32 years old and lives with his family in the Municipality of Sololá, in Sololá Department. He has four children, two male and two female. He grows potatoes and corn which he sells in the municipal market. His other activity that generates income for him is making traditional clothing as a handicraft. The majority of the clothing he makes he sells in his community. Jorge is requesting a loan for the amount of 5,500 GTQ to buy agricultural inputs to grow potatoes (potato seeds, fertilizer, organic manure and others). Jorge is thinking of using the profits to plaster one of the rooms of his house in order to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and inputs.

loans.name: Legine

texts.en:
Legine is a rice farmer. She would like to use her Kiva loan funds to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. 

Buying fertilizer will allow Legine to increase her farm's production. With the resulting profits, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

Legine and her husband have three children. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is a rice farmer. He would like to use his Kiva loan funds to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production.

Buying fertilizer will allow Bosco to increase his farm's production. With the resulting profits from his farming, he intends to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

Bosco and his wife are blessed with two children. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Mernalyn

texts.en:
Mernalyn, age 39, owns and manages a small retail store while her husband works on their farm. Due to financial hardship, Mernalyn aims to make her business more profitable in order to generate sufficient income. 

Mernalyn wants to increase her product offerings in order to satisfy the demand of her customers, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000. She will use her loan funds to buy more stocks of rice, eggs, canned goods, noodles, snack foods, laundry soap, beverages. and seasonings to offer for sale. 

She is grateful to be receiving a loan that can help her make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy rice, eggs, canned goods, noodles, snack foods, laundry soap, beverages, and seasonings to offer for sale

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Alicia works hard to support her family. She has a business, selling dried fish, in the Philippines. She earns additional income from a general store.

Alicia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Al-Tafa'al Group

texts.en:
Al-Tafa'al group is comprised of four poor women, who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a 200,000 YER loan from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Afrah is the group leader. She is married to an employee, and his salary barely covers living expenses. The house is not furnished completely, and her husband can't afford to complete it. Thus, Afrah decided to help her husband and buy some furniture. Since she doesn’t have enough money, she requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 YER from AMB, to buy a wardrobe.

Afrah hopes that she'll be able to renovate her home, in the future.

loans.use: to buy a wardrobe

loans.name: Condrada

texts.en:
Condrada is 52 years old and married. She has three children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns income by farming rice.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, and other groceries.

Condrada has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo, sugar, and other groceries.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald, age 35, is a banana farmer. He and his wife have three children, and he works hard to support them.

Gerald's primary business challenge is low matooke output (matooke is a variety of cooking banana) on his farm, and he wishes to tackle this problem aggressively because the market for matooke has grown in the area. He used his previous loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings to improve his farm by mulching his banana plantation, and he is confident that this will help increase his yields.

He decided to come to UGAFODE for a second loan in order to buy organic manure and additional mulch. He is confident that this investment will do wonders for his agricultural production.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and mulch for his banana plantation

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa buys and sells grain to earn an income. She has been in this business for five years. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She earns additional income from farming rice. Teresa is a hard-working entrepreneur.
  
She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase rice grain to offer for sale.
 
She dreams of saving sufficient money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice grain to offer for sale

loans.name: Vanis

texts.en:
Vanis, age 51, is a rice farmer. She would like to use her Kiva loan funds to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production.
 
Buying fertilizer will allow Vanis to increase her farm's production. With the resulting profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 
  
She and her husband have three children.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo kuña guapa 2 está en el 1er. ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona muy alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente.
La Sra. Maria  es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a hacer comestibles de todo tipo que después sale a vender por los alrededores de la zona y un poco más alejado donde tiene sus clientes que siempre compran de ella lo que prepara. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este préstamo para comprar condimentos, panificados, hortalizas, carne y demás, para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
The “Kuna Guapa 2” group is on their 1st cycle of the women committee program, they are from the city of Concepcion, which is located far from the center and is an area currently in development.  This is why the members of the group want to fight to continue growing and give their home area a better look.
Maria is one of the members, she works making food of different types that she later sells in the surrounding area as well as further away where she has a clientele that always buy what she makes.  She hopes that as time goes by and through the help of all the people from her area they can improve their surroundings and provide more security to their families and offer them a better future.  
She requests the loan to buy condiments, baking, vegetables, meat and other ingredients.  This will allow her to continue to make food and selling, fighting to advance.

loans.use: to buy condiments, baking, vegetables, meat and other ingredients.

loans.name: Iris Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Iris de 27 años de edad vive  con su pareja compañero de hogar y sus dos hijos  radica en la comunidad del Caimito San Lorenzo, Valle, al sur de Honduras posee casa propia se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de ropa usada sus clientes son los compañeros de trabajo ya que aparte de vender ropa en sus ratos libres ella trabaja como secretaria de una fábrica de sal.
Iris con el apoyo del préstamo ella pretende invertirlo en la mejora de su casa porque necesita ponerle techo a sus baños y una cocina pequeña donde ella hace su comida, necesita comprar láminas, hierro, cemento, arena, y pagar la mano de obra.
Iris es un cliente nuevo, su sueño es ir mejorando su casa con la ayuda de los créditos.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2014.
texts.en:
Iris, 27, lives with her companion, and her two children in the home she owns in the community of Caimito San Lorenzo, Valle, in the south of Honduras.

She has worked for two years selling used clothing.  Her customers are her co-workers, because in addition to selling clothes, in her free time she works as a secretary in a salt factory.

With the support of the loan, Iris plans to invest in improving her house.  She needs to put a roof on her bathrooms and a small kitchen where she prepares food.  She needs to buy sheet metal, rebar, cement, and sand, and pay for labor.

Iris is a new client.  Her dream is to keep on improving her house with the help of the loans.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, April 2014.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, rebar, cement, and sand, and to pay for labor for her bathroom

loans.name: Dalia Rosa

texts.es: Dalia  de 30 años de edad habita con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 6, 8 y 9 años, en un barrio del sur de la ciudad, donde se dedica a la actividad comercial. Ella vende todo tipo de productos a solicitud de su clientela.  Su negocio inició hace 14 años, cuando al sentirse sola en casa después de  mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, atendiendo las solicitudes de pedidos de sus clientes.  Su negocio inició hace 14 años, cuando después de quedarse sola en su hogar y sin mucho que hacer, decidió ponerse activa; así fue como impulsada por una amiga quien le propuso compra y vender ropa entre sus amigas, "le sonó la idea" poniéndola en marcha y hasta la presente no se ha detenido.  Hoy no solo vende ropa, sino perfumería, calzado, ropa para camas que compra directamente y también a través de guías especializadas de productos, empresas a las que se ha afiliado para obtener una mayor diversidad. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito semanalmente, trabajando por las tardes. Su meta mas adelante es tener un almacén y su propia casa para brindar bienestar a sus hijos hasta hacerlos unos profesionales de bien. Su mayor desafío es lograr el dinero suficiente para conseguir alcanzar sus sueños. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara perfumes, calzado, suéteres, y hará reparaciones al vehículo, con esta inversión planea que su negocio obtenga mas clientes y venda mucho mas, para hacer que su credikiva sea muy exitoso..
texts.en: Thirty-year-old Dalia lives with her partner and their three children, who are six, eight, and nine years old, in a neighborhood in the southern part of the city where she has her business.  She sells all kinds of products requested by her clientele.  She started her business 14 years ago when she was feeling lonely at home [...] through specialized guides or catalogs she fills her customers' orders.  She started her business 14 years ago when she was alone at home without much to do and she decided to become active.  So, encouraged by a friend who suggested she buy and sell clothing among their friends, "she got the idea" and put it into action and she has not stopped since.  Today she sells not only clothing, but also perfume, shoes, and bedclothes she buys directly, as well as through specialized product guides, businesses she has built relationships with to have more variety.  She does her sales on credit on a weekly basis, working in the afternoons.  Her goal in the future is to have a grocery store in her own home to offer her children wellbeing until she makes them into real professionals.  Her greatest challenge is getting enough money to achieve her dreams.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy perfumes, shoes, and sweaters, and to repair her car.  With this investment she plans for her business to get more customers and to sell a lot more so that her Kiva loan will be a success.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, shoes, and sweaters, and to repair her car

loans.name: Sharon Rose

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Sharon Rose works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Sharon Rose is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Sharon Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Félix

texts.es: Felix es una persona de 60 años de edad, viven con su familia en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, tiene 8 hijos: 5 hombres y 3 mujeres, se dedica a la agricultura, él cultiva papa, ejote y maíz, de estas actividades obtiene sus ingresos, cuando no esta trabajando en sus cultivos busca trabajo con vecinos y le pagan por día trabajado, Felix solicita un crédito por un monto de Q. 3,000.00 para comprar insumos para la siembra de papa (semilla de papa, fertilizantes, abono orgánico entre otros), con las ganancias que le deja los cultivos piensa comprar ropa para su familia. Felix es una persona muy trabajador ya que preocupa por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Felix is 60 years old. He lives with his family in the town of Sololá, department of Sololá, and has 8 children: 5 male and 3 female. He works in agriculture, growing potatoes, green beans and corn, from which he makes his income. When he is not working on his land he looks for work from his neighbours who pay him for working by the day. Felix is asking for a loan of Q. 3,000.00 to buy inputs for the sowing of potatoes (including potato seeds and chemical and organic fertilizers). With the profits from his crops he would like to buy clothes for his family. Felix is a very hardworking man who worries about the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and other inputs.

loans.name: Jorge David

texts.es: Al hablar de Jorge solo se puede tener admiración y es que una persona criada en el campo por una familia humilde que dependía de sus cosechas para poder vivir no se puede esperar mucho, pero este no es el caso Jorge desde muy joven comenzó a labrar su futuro y precisamente desde los 16 años comenzó con un cultivo de plátano que no le dejaba gran margen de ganancia pero lo suficiente como para pensar en iniciar un pequeño negocio, de esta manera comenzó con la cría de cerdos, con el tiempo se adentró más en el mercado y decidió vender añadido a estos dos negocios peces , construyendo su propio estanque incansable e insatisfecho con lo que hasta el momento había logrado aprendió actividades de construcción y hoy en día es un oficial de construcción que trabaja a contrato, un ser tan polifacético que lo único que quiere es darle a sus 3 hijos la mejor vida posible y que no le importa el sacrificio que este tenga con tal de que sus tres hijos siempre tengan una sonrisa dibujada en su rostro, solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima para la construcción, insumos agrícolas como semillas, pesticidas fungicidas todo con el propósito de mejorar sus ingresos para comenzar a construir la casa de sus sueños.
texts.en: When speaking of Jorge, they can only have admiration, and it is because a person raised in the countryside by a simple family that depends on their harvests to be able to live isn't able to hope for much, but this isn't the case. Jorge, since he was very young, began to shape his future, and precisely at the age of 16, he began with a planting of bananas, which did not leave him a great profit margin, but it was sufficient to think about beginning a little business. In this way, he began to raise pigs. With time he ventured further into the market and decided, in addition to these two businesses, to sell fish, constructing his own pond. Untiring and dissatisfied with what he had achieved up to that point, he learned the construction business, and today he is a construction official who works on contract. He is such a multifaceted person that the only thing that he wants is to give his three children the best life possible, and it doesn't matter to him the sacrifice that this requires, as long as his three children always have a smile on their faces. He is applying for a loan to purchase basic construction materials and agricultural supplies such as seeds, pesticides, and fungicides, all with the objective of improving his income in order to begin building the house of his dreams.

loans.use: to buy basic construction materials and agricultural supplies with which he hopes to generate more earnings in order to begin construction of his own house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pesticides, since his crops are threatened by a variety of animals that roam the area, with the only goal in his mind being to continue going forward.

loans.name: Jader David

texts.es: Jader un hombre de 38 años de edad padre de tres hijos menores de edad, su principal sueño es poder abastecer de agua a toda la región y para ello su familia ha trabajado de generación en generación en la extracción de minerales con el único fin de beneficiar al pueblo, su principal ventaja es que es un negocio legalmente constituido pero presenta dificultades en la transportación del agua, por problemas con los grupos armados que controlan el lugar. Solicita un crédito para la compra de una motobomba que le permita seguir llevando este tan vital liquido al pueblo, que tanto lo necesita y que le agradece en el alma a Jader por el servicio ya que contribuye con un grano de arena para que haya igualdad de condiciones en el país, cuenta con un empleado que le colabora llenando los tanques pero aspira a constituir una empresa donde no solo beneficie a las personas del pueblo con el servicio de agua potable si no brindándoles un empleo y que juntos mejoren sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Jader is a 38 year old father of three young children and his main dream is to be able to supply water to the entire region.  For this goal, his family has worked generation after generation in the extraction of minerals with the sole purpose of benefiting the people of his village.  The main advantage for them is that the extraction is legally constituted, but there are challenges in terms of transporting the water due to problems with the armed groups controlling the area.  Jader is requesting a loan to purchase a pump which will allow him to continue transporting this to the people of his town, who need it desperately and who are grateful for Jader's work so that conditions of equality are improved in the country.  Jader has an employee who works to fill the tanks but hopes to have a company where not only does this service benefit the town by giving people drinking water but also by providing employment so that together they can improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a pump for water extraction and decrease production time.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 66 años, es divorciado, pero actualmente tiene una pareja y un hijo aun pequeño. 
Comenta que desde muy joven trabajó en la ganadería, sus animales y la tierra los recibió como herencia, trabajó desde joven en la política, e incluso fue intendente de una ciudad.
Hace aproximadamente dos años que decidió construir un tinglado en donde montó un autoservice, con productos de primera necesidad y carnicería, hoy en día cuenta con clientela formada. Como se ve es una persona bastante trabajadora, que ha luchado desde joven y que tiene aún muchas ganas de seguir trabajando.
El pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos varios para su autoservice, como ser bebidas, verduras, frutas y demás, de manera a seguir trabajando y luchando.
texts.en:
Jose is 66 years old. He is divorced but he has a partner and a child who is still small.

He says that he has worked with livestock since he was very young. He received animals and land as an inheritance. He has also worked in politics from a young age and was even the mayor of a city.

About two years ago, he decided to build a shed where he began a convenience store with staple products and a butcher's shop. Today, he has an established clientele. He is clearly a very hardworking person who has worked hard since he was young and is still eager to continue working.
The loan he requested will be used to buy more products for the store including beverages, vegetables, fruit, and more so he can keep working.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, vegetables, fruit, and more to stock his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase necessities and make home improvements

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa quien se dedica a la venta de pupusas, Miguel se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos maíz y frijol y también de hortalizas, comercializa sus productos en los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencias, Miguel está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así continuar con sus cultivos para tener junto con su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Miguel is 55 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife, who sells pupusas. Miguel works growing basic grains, such as corn and beans, as well as vegetables. He sells his products in the markets that are close to his residence. Miguel is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, herbicide, etc. and to improve the soil seen in the photograph. This way, he can continue with his crops so he can have better financial stability with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, herbicide, etc., and to improve the soil.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria vive en el distrito de la tinguiña, para poder tener ingresos poder salir adelante y poder apoyar a su familia con algunos gastos de su hogar, trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace 1 año, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su empleo porque es responsable y honesta.

Maria esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá realizar algunas mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, asimismo podrá realizar la compra de enseres para el hogar y poder solventar algunos gastos personales, de esta manera podrá ir mejorando su calidad de vida y poder seguir esforzándose para hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Tener una vivienda propia y un mejor empleo”.
texts.en:
Maria lives in the district of la Tinguiña. She has been working as a domestic employee for the past year in order to have income to get ahead and support her family with some of the household expenses. She works about 9 hours per day and feels things are going well because she is honest and responsible.

Maria is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their support she can make some improvements to the house where she lives and buy some furniture as well as pay off some personal expenses. Doing this Maria can improve her quality of living and continue to strive to achieve her great dream which is to own her own house and to have better work.

loans.use: to make improvements on her house and to buy furniture.

loans.name: Oscar Orlando

texts.es:
Oscar de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, actualmente esta acompañado,  tiene tres hijos, pero entre ellos esta una parejita de gemelos,  su esposa se dedica a los oficios domesticos, sus hijos viven con ellos Oscar dice que su esperanza esque su credito sea aprobado, ya que de ahi podra comprar abono, semilla de maíz y fríjol, pesticidas y herbicidas que necesita para la produccion de la agricultura, le fue mal en un trabajo de un carro que hizo lejos de ganar perdio porque los materiales que compro estaban malos y con esa ganancia él soñaba con ahorrar, porque dice que quiere construir su casa para darles un mejor techo a sus hijitos.

Sus sueños son poder sembrar suficiente para que asi tener el maiz y frijol para el alimento de sus hijos, y que este año le vaya  bien en el taller para obtener mejores ganacias y poder ahorrar mas rapido y empezar a construir su casita ya que donde actualmente vive es ajeno.

Oscar se dedica a la agricultura en pequeño, es dedicr apenas tiene 3 años de dedicarse a eso esto, lo aprendio de un amigo, que se dedica a la agricultura, ademas de eso él es mecanico y le da mantenimiento a los carros, junto con su hermano mayor, ya tiene 2 años de tenerlo lo tiene cerca de su casa, su compañera de vida le ayuda a cuando puede, ya que tiene unos gemelitos que le dan mucho que hacer.
texts.en:
Oscar is 30 years old, and he studied through 5th grade. He is currently in a relationship, and he has three children, among them a pair of identical twins. His wife is a home maker, and his children live with them. 

Oscar says that his hope is that his loan will be approved, because he will be able to buy fertilizer, corn and bean seeds, pesticides, and herbicides that he needs for his agriculture production. Things at a job with a car that he made did not go well- far from earning money, instead he lost money because the materials that he purchased were poor. With that income, he had hoped to save because he says that he wants to build his house to provide a better roof for his children.

His dreams are to be able to plant enough to have the corn and beans as food for his children, and he hopes that this year his work goes well to earn a higher income and be able to save money quickly. He would also like to begin to build his house because where he currently lives is far away.

Oscar has only spent a small amount of time in agriculture- he has only spent 3 years with this. He learned form a friend who makes a living in agriculture. He is also a mechanic and he provides a maintenance service for cars along with his older brother. He has had his mechanic business for two years, and it is close to his house. His partner helps him when she can, because the young twins give her lots to do.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, corn and bean seeds, pesticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Parwish

texts.en:
Parwish is feeling blessed with the help of Kiva lenders. He thanks them a lot. Parwish is a very hardworking and dedicated farmer. With the profits from his rice cultivation of last season, he was able to pay for his wedding.

Parwish wants now to save for the future of his family and also for a pickup truck. That’s why he has expanded his rice production. For the purchase of diesel, fertilizers and pesticides, he asks Kiva lenders for another loan.

loans.use: To purchase diesel, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina, age 45, and her husband have four children and live in Lahore. Her son has been running a cigarette and paan shop for many years near his house. The business is operating very well. 

Due to customer demand, he wants to offer juices, soft drinks, and chilled drinks as well as cigarettes and paan. He does not want his store to be missing these popular products because he does not wish to disappoint any of his respected customers. He feels that his store should offer beverages that people consider necessary and consume regularly in their daily routines. In this way, he will successfully win the trust of his customers and increase his income as well. 

Samina has therefore requested a loan from Kiva field partner Brac Pakistan, so that her son can buy juices, soft drinks, and chilled drinks as well as cigarettes and paan for his shop. She is very happy about this loan and is hopeful that her son will successfully fulfill demand for these essential items so that he can ensure customer satisfaction. 

Samina is very thankful to Kiva and to Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her son in buying juices, soft drinks, and chilled drinks as well as cigarettes and paan to offer for sale in his shop

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 63 years old and married with 12 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional stock of nipa to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of nipa to sell

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois 44 years old. He is a father of two between the ages of one and even.

He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est né le 24 Décembre 2003 à l'inauguration du Banc villageois, ces femmes ont pu acquérir une expérience solide dans le programme après 16 cycles soit environ 08 années de vie commune. Les membres du groupe habitent le même village  et sont animés d’un esprit d’entre aide et de soutien mutuel. Elles sont très actives dans le commerce.

Madame Aminata (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 filles et un garçon. Son activité s’articule autour de la vente de poisson fumé et séché, qu’elle achète en gros par panier auprès de commerçants venus du nord pour la revente au détail.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte achèter en quantité des paniers de poissons 03 pour le poisson séché.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte aider son mari en contribuant sensiblement à la prise des frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
This group was formed December 24, 2003 at the inception of the "banc villageois," where these women were able to acquire solid experience in the borrowing program after 16 loan cycles, 8 of which were part of communal living. 

The members of this group live in the same village and are inspired by a spirit of mutual help and support. They are very active in their business.

Aminata (sitting on the right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 46 years old, married and the mother 4 children, 3 girls and one boy. Her business involves the sale of smoked and dried fish, which she buys in bulk by basked from vendors in the north, in order to resell them at retail.

With this new loan, Aminata plans to purchase 3 baskets of bulk dried fish. With the proceeds, she plans to help her husband and to participate in providing for the education costs of their children.

loans.use: to purchase three baskets of bulk dried fish

loans.name: Julie Ane

texts.en:
Julie Ane is a diligent mother who engages in a fish vending business to help her husband in gaining income. She is 30 years old and has three kids. With the help of her husband, Julie Ane believes that someday, they will improve their status of living. She aims to continue and improve her business, but she has insufficient capital. 

For this reason, she wants a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stock of fish to sell. 

Being a hardworking mother, she believes that she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz has been selling cosmetic products in her village, in addition to running her farm. She supplies assorted kind of cosmetics that she acquired from the market. Her children are on their way to succeed and she has to earn for their needs too. 

Luz has taken a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more cosmetic products to sell. She wants to expand her business to ensure a better source of income for her family. Luz hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Shelly Mae

texts.en: Shelly Mae dreams of having a college diploma; thus, she is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP from Kiva lenders thru ASKI to pay for her tuition fees. She wants to continue studying, for she knows that it is one of her parents' dreams for her. She believes that it is through education that she can help her parents meet their daily expenses. She also wants her father to stop working and rest. In five years, Shelly Mae sees herself as a teacher.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Through hard work and strong determination, Catalina believes that they will improve their living status someday. She is 48 years old and married. She helps her husband in gaining income by selling refreshment foods within the local community. 

She aims to prepare more snack recipes to sell but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, Catalina wants to avail herself of a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy milk, sugar, gelatin, coconut, banana, melon and other ingredients that she needs. She is hoping that she will be able to have her loan so that she will be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, gelatin, coconut, banana, melon and other ingredients.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 46 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna's business was devastated by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Lorna is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business. Lorna has requested 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to restart her business. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Lorna is committed to rebuilding and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Yunalie

texts.en:
Yunalie is 28 years old, married with four children, who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Yunalie has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Yunalie requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more frozen foods to sell.

Yunalie has been in this business for four years. In the future, Yunalie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 53 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for a year and also earns an income from fish-vending.

Jocelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs and noodles.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 43 years old. She is married to a farmer. 

She would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production; she needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. 

She wishes to invest the profits from farming in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions.

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, nails, and iron sheets as well as to pay builders for labor

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne is 44 years old. He would like to use this Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Viateur

texts.en:
Viateur is 36 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have four children. He would like to use this Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre, age 34, is a rice farmer. He would like to use his Kiva loan funds to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production.

Buying fertilizer will allow Jean Pierre to increase production on his farm. With the resulting profits from his farming, he intends to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 48-year-old married male with five children who all attend school. Joseph is a teacher by profession and works 8 hours a day. He has been in service for 22 years and also earns additional income from farming. Joseph was inspired to join the teaching profession due to the government sponsorship. 

Joseph wants money to buy building materials like sand and cement to complete his house. Joseph is reliable however, the long distance to his place of work is the difficulty he encounters.

loans.use: To buy building materials like sand and cement to complete his house.

loans.name: Sithun's Group

texts.en: Sithun’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Phung makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water .

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Srong Soth's Group

texts.en: Sroung’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sroung makes a living cultivating rice and doing extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 28-year-old married man with one child. He lives with his family in their own house in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. Wael has a University education. Recently, he has become an employee in the private sector and has a taxi which he uses to provide transportation. He earns good profits from the taxi but his salary is very low. 

Wael wants to improve the condition of his family by making his house comfortable, but he doesn't have enough money to do that. As a result, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase furniture for the house.

 Wael looks forward to improve the condition of his house.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for the house.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Ruben, tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero, vive junto a un hermano y un primo en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara.  Ruben siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando café y plátano, también ofrece maíz y frijol. Con el propósito de mejorar los cultivos e incrementar la producción va invertir 15,000 lempiras en fertilizantes, abonos, e insumos, principalmente la finca de café. Tiene como meta invertir las ganancias en la compra de más terrenos para cultivar café.
texts.en: Ruben is 27 years old, single, and lives with a brother and a cousin in a village in Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. Ruben has always worked in agriculture, growing and harvesting coffee and plantains. He also grows corn and beans. With the goal of improving his harvests and to increase production, he is going to invest $800 in fertilizers, manures and supplies, principally for his coffee farm. He wants to invest the profits in the purchase of more land to grow more coffee.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and supplies for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is 23 years old, a married woman, and the mother of two daughters. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Nasira has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He wants to fix the rickshaw body and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. Nasira gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw body and engine.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 52-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 10 children. Some of her children are students, and all of them are jobless now and fully dependent upon their father. 

She is requesting a loan for her husband’s fruit selling business. He owns a fruit selling business in a nearby fruit market. With the increase in the household expenses, he wants to grow the business.

Therefore, Rani has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy fresh fruit and an equilibrium to weigh the fruit. 

She wants to save the profit amount so that she can face the sudden incident or medical treatment for her children.

She hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal and fresh fruits for selling by her husband

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a 22-year old high school graduate and lives in a rural village in Bago City. She has 5 siblings and 2 of her sisters are teachers at the local elementary school, while another sister is working for a trading company. Their total monthly income is only Php 12,000.00 ($266). Hannah has a partner who works as a lead man in a construction company, and they have a 1-year old daughter. They're staying at her mother's house since she gave birth so she can take care of her parents. Hannah  has long seen the need to help her partner but didn’t have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of BagoSphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed Bagosphere's selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Once Hannah starts earning, she can help provide her family’s basic needs and save some money for her child’s education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Pich Pil's Group

texts.en: Pich’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Pich makes a living cultivating rice, selling fish and he also works as a teacher to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water .

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Suskhia

texts.en: Suskhia is a 21-year old high school graduate and lives in Bago city. She belongs to a family of 7. Their total monthly family income of Php 10,000 ($222) is barely enough to provide for all their needs. Her father is a security guard, and his monthly income is Php 8,000; her mother is a housewife. The eldest brother is unemployed and lives with the family, and her mother has a small retail store that somehow helps in providing the basic needs of the family.  Being the second child and seeing the poverty that the family is facing motivates Suskhia  to find means to help the family that’s why she braved the selection process of BagoSphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Apart from helping her family, Suskhia also dreams of having her own business and land a permanent job. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Annabelle support herself financially in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Mamafina's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est né le 24 Décembre 2003 à l'inauguration du Banc villageois, ces femmes ont pu acquérir une expérience solide dans le programme après 16 cycles soit environ 08 années de vie commune. Les membres du groupe habitent le même village  et sont animés d’un esprit d’entre aide et de soutien mutuel. Elles sont très actives dans le commerce et la culture sous pluie.

Madame Mamafina  (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 30 ans, mariée  et mère de cinq  enfants dont trois  filles et deux garçons. Elle  s’active de la vente de produits de consommation courante : thé vert, sucre en poudre, pâte d’arachide et divers. Elle se procure la marchandise au marché hebdomadaire de la localité pour la revente par détail au village.

Son nouveau prêt, elle compte s’approvisionner pour un sac de sucre de 50 Kg, un carton de thé vert et quatre seaux de pâte d’arachide.

Les bénéfices lui permettront en plus de renforcer son épargne, d’apporter une assistance plus solide à son mari pour la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 24, 2003 at the inauguration of the Banc villageois. The women in this group have acquired plenty of experience in this program after 16 loan cycles, that is, about eight years of working together. The group members live in the same village and help out each other in a team spirit They are very active working as vendors and growing rainfed produce. 

Mrs. Mamafina (the one seated on the right raising her hand) is a star borrower of the group. She is 30 years old, married and has five children: three daughters and two sons. She sells  basic food items: green tea, granulated sugar, peanut paste, etc. She stocks up at the weekly market in her region and resells retail in her village. She plans to use this new loan to buy a 50-kg bag [110 lbs] of sugar, a box of green tea and four pails of peanut paste.

loans.use: to buy a 50-kg bag  of sugar, a box of green tea and four pails of peanut paste.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en: Warlito is a young entrepreneur who runs a general store in his village to make a living. For three years, he has earned well with the help and support of his wife to provide for the family.  He needs to buy additional grocery goods in order to increase sales.  With the micro finance loan of GDMPC, his plan will be realized. In the future, he wants to acquire a new motorcycle to be used for the business to purchase and carry stock. He wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Triunfadoras De Senkata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TRIUNFADORAS DE SENKATA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dalia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de jugos, venta de comida, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dalia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres hace varios años y cuando decide tener su pareja implementa su negocio independientemente 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros, el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Triunfadoras de Senkata Communal Bank will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional office.  It's made up of nine members governed by a board of directors of which Dalia is the president.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses, including juice sales, food sales, vegetable sales, and a neighborhood store.

The loan they're going to get will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Dalia.  She said she has been a member of Pro Mujer for a year, having joined on the invitation of a friend who's a member of the institution.  Currently she has a business selling vegetables.  She learned the business from her parents several years ago.  When she decided to have her partner, she set up her business on her own.
 
The loan Dalia's getting is to increase her capital and buy vegetables wholesale.  She'll get them from the markets in the city of El Alto to sell in her sales stall.

This job allows her to generate income to support her family, because she lives in a common-law marriage.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the savings, the health field, and the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es: La señora Lisbeth de 19 años de edad, vive en domicilio en alquiler obtiene sus ingresos de la compra y venta de queso, realiza su actividad dos veces por semana ya que solo entrega por mayor y los ingresos le sirve para poder cubrir su alimentación y para el pago de su alquiler. Su diario vivir es muy sacrificado ya que ella misma tiene que sustentar a su familia y desea tener pronto mejores condiciones de vida, con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos solicita un crédito para comprar queso al por mayor  y un refrigerador, de esta forma lograra minimizar los costos de compra y así podrá obtener mejores ingresos, la señora cuenta con amplia experiencia en lo que viene desarrollando y quiere consolidar su actividad para crecer tanto en lo personal como en lo profesional.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is 19 years old and lives in rented accommodation. She derives her income from the purchase and sale of cheese. She carries out her business twice a week, since she only delivers in bulk. The income enables her to pay for her food and to pay her rent.

Her daily life is very demanding because she has to support her family. She wants to have a better life soon. In order to improve her income, she is asking for a loan to buy cheese at wholesale and a refrigerator. In this way she will be able to minimize the cost of purchase and so obtain a better income. Lisbeth has extensive experience in the business she is developing and wants to consolidate her activities to grow both personally and professionally.

loans.use: to buy cheese at wholesale and a refrigerator

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 46 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Judith has a general store business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan on November 8, 2013. Judith has requested a PHP 5000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, chips, canned goods, groceries, etc. to sell to restart her business activities.

Judith has been in this business for 5 years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Judith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, chips, canned goods, groceries, etc. to restart her general store business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is single and has a rice-retailing business, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

In the future, Joan would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda is 54 years old and married with eight children.  With one child in school, Nelda works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Nelda has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as rice, bread, soft-drinks and other groceries. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette is 32 years old. She would like to use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a fridge and rent a house for his business.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Herbert used the previous loan to buy more soap, sugar, salt, sodas, and beer for resale. He operates a wholesale shop, but he also grows crops to earn a living. His main challenge is limited capital. He has dreams of constructing a permanent house for a residence, and of expanding his business into new areas. Herbert intends to use this loan to buy soap, sugar, salt and soda to sell.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar, salt, and sodas  to sell.

loans.name: Caminando Juntos Group

texts.es: Anita de 28 años de edad, casada con 02 hijos dependientes.  Ella es integrante del grupo “Caminando Juntos” conformada por  05 socias emprendedoras. Hace más de 05 años que viene desempeñándose a la venta de comidas como el arroz con pollo. Con el trascurso del tiempo decide complementar su negocio con la venta de productos cosméticos. Actualmente le va bien en su negocio, pues tiene clientes fijos. Posteriormente tiene el anhelo de poner su propio local para poder exhibir sus productos de belleza. Solicitó el crédito  para la compra de arroz, pollo, papa y aceite. Anita junto al grupo “Caminando Juntos” agradecen a los prestamistas Kiva por colaborar en su progreso. Anita es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo manga larga de color plomo.
texts.en: Anita, 28 years old, is married with 2 dependent children. She is a member of the "Caminando Juntos" group, made up of 5 enterprising members. Five years ago, she began selling meals such as rice and chicken.  With the passing of time, she decided to complement her business with sales of cosmetic products. Currently, her business is doing will because she has regular customers. Later, she had the desire to set up her own place to show her beauty products. She asked for this loan to purchase rice, chicken, potatoes, and oil. Anita, along with the group "Caminando Juntos," thanks the Kiva lenders for collaborating in her progress.  Anita is the first on the right, wearing a long sleeve lead-colored shirt.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, pollo, papa y aceite.

loans.name: Minelda Aricela

texts.es:
La señora Minelda de 30  años de edad vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo en la aldea el Tular Nacaome al sur de Honduras, dedicándose desde hace ya vario tiempo su venta es ambulante en los barrios y colonia de san Lorenzo y Nacaome, ella vende ropa nueva americana, perfumes, sandalias y otros.
Doña Minelda el préstamo que está solicitando es de 15,000.00 lempiras, lo necesita para comprar ropa interior, y ropa americana, perfumes, cremas y otros producto que pueda vender y ganar. Con las ganancias de este préstamo ella pretende seguir aumentando su capital de trabajo y seguir mejorando su condición de vida ya que esta terminando de construir su casa.
Con apoyo del préstamo desea lograr su objetivo que es tener su propia casa y seguir luchando para crecer en su negocio.
Minelda su sueño es crecer más con su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2014.
texts.en:
Minelda is a 30-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in the small village of Tular Nacaome in southern Honduras. She has worked for a living for quite some time now as a mobile street vendor in the neighborhoods of San Lorenzo and Nacaome. She sells new American clothing, perfume and sandals, among other items. 

Minelda is requesting a loan for 15,000.00 Lempiras (Honduran currency), which she needs to buy undergarments, American clothing, perfume, creams and other products that she can sell for a profit. 

With her earnings from this loan she hopes to continue increasing her working capital and continue improving her living conditions since she is finishing the construction of her house. With support from the loan she hopes to reach her goal which is to have her own house and to continue fighting to build her business. Minelda's dream is to grow more with her business. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2014.

loans.use: to buy undergarments, American clothing, perfume, creams and other products she can sell for her business.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en: Randy is a hard-working father who raises his family in a rural community. He is 41 years old and has two children in school. Despite the hardship of living, he wants to continue sending his children to school so that they will become professionals in the future. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, he operates his motorcycle transport to have an additional source of income. To continuously use his motorcycle, he wants to take a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline, wheels and other spare parts needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. Being a patient and industrious father, he believes that he will improve his business and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, wheels and other spare parts needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle

location.town: Brgy. La Torre South, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma raises piglets to earn a living. She earns an additional income as a food vendor, selling snacks in her village. She lives in Lantungan with her husband and their two children.  

Thanks to the increased income generated from her piggery business, Alma's previous loan has been successfully repaid.  She is now requesting a new loan in order to purchase feed and supplies.  

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase feed and supplies for her piglets

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en: Aurelio is a businessman, from Oroquieta City. He provides well for his family, through his retail business selling various merchandise. PMPC has been his constant help, for his capital needs. He has applied for another loan, to pay for carpentry work. Recently, he had his small kitchen repaired. Aurelio wishes to maintain his membership with PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for carpentry work

loans.name: Lexis Karen

texts.en: Lexis Karen lives in Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, with her two children. She runs a general store selling goods in their local community.  For a year, she has also been selling rice and corn grits to earn a living. She is requesting a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional stocks like canned goods, noodles, and grains to sell. She plans to expand her store in order to gain more income for the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, noodles, and grains.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter vive en la ciudad de Ica, es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que cada día trabaja con mucho empeño en su empleo como obrero en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener  ingresos para salir adelante y solventar los gastos de su hogar.
