Walter esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá realizar mejoras en la su vivienda, ya que actualmente vive en una choza de esteras, asimismo compra de enseres y solventar algunos gastos personales, de esta manera irá mejorando su calidad de vida y seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Walter lives in the city of Ica. He is a man with a lot of desire to get ahead, and because of this he works every day with determination in his job as a farm worker in an estate in his city. With this job, he can have income in order to get ahead and pay for the costs of his home.

Walter is grateful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, he will be able to make improvements on his house, since he currently lives in a hut made of rush matting, and also to buy basic necessities and pay off some personal costs, in order to improve his quality of live and continue working toward achieving his greatest dream: "finish building his house."

loans.use: to improve his house, and to purchase basic necessities.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina, age 47, runs a general store to earn an income. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, snack foods, canned goods, soft drinks, diapers, and beer. 

Christina and her husband have three children, one of whom is still in school. Christina works very hard to provide for her family.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy additional stocks of such items as detergent soap, snack foods, canned goods, soft drinks, diapers, and beer to offer for sale.
 
Christina would like to build and expand her business sufficiently enough to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as detergent soap, snack foods, canned goods, soft drinks, diapers, and beer to offer for sale

loans.name: Dorisa

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Dorisa works hard to support her family. She has a business, selling fruit, in the Philippines. She earns additional income from a general store.

Dorisa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use this loan to purchase more stock of fruit to sell.

Dorisa has been sustaining her business activities, with one previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fruit, for her fruit stand

loans.name: Jesriel

texts.en:
Jesriel is 16 years old and is the first-born of three children in the family. He is borrowing PHP 8,000, which he will use to pay for tuition fees of the first semester, 2014-15 academic year.

Jesriel is currently in the first year of his four-year Bachelor of Elementary Education course. When he graduates, he plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha is a married woman, who has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elisha is 63 years old, and she has one child who is still in school. She has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Elisha requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 41 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. Lorna works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase additional stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, chips, and soft drinks.

Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, and chips

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorena is 34 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Lorena has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional bicycle for her business. Lorena has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 49 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Rebecca has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from raising pigs. Rebecca aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois, age 43, is a rice farmer. He would like to use his Kiva loan funds to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production.

Buying fertilizer will allow him to increase his farm's production. With the resulting profits from his farming, he intends to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert provides motorcycle transportation services to earn an income. He has found this sector to be very lucrative, and he used his previous loan to buy a second motorcycle. His major challenge has been mechanical breakdowns due to bad roads. 

His goal is to own at least three motorcycles so as to diffuse the risks arising from mechanical breakdowns. He is requesting a loan in order to complete payment on a motorcycle.

Robert's dream is to to build a permanent house for his family and to ensure the education of his children.

loans.use: to complete payment on a motorcycle

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy works hard to support his family by rearing goats and engaging in farming. He lives with his wife and children in Kagadi. 

Willy has repaid his previous loan, which was used to pay school fees for his children. Limited capital and seasonal changes pose obstacles to his business and affect his financial situation; nevertheless, his primary objective is to ensure the education of all six of his children. Therefore, Willy is requesting another loan to help him pay their school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es: Beatriz es una humilde campesina que junto a su esposo encontraron en el cultivo la manera ideal para criar a sus 5 hijos ejerciendo una labor que realmente los hace feliz, los productos que sacan los distribuyen en la plaza de mercado. Gracias a los buenos resultados que han tenido en el cultivo ha hablado con su esposo respecto al tema de ampliar sus cultivos y es por esta razón que solicitan un crédito para la compra de insumos de agricultura como semillas de papa, tomate, zanahoria entre otras abonos y fertilizantes para sacar el mayor provecho a sus tierras persiguiendo su principal sueño el cual es mantener ese estilo de vida ya que son una familia muy feliz y orgullosa de lo que son.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a humble peasant farmer who, with her husband, discovered in crop farming the ideal way to raise her 5 children, doing work that really makes them happy. The products which they grow, they sell in the marketplace.

Thanks to the success they have had with the crops, Beatriz has spoken to her husband on the topic of extending their crops. She is therefore seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seed potatoes, tomatoes, carrots and more compost and fertilizer to get the most out of her land and to pursue her main dream which is to maintain their lifestyle because they are a very happy family and proud of who they are.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seed potatoes, tomatoes, carrots, compost and fertilizer with which to increase the demand for requested products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay for home solar lighting systems

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay for household solar lighting

loans.name: Waheeda

texts.en:
Waheeda is a 39-year-old mother of 4 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession.  He sells fruits like apples, bananas, grapes, etc. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Waheeda's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales, and earn the maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position he is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business.

Therefore Waheeda has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel, tiene 23 años de edad, esta soltero, vive junto a un hermano en una aldea que pertenece a Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  Hace 5 años que realiza sus propios cultivos de café, maíz y frijol. Esta producción la vende en el mercado de la zona y es su fuente de ingresos.  El préstamo que ha solicitado es por  12,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar abonos, fertilizantes y limpiar la finca de café y sus otros cultivos. Con esta asistencia que dará espera sacar mejor cosecha y mejorar las ganancias. Su meta es construir su propia casa.
texts.en: Manuel, 23 years old, is single and lives with a brother in a village that is part of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. It has been 5 years that has been growing his own coffee, corn and bean crops. He sells these products in the regional market and they are his source of income. He has asked for a loan of 12,000 lempiras with which he will purchase natural and chemical fertilizers, and clean the farmland around his coffee and other crops. With this help, he hopes to have a better harvest and improve his income. His goal is to build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase natural and chemical fertilizer, and to clean the farmland around his coffee and other crops.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: La señora Emilia de 44 años de edad de estado civil casada, tiene 3 hijos dependientes, se dedica a la producción agrícola, cultivando papa, locoto, zapallo y achojcha en terreno propio en el municipio de Colomi de esta forma ella mantiene a sus hijos y cubre todos los gastos de su familia, ya que su esposo le abandono hace 3 años y no sabe nada de el. Actualmente la señora solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como productos agroquímicos, abono orgánico (gallinaza) y plantines de locoto para agrandar su cultivo, de esta forma pretende mejorar sus ingresos económicos y así tener una vida más prospera junto a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Emilia is 44 years old and is married with three dependent children. She makes a living as a farmer, growing potatoes, peppers, squash, and caigua on her own plot of land in the community of Colomi. This is how she supports her children and covers all her family's expenses, since her husband left her three years ago and she never hears from him. 

Today, Emilia is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as agrochemicals, organic compost (poultry manure) and pepper seedlings to increase the number of crops she grows. In this way, she hopes to improve her earnings and as a result, create a more prosperous life for her and her three children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as agrochemicals, organic compost (poultry manure) and pepper seedlings.

loans.name: Darío

texts.es:
El señor Darío habita en la comunidad Los panales ubicado a 5 kilómetros del municipio de El Sauce, es una pequeña comarca conformada por 20 casas donde todos sus habitantes son muy unidos.
Don Darío tiene la edad de 56 años, se ha desempeñado por más de treinta años como maestro de primaria donde tiene gran experiencia en la educación de los niños.
Gracias a los préstamos que le ha otorgado Kiva a través de Ceprodel ha mejorado las condiciones de su vivienda donde hoy ofrece en mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
Don Darío con el fin de seguir mejorando su casa y ampliándola, solicita un préstamo para la compra de cemento, ladrillos, hierro y arena, ya que quiere construir un cuarto, debido a que su familia es bien numerosa y poco a poco quiere ir dando mayor espacio a cada uno de sus hijos.
Espera y confía en Dios que estas personas apoyen su solicitud, ya que con el salario de maestro muchas veces no se pueden cumplir metas y estos préstamos vienen ayudar al asalariado.
texts.en:
Señor Darío lives in the community of Los Panales located 5 kilometres from the town of El Sauce. It is a small village of 20 houses, and all its inhabitants are very close.

Darío is 56 years old, and has made a living for over 30 years as a primary school teacher, gaining a huge amount of experience in educating children. Thanks to loans awarded to him by Kiva through Ceprodel, he has made improvements to his home, which today, offers better living conditions to his children.

With the aim of continuing to improve his house and extending it, Darío is requesting a loan to buy cement, bricks, metal and sand. He wants to build a room, because he has a large family and little by little, he wants to give each of his children more space. He hopes and trusts in God that people support his application, since with a teacher's salary, it is often difficult to achieve your goals and these loans help to supplement his earnings.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, metal and sand.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is 51 years old and chose to be single. She owns and manages a small retail store within her community. She aims to make her business profitable in order to earn a higher income. 

She planned to acquire more stock of grocery items to sell, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock of canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, snack foods, soaps, beverages and seasonings to sell. 

She believes that her loan will be a great help for her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, snack foods, soaps, beverages and seasonings to sell.

location.town: Brgy. La Torre North, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 49 years old, married and from Oroquieta City. She is a businesswoman who does sewing services. She has been doing this for ten years and sufficiently provides for her family. 

Recently, Imelda requested a loan to purchase construction materials for her house repair. Imelda hopes to improve their living condition.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repair.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta, age 56, earns a living by taking in and raising pigs owned by people in her neighborhood. Upon sale, the piglets' owners share in the profit, which is divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending on their agreement with Loreta. 
 
Motivated by the desire to earn more, Loreta decided to raise pigs on her own as well. With a loan through Pauglam PC, she obtained the capital to purchase her own piglets and feed.
  
She is now requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 in order to purchase additional piglets to raise. 
 
Loreta lives with her husband and family in Landing, Baliangao. Both she and her husband work hard to support the family. She hopes and prays that her business will grow so that it can better sustain the needs of her children. 
 
Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage so that she can more easily keep more sanitary conditions for her animals.

loans.use: to purchase piglets

loans.name: Marie Phe

texts.en:
Marie Phe is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a frozen-food-vending business, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use this loan to purchase more packs of frozen food to sell.

Marie Phe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, age 55 and widowed, fattens pigs to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She earns an additional income from food vending.

Lilia is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Her dream is to save sufficient money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

Marlyn has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from a computer shop.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

loans.name: Daiane

texts.en:
Daiane, 25, lives with her parents and helps pay the costs of the house. She loves to cook, and before opening her business, she worked in a restaurant kitchen. 

She has a shop where she sells handbags she designs. Daiane is very creative and always has ideas of innovative designs. With the money, she wants to buy more fabric to increase the variety of models and also make a new catalog of bags, which is key to sales on the site.

http://www.daibags.com/novo/

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, packing, redesign her website and create a catalog of photos

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
'Hardworking mother' best describes Maridel, 35 years old, residing in the Poblacion Municipality of Sibutad, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Maridel has one child and she is married.  The wage that her husband gets isn’t enough to sustain the daily needs of their family. So, Maridel started a business, a food stand or 'carenderia.' Maridel has been in the business for more than a year now. 

Maridel wants to expand her food stand business. She wants to gain more profit and to have enough money to sustain her family, especially her child, and she would be able to send her daughter to college. 

In order for Maridel to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 6,000 in additional capital to use to expand her business.  She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils, and other things that are needed in the food stand. She hopes to live a comfortable life with her family, someday.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils, and other things that needed in the food stand.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion offers motorcycle transport services to earn a living. She also uses her motorcycle to transport ready-to-wear clothing to customers in her village and nearby communities, allowing her to generate additional income. She is creative and is always thinking of ways to augment the family income. Her husband is a farmer and they both work hard to support the family.
 
In order to improve sales, Asuncion is requesting a loan in order to buy more goods to offer for sale to her customers. 

She plans to improve the business to ensure better sources of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing and other goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old and married with two children. With her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Vilma has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Valdina

texts.en:
Valdina, 41, is married and has a 13-year-old daughter. She is a seamstress and produces bags, backpacks and clothing. She loves to talk, is a very cheerful woman and wants to grow professionally and to provide a better future for her daughter. 

She needs to expand her store by installing a small printer so she can produce higher-quality pieces, thus bringing in more profits. She will also buy more fabric so that she can increase her production.

loans.use: to buy fabric and construction material

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 31 years old. He is married with three children. He would like to use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farm, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.  

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Norma Felicidad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA-TERMINAL, él banco eta ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Norma tiene 47 años de edad, tiene 02 hijos  y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una empresa privada de transporte interprovincial, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para gastos personales como bienes de consumo.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Señor de Huanca-Terminal communal bank. The bank is located in the department of Cusco.

The member, Norma, is 47 years old. She has two children and is separated from her spouse. She alternates her daily activities with working in a private inter-province transportation company. She has been working in this job for quite a while, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work every day. She is a responsible person, which is how she provides for her family.

She is requesting the loan for personal expenses like consumer goods.

She feels grateful for the loan granted, and she promises to make her established loan payments.

loans.use: to pay for personal expenses like consumer goods

loans.name: San Calixto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN CALIXTO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucila es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa, venta de queso, venta de comida, servicio de transporte, tejido de chompas, venta de queso.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucila es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio familiar y que al empezar a convivir con su pareja deciden seguir realizando el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por quintal) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene diez hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The San Calixto communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi regional center.  It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors.  Lucila is the president.  The businesses that the members carry out are varied and among them are selling potatoes, selling cheese, selling food, transportation service, and knitting sweaters.  

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business people where Lucila is a member.  She states that this is the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation from a representative of the institution who went to visit her at her house.  She currently has a business selling potatoes.  She says that this business was a family business.  When she started living with her life partner they decided to continue working in the same business.

The loan she will now take out is to increase capital in order to buy potatoes by the ‘quintal’ [about 100 pounds] that she will get from the wholesale sellers in her community.  She will later sell them at her sales space.  The way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is in a common-law marriage and has ten children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima requested a PHP 14,900 loan through PMPC to buy more nipa roofing to sell. She has been in this business for five years now. She signed up for her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record.

Maxima would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 53 years old. He is married and blessed with four children. His wife provides additional income. 

He has been running his business for five years, and the business is doing well. He earns an income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family.

He has applied for a loan of KES 40,500, after successfully repaying all his previous loans. Through his loan, he will buy more stock of green groceries, such as fresh tomatoes, onions and assorted vegetables, for sale. 

In the future, he hopes to educate his children and open a larger grocery.

loans.use: to add stock of green groceries.

loans.name: Jayfee

texts.en:
Jayfee provides transportation services in his community and he earns well from this. This is the main source of his income. He has been running this for business for more than nine years.   

Jayfee is requesting this loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy new tires for the vehicle and to pay for maintenance costs.  

In the future, Jayfee wants to have a family and he wants them to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy new tires and pay for maintenance costs.

loans.name: Martinus

texts.en:
Martinus is a 38-year-old man, married to Agustina, a 38-year-old woman. They have five children between 15 and 2 years old.

Martinus is running a poultry business at his residence. He has been running the business for about eight months by using his own capital. Martinus usually buys chicks and fodder from the supplier. He needs two to four weeks to raise the chicks and sell them to his customers. The customers usually come to his residence when the chickens are ready to sell.

Currently, Martinus needs some capital to buy more chicks and fodder; therefore, he has requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,500,000.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and fodder

loans.name: Niddy

texts.en:
Niddy is 38 years old. She is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and three children. She is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

Niddy wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mark Anthony

texts.en: Mark Anthony, a father of an only child, provides transportation services in his village to make a living. For more than three years, he has earned well enough to provide for the family.  He needs to repair and maintain his motorcycle to improve the services to his customers. With the micro finance loan from GDMPC, his plan was realized. He also has a boarding house rental and services. In the future, he wants to improve his boarding house and to acquire a new unit of motorcycle to use to expand his services.

loans.use: to cover repairs and maintenance costs for his motorcycle

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina's business is still running well. She is 60 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. For more than seven years while running the business, she was able to repay her previous loans used for the business successfully. Continuing the business, she still wants to improve sales. With this, she took a new loan to purchase additional vegetables to sell. She wants to improve the business in order to gain more and ensure a better income in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is married and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, with her family. Her husband is a government employee. She has operated a hog-raising business for many years to earn income in addition to her husband’s salary. She had her previous loan from GDMPC that she used to buy feed. Recently, she took out a loan to purchase feeding supplies. She hopes to improve and expand her business to generate more revenue for the family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Melinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as shoes, slippers, shorts, blouses, etc., to sell to her customers.

In the future, Melinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as shoes, slippers, shorts, blouses, etc., to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 39 years old and married, with three children.

Nancy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nancy has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from selling purified drinking water.

Nancy aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 30 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Elvie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elvie has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Lucila con su credikiva anterior, pues logró comprar pantalones, cosméticos y ropa interior, sus ingresos hoy son mayores para poder llegar a la meta de agregar un nuevo negocio a su actividad actual, que es el servicio de mejoramiento de la imagen personal, a través de una sala de belleza, que representa mas estabilidad a su grupo familiar. Ella agradece mucho a sus financiadores de Kiva por ayudarla a crecer. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento en el marco de los pedidos de sus clientes, ella comprará por una parte ropa, y por otro lado, acondicionará mucho mas su sala de belleza, para atraer mas clientes y ofrecerle un ambiente confortable, aprovechando que en su sector no hay servicios de belleza cercanos, lo cual hará de su credikiva una buena inversión.
texts.en:
Thanks to the support Lucila received from a previous Kiva loan, she managed to buy pants, cosmetics, and underwear.  Today her earnings are greater, and so she can now achieve her goal of adding a new business to her usual activities.  This business is providing beauty services through a beauty salon.  This would provide her family with more stability.  

Lucila thanks the Kiva lenders very much for helping her to grow.  At this time, she is applying for a new loan based on the orders of her customers.  She will use part of the loan to buy clothing, and the other part to continue to set up her beauty salon so that she can attract more customers and offer them a comfortable environment, taking advantage of the fact that there are no beauty services available nearby.  This is why this project, financed with a Kiva loan, will be a good investment.

loans.use: to buy clothing and to set up a beauty salon

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.en:
Marie Jeanne is 37 years old. She is married with three children. She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. 

With the profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru:
Фарогат женщина-предприниматель. У нее хорошие исследовательские способности. Ведь не спроста она всегда угадывает потребность людей ее местности, закупается нужными товарами и продает их с выгодой. У нее свой магазинчик дома. Имеет все что нужно для дома и каприза хозяек. Хоз товары, продукты питания, конц-товары, напитки и мороженное...У Фарогат пятилетний стаж в сфере бизнеса. Начинала с малого - закупала товар в малых количествах каждый день. Теперь расширила свой бизнес, и торговые агенты сами приносят некоторые продукты к ее магазину. Можно сказать что ее маленький бизнес и магазинчик способны устоять конкуренции и ее товары всегда найдут своего покупателя. Фарогат планирует купить стоячий холодильник. По ее прогнозам ей нужна дополнительная сумма денег для воплощение своих планов в реальность. Она может их накопить, но упустит момент когда смогла бы заработать больше она не может. Поэтому Фарогат обратилась за кредитом. Очень надеется, что  "Арванд" поможет  ей и она сможет дальше успешно пройти свой предпринимательский путь.
Фарогат любящая мама четырех детей и заботливая жена. Муж находится в миграции и помогает денежными переводами семье. У нее высшее образование. Приобретенные теоретические знание во время учебы в ВУЗ -е помогают ей в продвижении и налаживании её бизнеса. Фарогат заранее поблагодарила всех за содействие и пожелала процветание каждой семье.
texts.en:
Farrogat is a female entrepreneur. She has   good analytical abilities. This is why she is always able to project what kind of wares will be in demand in her region, stocks up on these wares and makes a profit from her sales. She has a small store at her home. She offers everything that is needed for the home and that homemakers may wish for: household goods, groceries, office supplies, beverages, ice cream etc. Farrogat has five years of experience in this business. She started slowly by buying small quantities of goods every day. Now she has expanded her business, and sales agents deliver their merchandise to her store themselves. It can be said that her small vending business is able to  stand up against the competition, and her wares always find buyers. Farrogat plans to buy a vertical refrigerator. She estimates that she needs additional funds to realize these plans. If she were to save up for the purchase, she will lose an opportunity to increase her sales and earn more. This is why Farrogat has applied for a loan. She truly hopes that Arvand will help her and she will be able to continue growing her business successfully.

Farrogat is the loving mother of four and a devoted wife. Her husband is a migrant worker and sends money transfers to help the family. Farrogat has a college degree. The theoretical knowledge acquired during her college years help her develop and manage her business. Farrogat thanks everyone in advance for their support and wishes prosperity for every family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for ice cream

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place durant le second semestre de l’année 2013. Il est composé de  femmes qui ont un idéal de cheminer ensemble. Elles partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide fruit d’un long voisinage, car vivant toutes dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Fatoumata (assise à la cinquième position de la gauche vers la droite), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfant (05 garçons et 01 fille). Elle  s’active dans la vente d’huile végétale, de sucre, de thé vert et divers autres produits de consommations courantes. Elle achète cette marchandise au marché hebdomadaire communal et même parfois dans les marchés hebdomadaires de villages d’un pays frontalier. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir fait depuis plusieurs années.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter un sac de sucre de 50 kg, 03  paquets de thé vert et un sac de riz.

 Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux soutenir son mari dans la gestion des frais de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This group was established during the second half of 2013. It is made up of women who dream of developing [their businesses] together. Having long been neighbors, all of them living in the same village, they share values of interdependence and mutual assistance. Their primary activity is small business and they also farm during the rainy season.

Mrs. Fatoumata (fifth woman seated, left to right [in the photo, hand raised]) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and the mother of six children (five boys and one girl). She sells vegetable oil, sugar, green tea, and various other staples. Mrs. Fatoumata purchases these goods at the local weekly market and sometimes even at weekly markets in the border villages of a neighboring country. She has good experience in this business, since she's been working in it for several years.

With this loan, Mrs. Fatoumata plans to purchase a 50kg sack of sugar, three bags of green tea, and a sack of rice. Her business profits will allow Mrs. Fatoumata to better support her husband in managing their children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a 50kg sack of sugar, three bags of green tea, and one sack of rice.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 46 years old from Oroquieta. She has a retail business selling whole nuts. She has had this business for 10 years and earns well which sufficiently provides for her family.

Rebecca gets her capital needs from PMPC and has recently applied for a loan to buy whole nuts to resell.

In the future, Rebecca hopes to live comfortably with her children who will finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy whole nuts to resell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn's husband is earning from employment as a company driver, while she runs a general store. For many years, she has been earning well to support her husband's income. 

She joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell.  

In the future, she wants to provide a good education to her children and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is single and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Neneth requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothes, such as blouses, dresses, shorts, etc., to sell.

In the future, Neneth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothes, such as blouses, dresses, shorts, etc., to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 49-year-old, married male with five children, all of whom attend school. He is an accountant by profession, in which he has served for 20 years. He also operates a produce business for additional income. Wilson joined the business because of the high demand for produce in his area. 

Wilson wants money to buy more maize to sell this season, although he complains of the taxes he pays from his salary.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Jerebie

texts.en:
Jerebie is 27 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She is a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. Her husband is a driver. She is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Jerebie oversees operations of her and her husband's tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destinations within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP per day. She earns additional income operating a small variety store.

To help Jerebie continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to buy spare parts and accessories and to pay for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. In the future, she hopes that her children finish their education with flying colors. She meets up with her co-fellowship members * to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and pay for maintenance of her tricycle

loans.name: Francisco Fabiel

texts.es: Francisco tiene 49 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de de vida y su hijo de 10 años de edad. Él es un hombre con espíritu emprendedor quien se gana la vida por medio de la venta de huevos, hamacas, plantas, flores y frutas. De esta forma es como mantiene la economía de su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un baño y un pequeño muro al rededor de su vivienda para protegerla del agua cuando llueve. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, lamina, plancha para el baño, etc. Espera poder dar inicio a las mejoras lo antes posibles.
texts.en:
Francisco is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his partner and 10-year-old child. He is an enterprising man, who makes a living selling eggs, hammocks, plants, flowers and fruit. This is how he supports the household.

With the aim of improving his living conditions, he has made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in building a bathroom and a small wall around his home to protect it from the water when it rains. With the amount he is requesting he will buy cement, sand, bricks, metal, sheeting, tiles and other items for the bathroom. He hopes to begin the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, metal, sheeting, tiles for the bathroom, etc.
